- The Democratic Party's official platform document for the 2028 election. 
- Public statements or speeches by the Democratic Party's presidential candidate or party chairperson. 
- Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

If there is ambiguity or dispute over whether AI ethics is a major part of the platform, the question will resolve based on a consensus of expert political analysts from at least three major news organizations.

title: Will the Republican Party retain control of the US House of Representatives after the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, after the 2028 United States House of Representatives elections, the Republican Party holds more seats than any other party.

The determination will be based on the official results published by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or an equivalent authoritative source. If there is any dispute or recount, the resolution will be based on the final certified results. In case of a tie, the question will resolve as No.

Independent or third-party members who caucus with the Republican Party will not be counted as Republican seats.

title: Will France elect a female president by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a female candidate is officially declared the winner of a French presidential election by December 31, 2028. 
The winner must be confirmed by the French Constitutional Council (Conseil constitutionnel) as having received the majority of votes in the final round of the election. 
In the event of a dispute or recount, the resolution will be based on the final decision of the French Constitutional Council. 
If no election is held by the end of 2028, or if a female candidate is not declared the winner by the French Constitutional Council, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will AI-driven technologies significantly change the way baseball is played or managed by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven technologies are officially adopted in Major League Baseball (MLB) or another major baseball league, leading to significant changes in how the game is played or managed. Significant changes are defined as:

- Game Play: AI-driven systems are used to make real-time decisions during games, such as pitch selection, defensive shifts, or player substitutions.
- Training and Strategy: AI systems are used for player training, injury prevention, or strategic planning in a way that fundamentally alters traditional methods.
- Officiating: AI is used for making or assisting in umpiring decisions, such as calling balls and strikes or reviewing plays.

The adoption and implementation of these technologies must be confirmed by an official announcement from the league or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post). The technologies must be in regular use, not in a trial phase or limited to experimental use.

In the event of partial adoption (e.g., only for officiating or only for training), the question will resolve as Yes if the adoption is intended for league-wide implementation. Temporary or one-off uses do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will an AI-related policy or regulation be a significant part of Donald Trump's platform if he runs for office before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Donald Trump runs for any political office and includes an AI-related policy or regulation as a significant part of his platform.

A "significant part" is defined as one that is prominently featured in his campaign materials (e.g., website, speeches, official policy documents) and is covered by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

"AI-related policy or regulation" refers to any official stance or proposal concerning the development, deployment, regulation, or ethical considerations of artificial intelligence technologies.

If Donald Trump does not run for office before January 1, 2028, or if no AI-related policy or regulation is a significant part of his platform, this question resolves as No.

title: Will there be any significant political movements related to funding for biotechnology research in the US by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a notable political movement in the United States specifically advocating for increased or decreased funding for biotechnology research. 

A significant political movement is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Endorsement by a major political party (Democratic or Republican) or a prominent political figure (e.g., a sitting U.S. Senator, Representative, or Governor).
- Introduction of a bill or legislative proposal in the U.S. Congress aimed at altering biotechnology research funding.
- Coverage by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) describing the movement as significant.

The movement must be explicitly focused on biotechnology research funding and not part of a broader initiative. Temporary or minor advocacy efforts do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland implement national regulations for robotics by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland has officially implemented national regulations specifically governing the use, development, or deployment of robotics. The regulations must be enacted by the Swiss Federal Assembly or another relevant national authority. The implementation of these regulations must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The regulations must be in force, not just proposed or in draft form. Regional or local regulations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland hold a national referendum on joining an international alliance by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland holds a national referendum on joining any international alliance. An 'international alliance' is defined as an organization or agreement between multiple countries for mutual benefit, which includes but is not limited to military, economic, or political alliances. 

The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the Swiss Federal Council and announced in an official government publication. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The question resolves as No if no such referendum is held by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled before it takes place.

title: Will the European Union expand to include new member states by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any new member state(s) officially join the European Union. 

A new member state is considered to have joined the European Union if the accession treaty has been signed and ratified by all current EU member states and the candidate country, and the country has officially become a member state as recognized by the European Commission. 

In the event of partial or conditional membership, this question resolves as Yes only if full membership is granted. 

The accession must be confirmed by an official announcement from the European Commission or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the Amazon rainforest experience a significant reduction in area by 2028 due to geopolitical factors?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the total area of the Amazon rainforest is reduced by at least 10% compared to its area as of January 1, 2023, and the reduction is primarily attributed to geopolitical factors.

"Geopolitical factors" refer to actions taken by governments, political entities, or large-scale policies that directly or indirectly lead to deforestation. This includes, but is not limited to:
- Changes in land use policies that favor deforestation.
- Government-sanctioned agricultural expansion.
- Infrastructure projects such as roads, dams, or urban development.
- Political instability leading to uncontrolled deforestation.

The primary source of information will be satellite imagery and deforestation reports from reputable sources such as NASA, the Brazilian National Institute for Space Research (INPE), or other scientific institutions. Confirmation from at least two major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) is required to attribute the reduction to geopolitical factors.

In case of conflicting reports, the consensus view of the scientific community as of the resolution date will be used to determine the outcome. If no significant reduction is observed, or if the reduction is primarily due to non-geopolitical factors (e.g., natural disasters), the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be any major geopolitical events impacting particle physics research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any major geopolitical event significantly impacts particle physics research. 'Major geopolitical event' is defined as:
- A conflict, war, or military action involving at least one major world power (e.g., USA, China, Russia, EU).
- Significant international sanctions or embargoes affecting scientific collaboration or funding.
- Major political upheaval or regime change in a country hosting significant particle physics research facilities (e.g., CERN in Switzerland).

The impact on particle physics research must be verifiable through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post), or official announcements from relevant scientific institutions or government bodies.

Examples of impacts include:
- Suspension or termination of major particle physics experiments or projects.
- Significant delays in research timelines due to geopolitical tensions.
- Loss of funding or resources critical to ongoing particle physics research.

If no such events are reported by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will India become a permanent member of the UN Security Council by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, India becomes a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council.

A permanent member is defined as a country that has been granted permanent membership status with all associated rights and responsibilities, including veto power.

The resolution will be based on official announcements from the United Nations or confirmation from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of such confirmation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Israel sign a formal peace agreement with Saudi Arabia by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Israel and Saudi Arabia sign a formal peace agreement. The agreement must be officially announced and signed by representatives of both countries' governments.

The agreement must include provisions for the normalization of diplomatic relations, which may include but are not limited to the establishment of embassies, exchange of ambassadors, or mutual recognition of sovereignty.

The signing of the agreement must be reported by at least three major reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the majority consensus of these sources.

title: Will Japan conduct a national election that is recognized as free and fair by international observers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Japan conducts a national election that is recognized as free and fair by international observers. The election must be for a national office, such as the House of Representatives or the House of Councillors.

The recognition of the election as free and fair must come from at least two reputable international organizations, such as the United Nations, the European Union, or the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE). Reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the election's free and fair status are also acceptable.

If there are conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the majority consensus of the aforementioned organizations and news sources. In the event of no national election being held by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an electronic voting system be widely adopted in at least 3 countries by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, at least three countries have officially adopted an electronic voting system for national elections.

An "electronic voting system" is defined as a system where votes are cast, recorded, transmitted, and counted using electronic means. This includes, but is not limited to, Direct Recording Electronic (DRE) voting machines, optical scan voting systems, and online voting platforms.

"Widely adopted" means that the system is used in at least 50% of the voting precincts or districts within the country for national elections.

The adoption must be confirmed by official government announcements or documentation from the respective countries. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary or pilot implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major national election be postponed due to a significant event related to soccer by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a major national election in any country is officially postponed due to a significant event related to soccer (football).

A "major national election" is defined as any election for the head of state, head of government, or national legislative body.

A "significant event related to soccer" can include, but is not limited to:
- A major international tournament (e.g., FIFA World Cup, UEFA European Championship) causing logistical or security concerns.
- A national tragedy or disaster occurring during a soccer event, leading to widespread disruption.
- Political or civil unrest directly linked to a soccer event.

The postponement must be confirmed by an official government announcement or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

If multiple elections are postponed, the first confirmed instance will be used for resolution. If no such postponement occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI developed by OpenAI be involved in a major geopolitical decision by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI developed by OpenAI is officially involved in a major geopolitical decision. 

A 'major geopolitical decision' is defined as a decision that significantly affects the political, economic, or military relations between countries or regions. Examples include, but are not limited to, decisions involving international treaties, trade agreements, military actions, or significant diplomatic negotiations. 

The involvement of the AI must be confirmed by an official statement from a government or an authoritative international organization (such as the United Nations, NATO, or the European Union). In the absence of an official statement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The AI must be directly involved in the decision-making process, not merely providing auxiliary support or analysis. In the event of ambiguity, the question will resolve based on the consensus of expert opinions from recognized authorities in AI and geopolitics.

title: Will a major breakthrough in robotics lead to widespread adoption of humanoid robots in households by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, humanoid robots are widely adopted in households in at least three countries, with adoption rates exceeding 5% of households in each of those countries.

A "humanoid robot" is defined as a robot with a human-like appearance (e.g., two arms, two legs, a head) that is capable of performing household tasks such as cleaning, cooking, or providing companionship.

"Widespread adoption" is defined as at least 5% of households in a country owning and regularly using a humanoid robot.

The adoption rates must be confirmed by reputable market research reports or surveys conducted by recognized organizations such as Gartner, Forrester, or the International Federation of Robotics.

In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these sources will be used.

Temporary or trial usage does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Google develop a quantum computer that achieves quantum supremacy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google announces that it has developed a quantum computer that achieves quantum supremacy. "Quantum supremacy" is defined as the ability of a quantum computer to solve a problem that is infeasible for any classical computer to solve within a reasonable timeframe.

The announcement must be accompanied by a peer-reviewed publication or a presentation at a major scientific conference that is recognized by the scientific community. The claim must be independently verified by at least two credible sources within the quantum computing field.

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be sufficient to resolve this question as Yes. If no such announcement or reports are made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant environmental impact due to the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, credible evidence of significant environmental impact due to the Russo-Ukrainian War is reported by at least two of the following organizations: United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), World Health Organization (WHO), or any two of the following major news organizations: BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post.

"Significant environmental impact" is defined as any of the following:
- Measurable long-term damage to ecosystems, such as deforestation, loss of biodiversity, or pollution of water bodies.
- Documented health impacts on the human population due to environmental degradation, such as increased respiratory or waterborne diseases.
- Economic costs exceeding $1 billion USD related to environmental damage, including cleanup and restoration efforts.

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the majority of the aforementioned sources.

title: Will Taiwan experience a major earthquake before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Taiwan experiences a major earthquake that meets the following criteria:

- Magnitude: The earthquake must have a magnitude of 7.0 or higher on the Richter scale.
- Location: The epicenter of the earthquake must be within the geographical boundaries of Taiwan or its territorial waters.
- Confirmation: The earthquake must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: United States Geological Survey (USGS), European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC), or the Central Weather Bureau of Taiwan (CWB).

In the event of multiple earthquakes, the criteria apply to any single earthquake meeting the above conditions.

title: Will an international basketball event lead to significant diplomatic tensions before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, an international basketball event leads to significant diplomatic tensions between two or more countries. 

"Significant diplomatic tensions" are defined as any of the following occurring as a direct result of the basketball event:
- Withdrawal of ambassadors or diplomatic staff.
- Imposition of sanctions or trade restrictions.
- Official government statements condemning the actions of another country related to the event.
- Cancellation of treaties or agreements.

The occurrence of these events must be reported by at least three major reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). 

The basketball event must be an officially recognized international competition involving national teams.

title: Will China develop a quantum computer that achieves quantum supremacy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum computer developed in China achieves quantum supremacy. Quantum supremacy is defined as the demonstration of a quantum computer performing a calculation that is infeasible for any classical computer to perform within a reasonable time frame.

The achievement must be recognized and verified by at least one of the following authoritative sources:
- A peer-reviewed scientific journal publication confirming the quantum supremacy claim.
- An official announcement from a recognized Chinese research institution or government body.
- Reports from at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of a dispute or conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on a consensus among the majority of the aforementioned sources. If no consensus is reached, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Microsoft release a commercially successful quantum computer by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Microsoft releases a quantum computer that meets the following criteria for commercial success:

- The quantum computer must be available for purchase or lease by businesses or consumers.
- The quantum computer must achieve at least $100 million in revenue within the first year of its release.
- The quantum computer must be capable of performing computations that are demonstrably advantageous over classical computers for specific tasks.

Confirmation of these criteria must come from credible sources such as financial reports from Microsoft, industry analysis from reputable firms (e.g., Gartner, IDC), or coverage by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will there be significant advancements in computing technologies in Ukraine by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any of the following criteria are met, indicating significant advancements in computing technologies in Ukraine:
- Establishment of a new high-performance computing (HPC) center or substantial upgrade to an existing one, verified by an official government announcement or documentation from a recognized Ukrainian scientific institution.
- Development and deployment of a quantum computing system within Ukraine, confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
- Introduction of a commercially viable computing technology that is at least 10 times more efficient than current standards, as recognized by a peer-reviewed scientific journal or a major technology conference.

In the event of any ambiguity or dispute, the resolution will be based on consensus from experts in the field, including consultations with recognized academic and industry professionals.

title: Will NATO member countries experience a significant natural disaster causing over $1 billion in damages before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, any NATO member country experiences a natural disaster that causes at least $1 billion in damages (USD).

For the purposes of this question, a 'natural disaster' includes events such as earthquakes, hurricanes, floods, wildfires, and other similar catastrophic occurrences.

The damage assessment must be confirmed by an authoritative source such as the United Nations, World Bank, or a relevant national government agency (e.g., FEMA in the United States).

In the absence of an official damage assessment, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If multiple natural disasters occur, the question will resolve as Yes if any single event meets the $1 billion damage threshold. If no qualifying event occurs, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new geopolitical alliance form in Asia by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new geopolitical alliance is officially formed in Asia. The alliance must meet the following criteria: 
- It must include at least three sovereign countries as members. 
- It must be formalized through a treaty, agreement, or official declaration. 
- The alliance must have a defined purpose, such as economic cooperation, military collaboration, or political partnership. 
- The formation of the alliance must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

In the event of ambiguity, the question will resolve based on the consensus of expert analysis from reputable geopolitical think tanks or academic institutions.

title: Will the geopolitical influence of the US in international sports, such as basketball, increase by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is clear and measurable evidence that the geopolitical influence of the United States in international sports, specifically basketball, has increased. This can be demonstrated through any of the following:

- An increase in the number of US-based players participating in international basketball leagues (such as the EuroLeague) by at least 20% compared to 2023 levels.
- An increase in the number of international basketball teams employing US-based coaches by at least 20% compared to 2023 levels.
- An increase in the number of international basketball tournaments or events hosted in the United States by at least 20% compared to 2023 levels.
- A significant increase in the media coverage and broadcasting rights of US basketball leagues (such as the NBA) in international markets, as reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of official statistics, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used to verify these criteria.

If none of these criteria are met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will quantum computing play a significant role in international espionage by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is credible evidence that quantum computing has been used in international espionage activities. The criteria for credible evidence are:

1. Public Disclosure: Official statements or documents from government agencies (e.g., NSA, GCHQ, FSB) confirming the use of quantum computing in espionage.
2. Major News Reports: Investigative reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) corroborating the use of quantum computing in espionage.
3. Academic or Industry Reports: Publications in peer-reviewed journals or reports from credible cybersecurity firms detailing the use of quantum computing in espionage activities.

The espionage activities must involve the use of quantum computing for tasks such as code-breaking, secure communications interception, or other intelligence-gathering operations. Mere speculation or theoretical discussions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War result in a change of national borders by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there is an official and internationally recognized change in the national borders of either Russia or Ukraine as a direct result of the Russo-Ukrainian War.

The change must be confirmed by at least two of the following sources: United Nations, European Union, NATO, or at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

The change must be permanent and not a temporary occupation or control. Any changes resulting from a mutual agreement, treaty, or armistice will count towards this question's resolution. In the absence of a clear official change, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major political scandal involving a professional golfer emerge in the United Kingdom before 2028?
Will the United Kingdom implement national regulations on the use of robotics in public spaces by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom enacts and implements nationwide regulations specifically addressing the use of robotics in public spaces. 

The regulations must meet the following criteria:

- Be officially enacted by the UK Parliament or relevant regulatory authority and come into effect by the resolution date.
- Specifically address the deployment, operation, and oversight of robotic systems in public spaces, including but not limited to streets, parks, and public transportation.
- Be reported by at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

If only guidelines, recommendations, or non-binding policies are issued, or if the regulations are limited to specific regions or cities without a nationwide scope, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant policy change in the United Kingdom's political landscape by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant policy change is enacted in the United Kingdom's political landscape. A 'significant policy change' is defined as any of the following: - A major shift in economic policy, such as a change in the tax system, introduction of a universal basic income, or a significant change in trade policy. - A substantial reform in the healthcare or education system. - A major change in immigration policy. - A significant amendment or repeal of a major law or set of laws. The policy change must be confirmed through official government documentation or announcements. In the absence of official documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy change must be implemented and not merely proposed or debated. If there is ambiguity about whether a policy change is 'significant,' the resolution will be based on expert analysis from reputable political analysts or institutions.

title: Will biotechnology advancements significantly influence US healthcare policy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is clear and documented evidence that biotechnology advancements have significantly influenced US healthcare policy. "Significantly influenced" means that at least one of the following criteria is met:

- Legislation: The US Congress passes a bill directly related to biotechnology advancements, which is signed into law by the President.
- Executive Action: An executive order or directive is issued by the President specifically addressing biotechnology advancements and their implementation in healthcare.
- Regulatory Changes: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or another relevant federal agency enacts new regulations or guidelines specifically targeting biotechnology advancements in healthcare.
- Major Funding Initiatives: Allocation of substantial federal funding (at least $500 million) towards biotechnology research or implementation in healthcare.

The influence must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or confirmed through official government documentation. In the case of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of credible sources.

title: Will there be any significant changes in election laws in France by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any of the following significant changes to election laws in France are enacted and come into effect:

- Changes to the voting age (either lowering or raising it).
- Introduction or abolition of compulsory voting.
- Major changes to the electoral system (e.g., switching from a two-round system to a proportional representation system).
- Significant changes to voter registration processes or requirements.
- Introduction of new voting methods (e.g., online voting, blockchain voting).

The changes must be confirmed by official government documentation or legislation published in the Journal Officiel de la République Française. In the absence of such documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Le Monde, Le Figaro, AFP, Reuters) are sufficient.

Minor procedural changes or temporary adjustments (e.g., changes due to specific circumstances like a pandemic) do not count towards this question's resolution. The changes must be intended to be permanent or long-term.

title: Will any major tech company, like Microsoft, develop technology that significantly impacts election processes by 2028?
Will there be a major breakthrough in understanding the human genome by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a major breakthrough in understanding the human genome, defined as one of the following:

- Identification of at least 100 previously unknown genes and their functions.
- Discovery of a new mechanism of genetic regulation that significantly alters current understanding.
- Development of a new technique that allows for the precise editing of genes with an accuracy rate of at least 99%.

The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community and reported in at least two peer-reviewed scientific journals. Additionally, the discovery must be covered by at least three major news organizations such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post.

title: Will the US Senate pass a bill significantly impacting information technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the US Senate passes a bill that significantly impacts the information technology (IT) sector. A bill is considered to 'significantly impact' IT if it meets any of the following criteria:

- Introduces new regulations or reforms existing ones that directly affect IT companies' operations, data privacy, cybersecurity, or digital infrastructure.
- Allocates substantial federal funding (at least $1 billion) for IT-related projects, research, or infrastructure.
- Establishes new federal agencies or programs specifically focused on IT or digital innovation.

The bill must be signed into law by the President to count towards this question's resolution. Verification will be based on official government records and announcements. In the absence of such records, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) will be sufficient.

title: Will a third-party candidate win a US Senate seat by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate who is not affiliated with either the Democratic Party or the Republican Party wins a United States Senate seat in any state. The candidate must be officially recognized as a third-party candidate by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or a reputable news organization (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The win must be confirmed by official election results published by the relevant state authority. In the event of a contested election, the final outcome as determined by the appropriate legal and electoral processes will be considered.

title: Will Switzerland implement a national policy on AI ethics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland officially implements a national policy specifically addressing AI ethics. 

The policy must be a formal, government-issued document that outlines ethical guidelines, principles, or regulations for the development, deployment, and use of artificial intelligence technologies within Switzerland. 

The implementation must be confirmed either through an official government announcement or publication in an official government gazette. 

In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice. The policy must be in effect, not merely proposed or under discussion.

title: Will Iran announce a significant breakthrough in AI technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Iran announces a significant breakthrough in artificial intelligence (AI) technology. A 'significant breakthrough' is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- The development of an AI system that achieves performance on par with or superior to state-of-the-art models in a well-established benchmark (e.g., ImageNet for image recognition, GLUE for natural language processing).
- The creation of a novel AI algorithm or architecture that is widely recognized by the global AI research community and cited in peer-reviewed journals or presented at major AI conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR).
- A major advancement in AI applications that leads to substantial improvements in a specific domain (e.g., healthcare, autonomous vehicles, natural disaster prediction) and is covered by reputable international news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The announcement must be made by an official Iranian government entity or a recognized Iranian research institution. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major international news organizations are sufficient to resolve this question as Yes.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a unified AI strategy for member states by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially adopts a unified AI strategy that member states are encouraged or required to follow.

The strategy must be formally documented and publicly accessible, outlining guidelines, principles, or regulations concerning the development, deployment, and governance of artificial intelligence technologies.

The adoption of the strategy must be confirmed through an official UN resolution, announcement, or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The strategy must be comprehensive, addressing multiple aspects of AI such as ethics, safety, privacy, and international cooperation. A partial or draft strategy does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Russia's GDP surpass 2 trillion USD by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Russia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) surpasses 2 trillion USD. The GDP figure must be based on official data released by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank. In the absence of data from these sources, data from Russia's Federal State Statistics Service (Rosstat) will be considered. The GDP must be measured in current US dollars, not adjusted for inflation. If multiple sources report different figures, the highest reported figure will be used for resolution. If no official data is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan achieve a major breakthrough in quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Japan announces a major breakthrough in quantum computing that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Demonstration of a quantum computer with at least 100 qubits that performs a task beyond the capability of classical computers (quantum supremacy).
- Development of a quantum algorithm that significantly outperforms classical algorithms for a specific problem of practical importance.
- Creation of a stable, error-corrected quantum bit (qubit) that demonstrates prolonged coherence times and low error rates, making it viable for scalable quantum computing.

The breakthrough must be confirmed by an official announcement from a reputable Japanese research institution, government body, or major corporation involved in quantum computing (e.g., RIKEN, NTT, Toshiba).
In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If no such breakthrough is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will OpenAI release a new AI model that surpasses human-level intelligence by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, OpenAI releases a new AI model that is widely recognized as surpassing human-level intelligence (HLI). For the purposes of this question, 'surpassing human-level intelligence' means the AI model demonstrates general intelligence across a wide range of tasks at a level that is consistently superior to that of the best human experts in those fields.

The AI model must meet the following criteria:

- General Intelligence: The AI must perform at or above human expert level across a wide variety of tasks, including but not limited to problem-solving, learning, understanding complex concepts, and adapting to new situations.
- Recognition: The AI's capabilities must be recognized by a consensus of AI researchers and experts, with endorsements from at least three reputable sources, such as peer-reviewed journals, major AI conferences, or leading AI research institutions.
- Independent Verification: The AI's performance must be independently verified by at least two separate and credible organizations or research groups.

The question will resolve as No if these criteria are not met by the resolution date.

title: Will the United States implement a nationwide policy on AI ethics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States federal government officially implements a nationwide policy addressing AI ethics. The policy must include guidelines or regulations on at least three of the following areas:
- Transparency and Explainability
- Fairness and Non-Discrimination
- Privacy and Data Protection
- Accountability and Governance
- Safety and Security

The policy must be enacted through legislation signed by the President or through an executive order. Confirmation of the policy's implementation must come from an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters) are sufficient. Temporary or trial policies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States implement a nationwide AI regulation framework by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States has officially implemented a nationwide regulatory framework specifically governing the development, deployment, and use of artificial intelligence technologies.

The regulatory framework must include, at a minimum, guidelines or rules addressing the following aspects:
- Ethical considerations and responsible AI use
- Data privacy and security
- Transparency and explainability of AI systems
- Accountability and liability for AI-driven decisions

The implementation must be confirmed through an official government announcement or publication in the Federal Register. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient.

The framework must be nationwide, covering all states, and not limited to specific sectors or temporary measures. If the framework is implemented in stages, it must be clear that the intention is for comprehensive nationwide coverage.

title: Will Donald Trump publicly endorse an AI research initiative by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Donald Trump publicly endorses an AI research initiative. A public endorsement is defined as a clear and explicit statement of support made by Donald Trump, either through his official social media accounts, public speeches, interviews, or press releases.

The endorsement must specifically mention support for an AI research initiative, which can include projects, organizations, or policies aimed at advancing artificial intelligence research. General statements supporting AI without reference to a specific initiative do not count.

The endorsement must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) to be considered valid.

In the event of ambiguity or dispute, the resolution will be based on the consensus of reputable news sources and expert analysis.

title: Will AI-driven technology be used to assist referees in major soccer tournaments by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven technology is officially used to assist referees in at least one major soccer tournament. Major soccer tournaments are defined as the FIFA World Cup, UEFA European Championship, Copa America, or any equivalent tournament organized by a recognized continental football federation. The AI-driven technology must be used in real-time decision-making during matches and should be acknowledged by the tournament's official governing body. Use of AI-driven technology in trials, friendly matches, or unofficial tournaments does not count. Confirmation must come from an official announcement by the governing body of the tournament or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the United States lead in the number of Nobel Prizes in Natural Sciences by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States has been awarded more Nobel Prizes in the Natural Sciences (Physics, Chemistry, and Physiology or Medicine) than any other country for the years 2024 through 2028. The Nobel Prizes considered will be those announced by the Nobel Assembly and listed on the official Nobel Prize website (nobelprize.org). In the event of a tie in the number of Nobel Prizes awarded, the question will resolve as No. Prizes awarded to organizations or international collaborations will not be counted towards any country's total.

title: Will there be a significant scientific discovery related to the Amazon rainforest by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant scientific discovery related to the Amazon rainforest is announced and recognized by the scientific community. A 'significant scientific discovery' is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Discovery of a new species of flora or fauna that has a substantial impact on biological science.
- Identification of a previously unknown ecological process or interaction within the Amazon rainforest ecosystem.
- Discovery of new medicinal compounds derived from Amazonian plants or organisms that show promise in treating diseases or medical conditions.
- Significant advancements in the understanding of the Amazon rainforest's role in global climate regulation.

The discovery must be officially recognized by reputable scientific organizations or published in peer-reviewed scientific journals. Reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the discovery are also sufficient for resolution.

In case of multiple discoveries, the first one to meet the criteria will be considered for resolution. If no such discovery is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Switzerland hold a national referendum on joining the European Union before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Switzerland holds a national referendum specifically on the issue of joining the European Union.

The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the Swiss Federal Council or the Swiss Federal Assembly. The question must explicitly ask whether Switzerland should join the European Union. Referendums on related but distinct issues, such as closer ties with the EU or joining specific EU programs, do not count.

Confirmation of the referendum must come from an official announcement by the Swiss government or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of ambiguity, the question will be resolved based on the consensus of reputable sources.

title: Will the US government implement significant regulations on major technology companies by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the US government implements significant regulations targeting major technology companies. 

"Significant regulations" are defined as new laws or regulations that meet at least one of the following criteria:
- Require major technology companies to change their business practices in a substantial way (e.g., altering data privacy practices, content moderation policies, or antitrust measures).
- Impose fines or penalties exceeding $1 billion collectively on major technology companies for regulatory non-compliance.
- Mandate the breakup or structural reorganization of one or more major technology companies.

"Major technology companies" are defined as those with a market capitalization of at least $100 billion as of the date of the regulation's implementation.

The implementation of these regulations must be confirmed by official government documentation or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

title: Will there be a significant advancement in computational methods for analyzing baseball statistics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there is a significant advancement in computational methods for analyzing baseball statistics, as evidenced by at least one of the following:
- Publication of a peer-reviewed paper in a reputable journal (e.g., Journal of Quantitative Analysis in Sports) detailing a novel computational method that significantly improves predictive accuracy or insights in baseball statistics.
- Adoption of a new computational method by at least three Major League Baseball (MLB) teams that leads to measurable improvements in performance metrics (e.g., player performance, game outcomes).
- Recognition of the advancement by a major sports analytics conference (e.g., MIT Sloan Sports Analytics Conference) as a groundbreaking development in the field.

The advancement must be acknowledged by credible sources, such as peer-reviewed journals, official MLB announcements, or major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

title: Will Amazon face antitrust actions from the European Union before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the European Union initiates formal antitrust proceedings against Amazon. 

'Antitrust actions' are defined as formal legal actions taken by the European Union's regulatory bodies aimed at investigating or prosecuting Amazon for alleged violations of competition laws. 

The initiation of such actions must be confirmed by an official announcement from the European Commission or other relevant EU regulatory bodies. Alternatively, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if no such formal antitrust proceedings are initiated by the specified date.

title: Will any new international regulations on medicine be implemented by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any new international regulations on medicine are officially implemented. 'International regulations' are defined as rules or standards adopted by an international body or organization (e.g., World Health Organization, United Nations) that are intended to be followed by multiple countries. The implementation must be confirmed by official documentation from the relevant international body or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The regulations must be new and not merely amendments or extensions of existing regulations.

title: Will the conflict in Ukraine significantly influence any major country's election outcomes before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the conflict in Ukraine is cited as a significant influence on the outcome of a major country's election by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

A "major country" is defined as any of the G7 nations (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States).

"Significant influence" means that the conflict in Ukraine is mentioned as a key factor affecting voter behavior, election results, or political campaigns by the news organizations.

The question resolves as NO if these criteria are not met by the resolution date.

title: Will the NBA expand to include a team from outside North America by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the NBA formally announces the inclusion of a new team from a country outside of North America (defined as Canada, the United States, and Mexico).

The announcement must come from an official NBA source, such as a press release on the NBA's official website or a statement from a high-ranking NBA official (e.g., the NBA Commissioner).

The team must be officially scheduled to participate in the NBA regular season games. Mere discussions, proposals, or intentions to expand do not count towards this question's resolution.

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) confirming the expansion will suffice.

title: Will the MLB host a regular season game in a new country by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Major League Baseball (MLB) hosts a regular season game in a country where no regular season MLB game has been played before, by December 31, 2028. The game must be an official regular season game, not a pre-season or exhibition game. Confirmation must come from an official MLB announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will Spain achieve a significant scientific breakthrough in the field of natural sciences by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a scientific breakthrough in the field of natural sciences is achieved in Spain and meets the following criteria:

- The breakthrough must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, which can be evidenced by publication in a high-impact peer-reviewed scientific journal (e.g., Nature, Science, Cell).
- The breakthrough must originate from research primarily conducted by scientists affiliated with a Spanish institution.
- The breakthrough should lead to a substantial advancement in understanding, technology, or methodology within the natural sciences (e.g., biology, chemistry, physics, earth sciences).

Confirmation of the breakthrough can also come from authoritative sources such as major scientific organizations (e.g., National Academy of Sciences, Royal Society) or reputable news outlets (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria. If no such breakthrough is recognized by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new black hole be discovered by scientists by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a new black hole is discovered by scientists and meets the following criteria:

- The discovery is confirmed through observational data or indirect evidence by a recognized scientific authority such as NASA, ESA, or a major astronomical observatory.
- The discovery is published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or announced at a major scientific conference.
- The black hole must be a new discovery, not a reclassification or reinterpretation of previously known data.

In case of multiple discoveries, the resolution will be based on the date of the official announcement of the first discovery.

title: Will Israel develop a quantum computer with more than 100 qubits by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Israel develops a quantum computer with a qubit count exceeding 100.

The quantum computer must meet the following criteria:
- The qubits must be functional and capable of maintaining coherence for a time period sufficient to perform a computation.
- The quantum computer must be capable of running a quantum algorithm demonstrating entanglement and superposition with more than 100 qubits.

Verification of the quantum computer’s capabilities must come from an official announcement by an Israeli government agency or a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

This question resolves as NO if these criteria are not met by the resolution date.

title: Will quantum computing be used to develop new treatments or drugs by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, quantum computing technology is used to develop new treatments or drugs that meet the following criteria:

- The treatment or drug must be a novel development, not a minor modification of an existing one.
- The development must be directly attributed to the use of quantum computing in the research and development process.
- The treatment or drug must receive approval from a major regulatory body such as the FDA (U.S. Food and Drug Administration), EMA (European Medicines Agency), or an equivalent authority in another country.

The use of quantum computing must be confirmed through credible sources, including scientific publications, official announcements from pharmaceutical companies, or reports from reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, etc.).

In case of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on the consensus of experts in the fields of quantum computing and pharmaceuticals.

title: Will the Republican Party (US) advocate for major changes in cybersecurity policies by 2028?
Will Germany increase its military spending to 2% of its GDP by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Germany's military spending reaches or exceeds 2% of its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for that year. The determination will be based on official data released by the German Federal Statistical Office (Destatis) or confirmed by reputable international organizations such as NATO or the World Bank. If there are discrepancies between sources, the data from Destatis will take precedence. This question resolves as NO if the spending does not reach 2% by the specified date.

title: Will there be a significant geopolitical event involving Google before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a significant geopolitical event involving Google occurs. A 'significant geopolitical event' is defined as one that meets any of the following criteria:

- Official Sanctions or Fines: Google is subject to official sanctions or fines by a government or international body exceeding $1 billion.
- Legislation: New legislation is passed specifically targeting Google's operations, data practices, or market behavior, significantly impacting its business model.
- International Dispute: Google is at the center of a diplomatic dispute between two or more countries, leading to official government statements or actions.
- Major Cyber Incident: Google is involved in a major cyber incident attributed to or involving a nation-state actor, confirmed by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

The event must be reported by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or confirmed by an official government or international body.

title: Will DeepMind's AI achieve a significant breakthrough in general AI by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, DeepMind announces and demonstrates a significant breakthrough in general artificial intelligence (AGI) that meets the following criteria:

- The AGI system can perform a wide range of tasks that require human-like cognitive abilities, including but not limited to natural language understanding and generation, problem-solving, learning, and adaptation across different domains without task-specific programming.
- The breakthrough must be recognized by at least three major credible sources such as academic publications, peer-reviewed journals, or reports from reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The AGI system must pass at least one established benchmark or test for general intelligence, such as the Turing Test, and be publicly demonstrated to do so.

In the absence of a public demonstration, credible reports from at least three major news organizations will be considered sufficient to resolve this question as Yes. If no such breakthrough is announced and demonstrated by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) propose significant legislation regulating AI by 2028?
body:
This question resolves as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Democratic Party in the United States proposes significant legislation aimed at regulating artificial intelligence (AI).

"Significant legislation" is defined as a bill or set of bills introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate that specifically targets the regulation of AI technologies, including but not limited to:
- Ethical guidelines for AI development and deployment
- Data privacy and security measures related to AI
- Accountability and transparency requirements for AI systems
- Funding for AI research and development with regulatory frameworks

The proposal must be formally introduced and documented in the Congressional Record. In the event of multiple bills, the question resolves as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria. Reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the introduction of such legislation are also acceptable as evidence.

If no such legislation is proposed by the resolution date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will the US Senate see a significant shift in party control after the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, after the 2028 elections, the party control of the US Senate changes significantly. A significant shift is defined as:

- A change in the majority party (e.g., from Democratic to Republican or vice versa).
- A shift of at least 10 seats in favor of one party, regardless of whether it changes the majority.

The outcome will be determined based on the official results reported by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or an equivalent authoritative source. In the absence of official results, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

Special elections and interim appointments will be considered if they occur before the resolution date. The resolution date is set to the end of the calendar year in which the elections take place.

title: Will a member state leave the European Union before the end of 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, an official and legally binding declaration of intent to leave the European Union is made by a member state government. The declaration must be formally submitted to the European Council in accordance with Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union. The question will resolve as No if no such declaration is made by the resolution date. In case of ambiguity, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used to resolve the question.

title: Will Japan become a global leader in AI ethics and governance by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Japan is recognized as a global leader in AI ethics and governance. The recognition must come from at least two of the following sources:
- Official statements or publications by international organizations such as the United Nations, OECD, or the European Union.
- Rankings or reports by reputable think tanks or research institutions specializing in AI and technology ethics, such as the AI Ethics Lab, Future of Humanity Institute, or the World Economic Forum.
- Credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that explicitly identify Japan as a global leader in AI ethics and governance.

The term "global leader" refers to a country that sets influential policies, guidelines, or standards widely adopted or respected internationally. This includes leadership in creating ethical frameworks, regulatory measures, and international collaborations or agreements related to AI ethics and governance.

title: Will there be a significant discovery in the field of Biology related to CRISPR technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a significant discovery in the field of Biology related to CRISPR technology that meets the following criteria:

- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- Widely recognized as significant by the scientific community, as evidenced by citations, coverage in major scientific news outlets (e.g., Nature, Science, Cell), or endorsements from leading experts in the field.
- Demonstrates a novel application, advancement, or understanding of CRISPR technology.

Examples of significant discoveries may include, but are not limited to:
- New therapeutic applications for genetic diseases.
- Major improvements in CRISPR efficiency or specificity.
- Novel CRISPR-based techniques for gene editing.

In the event of multiple discoveries, the resolution will be based on the earliest discovery that meets the criteria.

title: Will a new fundamental particle be discovered in Physics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a new fundamental particle is discovered and meets the following criteria:

- The particle must be confirmed through experimental evidence and peer-reviewed publication.
- The discovery must be recognized by the scientific community, specifically by organizations such as CERN or a major physics journal (e.g., Physical Review Letters, Journal of High Energy Physics).
- The particle must be distinct from previously known particles in the Standard Model or any established extensions of the Standard Model.

In the event of a disputed discovery, the resolution will be based on a consensus within the scientific community or a formal recognition by a major scientific body.

title: Will Canada implement a nationwide policy to protect at least 30% of its natural habitats by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Canada implements a nationwide policy that legally protects at least 30% of its natural habitats. 

The policy must be officially enacted through federal legislation or regulation. 

The protected natural habitats must include a mix of terrestrial, freshwater, and marine areas. 

Confirmation of the policy's implementation must come from an official government announcement or documentation, or be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., CBC, The Globe and Mail, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times). 

Temporary protections, pilot programs, or regional policies that do not cover the entire nation will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new medical breakthrough in the treatment of Alzheimer's disease be announced before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a new medical breakthrough in the treatment of Alzheimer's disease is announced and meets the following criteria:

- The breakthrough must be publicly announced by a reputable medical or scientific organization, such as the World Health Organization (WHO), the National Institutes of Health (NIH), or a major medical university or research institution.
- The breakthrough must demonstrate significant improvement in the treatment or management of Alzheimer's disease, as evidenced by peer-reviewed clinical trials or studies published in reputable medical journals (e.g., The Lancet, JAMA, NEJM).
- The breakthrough must be recognized as such by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the first to be announced and meet the above criteria will be considered for resolution. Incremental improvements or modifications to existing treatments do not count unless they result in a significant change in the standard of care for Alzheimer's patients.

title: Will Switzerland introduce new political reforms to address climate change by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland enacts new political reforms specifically aimed at addressing climate change. 

"Political reforms" are defined as new laws, regulations, or policies officially adopted by the Swiss Federal Assembly or through a national referendum. 

The reforms must explicitly mention climate change mitigation or adaptation in their text and demonstrate a clear intent to address climate-related issues.

Confirmation of the enactment must come from an official government announcement or publication in the Swiss Federal Gazette. 
In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If multiple reforms are introduced, at least one must meet the above criteria for the question to resolve as Yes.

Temporary measures or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will California implement state-level regulations on artificial intelligence by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, California enacts state-level regulations specifically targeting the development, deployment, or use of artificial intelligence (AI) technologies. 

Such regulations must be signed into law by the Governor of California and must explicitly address AI technologies. 

The regulations can include, but are not limited to, areas such as data privacy, algorithmic transparency, ethical AI usage, or AI safety standards. 

The enactment must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). 

If the regulations are part of a broader technology or data privacy law, they must still contain specific provisions directly addressing AI. 

In the absence of explicit AI regulations, this question resolves as No.

title: Will China hold a national election before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, China holds a national election in which citizens can vote for the country's head of state or head of government. 

The election must meet the following criteria:
- Be officially sanctioned by the Chinese government as a national election.
- Allow for the participation of multiple candidates or parties.
- Be reported by at least three major international news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

If the election is annulled or deemed illegitimate by international observers such as the United Nations or the European Union, this question will resolve as No.

In the event of partial or regional elections, the question will resolve as No unless these elections are part of a phased national election process officially recognized by the Chinese government.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a significant election reform legislation by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the US House of Representatives passes a significant election reform legislation.

"Significant election reform legislation" is defined as a bill that introduces substantial changes to federal election laws or procedures. This can include, but is not limited to:
- Changes to voter registration processes
- Changes to voting methods or technologies
- Changes to redistricting procedures
- Measures to enhance election security and integrity
- Measures to expand or restrict voting rights

The passage of the legislation must be confirmed by official records from the US House of Representatives or reputable news sources such as the New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, or Reuters.

In the event of multiple bills being passed, the resolution will consider the first bill that meets the criteria.

If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will the European Union implement a significant policy to reduce carbon emissions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements a policy aimed at significantly reducing carbon emissions. A policy is considered 'significant' if it meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Mandates a reduction in carbon emissions by at least 40% from 1990 levels.
- Introduces a carbon pricing mechanism (e.g., carbon tax or cap-and-trade system) covering at least 70% of EU carbon emissions.
- Implements regulations or incentives that lead to a measurable reduction in carbon emissions by at least 30% from current levels.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official EU announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be enacted and not merely proposed or under discussion. Temporary measures or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States achieve a significant increase in renewable energy usage by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States achieves a significant increase in renewable energy usage, defined as meeting either of the following criteria:

- Renewable energy sources (wind, solar, hydro, geothermal, and biomass) account for at least 35% of the total energy consumption in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA).
- There is at least a 50% increase in the total energy generated from renewable sources compared to the levels reported in 2023, according to the EIA.

The data must be published by the EIA or corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In case of discrepancies, the most conservative estimate will be used. Temporary spikes due to extraordinary events (e.g., natural disasters) will not be considered.

title: Will Switzerland make a major scientific breakthrough in climate change research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Switzerland achieves a scientific breakthrough in climate change research that meets the following criteria:

- The breakthrough must be recognized as significant by at least two major scientific organizations or institutions specializing in climate science, such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH Zurich).
- The breakthrough must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.
- The breakthrough must contribute substantially to the understanding, mitigation, or adaptation strategies related to climate change.

This question resolves as NO if no such breakthrough is recognized and published by the resolution date.

title: Will robotics technology be used to conduct voting processes in any country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, robotics technology is used to conduct voting processes in any country. 

Robotics technology refers to automated systems, machines, or robots capable of performing tasks typically carried out by humans. The use of such technology must be officially sanctioned by the country’s electoral authority and publicly announced. 

The robotic system must be involved in at least one of the following aspects of the voting process:
- Voter registration
- Ballot distribution or collection
- Vote tallying
- Voter identification and authentication
