The deployment of robotics technology must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a baseball player run for a major political office in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a person who has played at least one Major League Baseball (MLB) game runs for a major political office in the United States. 'Major political office' is defined as:
- President or Vice President of the United States
- U.S. Senator
- U.S. Representative
- Governor of a U.S. state

The candidacy must be officially declared and recognized by the relevant election authority. Independent runs, as well as those affiliated with a political party, are eligible. The question resolves as No if no such candidacy is declared by the resolution date.

title: Will China achieve a breakthrough in renewable energy technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, China announces and demonstrates a renewable energy technology that meets at least one of the following criteria:
- Increases the efficiency of solar panels by at least 50% compared to 2023 standards.
- Reduces the cost of wind energy production by at least 30% compared to 2023 standards.
- Introduces a new form of renewable energy that is adopted for commercial use and recognized by at least three major scientific or engineering organizations (e.g., IEEE, IEA, or a major university).

The demonstration must be confirmed by an official Chinese government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The technology must be operational and not merely theoretical or in the prototype stage. Temporary pilot projects or limited trials do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant discovery in the field of quantum mechanics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant discovery in the field of quantum mechanics is announced and recognized by the scientific community. A "significant discovery" is defined as one that meets the following criteria:

- The discovery must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.
- The discovery must be recognized as significant by at least two authoritative scientific organizations, such as the American Physical Society (APS) and the European Physical Society (EPS).
- The discovery must lead to a substantial advancement in the understanding of quantum mechanics or result in a new application of quantum mechanical principles.

In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one discovery meets the above criteria. If no discovery meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US dollar experience a significant devaluation before the 2028 US presidential election?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the US dollar experiences a significant devaluation, defined as a decrease of at least 15% in its trade-weighted value against a basket of major world currencies (including but not limited to the Euro, Yen, Pound Sterling, and Yuan) as measured by the Federal Reserve's Broad Trade-Weighted Dollar Index.

The devaluation must be confirmed by official data from the Federal Reserve or, in the absence of such data, by credible reports from at least three major financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters).

Temporary fluctuations that do not persist for at least one month do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of conflicting data or interpretations, the consensus of the majority of the aforementioned news organizations will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will China implement a nationwide AI-driven surveillance system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, China has officially implemented a nationwide surveillance system driven by artificial intelligence. The system must include real-time facial recognition capabilities and be operational across the majority of public spaces in the country. 

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The system must be fully operational, not in a trial phase. Temporary deployments for specific events or the use of similar technology in private spaces do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a partial deployment, the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for nationwide expansion.

title: Will the Liberal Party win the most seats in the Canadian federal election in 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Liberal Party wins the most seats in the Canadian federal election held in 2028. The number of seats won by each party will be determined based on the official results announced by Elections Canada. In the event of a tie, where the Liberal Party and another party win an equal number of seats, the question will resolve as No. If the election is delayed or postponed beyond 2028, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Ukraine hold a presidential election deemed free and fair by international observers before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Ukraine holds a presidential election that is deemed free and fair by major international observers.

"Free and fair" means that the election process, including campaigning, voting, and counting, adheres to democratic standards without significant irregularities or coercion. 

The assessment must come from at least two of the following organizations: the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE), the European Union (EU), the United Nations (UN), or reputable non-governmental organizations such as Human Rights Watch or the Carter Center.

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of these organizations.

title: Will Amazon announce a candidate for a major political office in the US before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2029, Amazon officially announces that it is running a candidate for a major political office in the United States. 

"Major political office" is defined as any of the following: President, Vice President, U.S. Senator, or Governor. 

The announcement must come from an official Amazon communication channel, such as a press release, official company blog, or a verified Amazon social media account. 

Reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the announcement will also be sufficient for a Yes resolution. 

If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a current or former NBA player run for a significant political office in the US by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a current or former NBA (National Basketball Association) player officially runs for a significant political office in the United States. 

"Significant political office" is defined as any of the following:
- President or Vice President of the United States
- U.S. Senator
- U.S. Representative
- Governor of a U.S. state
- Mayor of a city with a population of at least 100,000 according to the most recent U.S. Census data

The candidacy must be officially announced and covered by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

title: Will North Korea hold a multi-party election before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, North Korea holds an election in which candidates from more than one political party are allowed to run for office in a competitive manner. 

The election must meet the following criteria:
- Multiple political parties must be legally allowed to participate and field candidates.
- Voters must have a genuine choice between candidates from different political parties.
- The election must be for a national-level office (e.g., President, Supreme Leader, or members of the Supreme People's Assembly).
- The election must be confirmed by reputable international news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or recognized international election monitoring bodies (e.g., United Nations, OSCE).

In the event of government-staged or non-competitive elections, or if only candidates from a single party or government-approved parties are allowed to run, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Germany implement online voting in national elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Germany officially implements online voting for its national elections.
'Online voting' is defined as a system that allows eligible voters to cast their votes over the internet using electronic devices.
The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
The system must be operational and used in at least one national election by the resolution date. Temporary or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will any new voting technology be developed and widely adopted in national elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new voting technology is both developed and widely adopted for use in national elections in any country.

"New voting technology" is defined as a system or method for casting, counting, or verifying votes that was not in widespread use as of January 1, 2023.

"Widely adopted" means that the new technology is used by at least 30% of the eligible voters in the national election of the country adopting it.

The adoption and use of the new voting technology must be confirmed by official government reports or documentation. In the absence of official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event of partial adoption (e.g., limited to specific regions or states within a country), the question will resolve as Yes if the usage meets the 30% threshold of eligible voters in the national election.

Temporary or pilot implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a Major League Baseball (MLB) team use AI to assist in game strategy decisions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any Major League Baseball (MLB) team officially uses artificial intelligence (AI) to assist in game strategy decisions during regular season or postseason games.

The AI must be used in real-time to make or recommend strategic decisions such as player substitutions, pitching changes, or defensive alignments. The use of AI must be confirmed by an official statement from the MLB team or the league itself. In the absence of an official statement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) are sufficient.

The AI must be more than a statistical analysis tool; it must actively contribute to decision-making during games. Use of AI solely for scouting, training, or injury prevention does not count towards this question's resolution.

In the event of partial or trial use, the question will resolve as Yes if the AI is intended for ongoing use in game strategy decisions.

title: Will the US dollar be fully integrated into a blockchain-based financial system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the US dollar is fully integrated into a blockchain-based financial system that meets the following criteria:

- The blockchain-based financial system must be officially recognized and regulated by the US government.
- The system must support the issuance, transfer, and storage of US dollars directly on a blockchain, without the need for intermediaries.
- The system must be used for at least 10% of all US dollar transactions, as measured by transaction volume or value, over a continuous 30-day period.
- The integration must be confirmed by an official announcement from the US Department of the Treasury or the Federal Reserve, or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The system must be operational and not in a trial or pilot phase.

In the absence of such confirmation, this question resolves as No.

title: Will Russia develop a quantum computer that surpasses 100 qubits by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Russia develops a quantum computer that surpasses 100 qubits. The following criteria must be met:
- The quantum computer must be officially announced by the Russian government or a reputable Russian scientific institution.
- The quantum computer must be operational and its qubit count independently verified by at least two reputable sources, such as peer-reviewed scientific journals or major international conferences.
- The quantum computer must demonstrate practical computation or problem-solving capabilities beyond experimental setups.

If these conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in black hole simulation algorithms by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant breakthrough in black hole simulation algorithms is announced and meets the following criteria:

- Performance Improvement: The new algorithm must demonstrate at least a 10-fold improvement in computational efficiency or accuracy compared to the best existing algorithms as of 2023.
- Peer-Reviewed Publication: The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.
- Independent Verification: The results must be independently verified by at least two separate research groups, each from different institutions.

The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community as a substantial advancement in the field of black hole simulations. In the absence of such recognition, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a major European Union country experience a significant cyber attack by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a major European Union country experiences a significant cyber attack that meets the following criteria:

- The cyber attack must disrupt critical infrastructure or services, such as power grids, transportation systems, healthcare services, financial systems, or government operations.
- The attack must be confirmed by the affected country's government through an official statement or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The disruption caused by the attack must last for at least 24 hours or result in significant economic loss, data breach, or operational downtime.
- The term "major European Union country" refers to any EU member state with a GDP exceeding $500 billion USD as of the most recent World Bank data.

In the event of multiple cyber attacks, the question will resolve as Yes if any single attack meets the above criteria. If no such attack occurs, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United States impose new major economic sanctions on a foreign country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States officially imposes new major economic sanctions on a foreign country. The sanctions must be announced through an official government channel, such as the U.S. Department of State or the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC).

"Major economic sanctions" are defined as measures that significantly restrict trade, investment, or financial transactions with the targeted country and are expected to have a substantial impact on the country's economy. This includes, but is not limited to, broad trade embargoes, significant restrictions on financial institutions, or comprehensive asset freezes.

The imposition of sanctions must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). Sanctions that are minor, targeted only at specific individuals, or symbolic in nature do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Canada establish a new national park by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Government of Canada officially establishes a new national park. 

"Establishes" is defined as the formal designation and creation of a national park through legislation or an official government decree. 

The establishment must be publicly announced by the Parks Canada Agency or a relevant governmental body. 

In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, National Post, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The national park must be intended for long-term preservation and public use, not a temporary designation or a reclassification of an existing park.

title: Will there be a significant environmental policy change in Iran by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Iranian government officially enacts and implements a new environmental policy that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Nationwide regulations or laws aimed at significantly reducing air or water pollution.
- Establishment of protected areas or wildlife reserves covering at least 5% of the country's land area.
- Implementation of renewable energy projects that contribute to at least 10% of the national energy grid.

The policy change must be confirmed through official government announcements, legal documentation, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

Temporary measures, pilot programs, or policies that are not enforced do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland hold a national referendum on electoral reform by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland holds a national referendum specifically focused on electoral reform. 

"Electoral reform" is defined as any proposed change to the electoral system used to elect representatives at the national level. This includes, but is not limited to, changes in voting methods, districting, or the structure of the electoral process.

The referendum must be officially sanctioned and recognized by the Swiss Federal Council. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the event.

If the referendum is postponed or canceled, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any country introduce a voting system that includes an option for online voting by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any country officially introduces a voting system that includes an option for online voting in national elections.

The introduction must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The system must be available for use by the general population and not limited to specific groups (e.g., expatriates, military personnel).

In the event of a pilot or trial program, the question will resolve as Yes if the program is intended for full implementation in subsequent national elections. Temporary or one-time use does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Democratic Party secure a majority in the US Congress in the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, following the 2028 United States congressional elections, the Democratic Party holds a majority of seats in both the House of Representatives and the Senate. 

A majority is defined as holding more than 50% of the seats in each chamber. 

The resolution will be based on the official election results as certified by the Federal Election Commission (FEC). 

In the event of contested results or recounts, the resolution will be based on the final certified results. If no majority is secured in either chamber, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be any significant advancements in the use of robotics for election processes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there are significant advancements in the use of robotics in election processes, as evidenced by at least one of the following criteria:

1. Deployment of robots in polling stations for tasks such as voter identification, ballot distribution, or vote counting, confirmed by official government documentation or announcements.
2. Use of robots in the logistics of election processes, such as the secure transportation of ballots, as confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
3. Implementation of robotic systems for ensuring election security, such as surveillance or threat detection, with confirmation from reputable sources as mentioned above.

The term "significant advancements" is defined as the widespread adoption or official implementation of robotic systems that enhance the efficiency, security, or accuracy of election processes. Temporary trials or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the majority consensus of credible sources.

title: Will NATO member countries adopt a unified cybersecurity protocol by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, NATO member countries officially adopt a unified cybersecurity protocol that meets the following criteria:

- The protocol must be formally agreed upon and documented in an official NATO publication or announcement.
- The protocol must be designed to be implemented across all NATO member countries.
- The protocol must cover key aspects of cybersecurity, including but not limited to threat detection, incident response, information sharing, and defense against cyber-attacks.
- The adoption of the protocol must be confirmed by an official NATO statement or documentation. In the absence of an official statement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event of partial adoption (e.g., by a subset of NATO members), the question will resolve as Yes if the protocol is intended for eventual implementation by all NATO member countries.

title: Will there be any significant advancements in NBA-related sports science by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, at least one of the following significant advancements in NBA-related sports science is reported and verified by reputable sources (e.g., peer-reviewed journals, official NBA announcements, major news organizations such as ESPN, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post):
- Injury Prevention: Development and implementation of new scientifically-proven methods or technologies that significantly reduce the incidence of common injuries (e.g., ACL tears, concussions) among NBA players.
- Performance Enhancement: Introduction of new scientifically-backed training or recovery techniques that lead to a measurable and significant improvement in player performance metrics (e.g., shooting accuracy, endurance, speed) across the league.
- Health Monitoring: Deployment of advanced health monitoring systems or wearables that provide real-time data and predictive analytics, resulting in improved player health and performance.

The advancements must be widely adopted within the NBA and demonstrate clear, measurable benefits. Verification must come from at least two reputable sources, including peer-reviewed publications or official NBA reports. In the event of conflicting information, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the majority of reputable sources.

title: Will CRISPR technology lead to a major biotechnological advancement by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, CRISPR technology leads to a major biotechnological advancement. A 'major biotechnological advancement' is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- FDA or EMA approval of a CRISPR-based therapy for a previously untreatable or incurable disease.
- Commercial availability of a CRISPR-based product that significantly enhances agricultural yield or pest resistance.
- Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of a CRISPR-based technique that is widely recognized by the scientific community as a breakthrough in biotechnology.

The advancement must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or confirmed by an official announcement from a recognized authority (e.g., FDA, EMA, major scientific organization).

title: Will Russia develop an AI system that surpasses GPT-4 in natural language processing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, an AI system developed primarily by Russian entities surpasses GPT-4 in natural language processing capabilities. The AI system must meet or exceed GPT-4 in the following criteria:
- Performance on standardized benchmarks such as GLUE, SuperGLUE, or equivalent.
- Demonstrated proficiency in tasks including but not limited to text generation, translation, summarization, and question-answering.
- Peer-reviewed publications or evaluations by recognized AI researchers confirming its superiority over GPT-4.

The AI system's development must be attributed primarily to Russian organizations or researchers, and the claim must be substantiated by credible sources such as major AI conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML) or reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of multiple AI systems claiming superiority, the one with the earliest verified achievement date will be considered. If no such system is recognized by the resolution date, this question resolves as No.

title: Will Canada become a leading country in quantum computing research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Canada is recognized as a leading country in quantum computing research based on the following criteria:
- Publication: Canada-based researchers or institutions must have published at least 10% of the top 100 most-cited papers in quantum computing in the preceding three years.
- Funding: Canada must be among the top three countries in terms of government or private funding allocated to quantum computing research in the preceding three years.
- Innovation: Canadian institutions or companies must have developed or significantly contributed to at least three major advancements or breakthroughs in quantum computing technology, as recognized by leading scientific organizations or publications.
Recognition of Canada's leading status must be confirmed by credible sources such as Nature, Science, or reports from major research institutions or think tanks.
In the absence of clear recognition, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Google achieve a major breakthrough in quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google announces a major breakthrough in quantum computing that meets any of the following criteria:

- Demonstrates quantum supremacy by solving a problem that is practically unsolvable by classical computers within a reasonable timeframe.
- Develops a quantum computer with at least 100 stable qubits that can maintain coherence for a time period sufficient to perform complex computations.
- Achieves a significant milestone recognized by the quantum computing community, such as a major improvement in error correction or quantum algorithm efficiency.

The breakthrough must be verified by independent experts in the field and reported in at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Nature, Science).

In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the resolution will be based on the earliest verified announcement.

title: Will North Korea engage in direct diplomatic talks with South Korea by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a confirmed instance of direct diplomatic talks between North Korea and South Korea. 'Direct diplomatic talks' are defined as official, face-to-face meetings between representatives of the governments of North Korea and South Korea, aimed at discussing bilateral issues. The occurrence of such talks must be confirmed by official announcements from both the North Korean and South Korean governments or reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). Indirect talks, mediated negotiations, or informal meetings do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the majority consensus of the reputable sources mentioned.

title: Will any major political event related to Information Technology occur globally by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major political event specifically related to Information Technology (IT) occurs globally. The event must meet the following criteria:

- Involves significant policy changes, regulations, or international agreements directly impacting the IT sector.
- Is covered by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) as a major event.
- The event must be recognized as significant by at least one authoritative organization in the field of IT (e.g., IEEE, ACM, ITU).

Examples of such events include, but are not limited to:
- Enactment of major international agreements on cybersecurity or data privacy.
- Significant changes in IT-related laws or regulations in major economies (e.g., GDPR-like regulations in other regions).
- Major international disputes or agreements involving IT infrastructure or cyber warfare.

The question resolves as NO if no such event is recognized by the resolution date.

title: Will Google face significant political backlash over privacy issues before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Google faces significant political backlash over privacy issues, defined by any of the following criteria:

- Official government investigations or sanctions related to privacy concerns are initiated against Google by at least two different countries.
- Legislation is passed in at least two different countries specifically targeting Google's privacy practices.
- Major political figures (e.g., heads of state, ministers, or equivalent) in at least two different countries publicly denounce Google's privacy practices and call for regulatory action.

The political backlash must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a significant advancement in quantum computing be achieved in Information Technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant advancement in quantum computing in the field of Information Technology is confirmed by credible sources. 

A "significant advancement" is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:
- Demonstration of a quantum computer solving a problem that is currently infeasible for classical computers to solve within a reasonable timeframe.
- Achievement of quantum supremacy in a practical and widely-recognized IT application.
- Development of a new quantum algorithm that provides a substantial improvement in solving a class of problems relevant to Information Technology.

The advancement must be verified by at least two reputable sources, such as peer-reviewed scientific journals, major conferences, or credible news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus of the scientific community will be considered. If no such advancement is confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Switzerland become a leading hub for AI research and development by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland is recognized as a leading hub for AI research and development based on the following criteria:

- Publication Output: Switzerland ranks within the top 5 countries globally for the number of AI research publications in reputable journals and conferences, as verified by sources like Scopus or Google Scholar Metrics.
- Research Funding: Switzerland is among the top 5 countries globally in terms of government and private sector investment in AI research and development, as reported by sources such as OECD or similar organizations.
- AI Startups: Switzerland is home to at least 10 AI startups that have received significant venture capital funding (defined as over $10 million each) or have been acquired by major tech companies.
- Academic Institutions: At least two Swiss universities or research institutions are ranked within the top 10 globally for AI research, according to reputable ranking organizations like QS World University Rankings or Times Higher Education.

This question will resolve based on reports and data published by reputable sources such as OECD, Scopus, Google Scholar Metrics, QS World University Rankings, Times Higher Education, and major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the United Nations pass a significant resolution on climate change by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations passes a resolution that meets the following criteria for being considered 'significant' on climate change:

- The resolution must be adopted by a majority vote in the United Nations General Assembly or the United Nations Security Council.
- The resolution must include actionable measures or commitments aimed at mitigating climate change, such as reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, promotion of renewable energy, or adaptation strategies for climate resilience.
- The resolution must be covered by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) as a significant step in international climate policy.

In the event of multiple resolutions, the question resolves as Yes if at least one resolution meets the above criteria. If no resolution meets the criteria by the specified date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will there be a major geopolitical event involving basketball diplomacy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a major geopolitical event involving basketball diplomacy occurs. For the purposes of this question, a 'major geopolitical event' is defined as a significant diplomatic engagement between two or more countries where basketball plays a central role in the diplomacy. This can include, but is not limited to:

- Official state visits or summits where basketball games or events are a primary focus.
- Formal agreements or treaties facilitated or celebrated through basketball-related activities.
- High-profile basketball matches organized explicitly for diplomatic purposes with participation from government officials.

The event must be reported by at least three major reputable news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, or Bloomberg). In the absence of such reports, official statements from the governments involved confirming the event will also be considered.

Friendly matches or informal gatherings do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will an AI system defeat a professional MLB team in a simulated game by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, an AI system defeats a professional Major League Baseball (MLB) team in a simulated game under the following conditions:

- The AI system must be designed to play baseball and simulate both offensive and defensive plays.
- The simulated game must be conducted using a widely accepted and realistic baseball simulation platform.
- The professional MLB team must be represented by its actual roster of players or accurate virtual equivalents.
- The AI system must win the game according to the official rules of Major League Baseball.

The outcome must be confirmed by at least three reputable sources, such as major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, MLB.com) or technology news outlets (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch).

title: Will the United Nations implement a global initiative to combat climate change by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially implements a global initiative specifically aimed at combating climate change. 

The initiative must meet the following criteria:
- Be formally adopted by the UN General Assembly or the UN Security Council.
- Include specific, actionable measures aimed at reducing global greenhouse gas emissions or mitigating the effects of climate change.
- Be endorsed by at least two-thirds of the UN member states.

The implementation must be confirmed through an official UN announcement or resolution. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Initiatives that are regional or not globally coordinated, or those that do not specifically target climate change, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will California implement blockchain-based voting systems in statewide elections by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, California officially implements a blockchain-based voting system for any statewide election. The system must be used to record and verify votes in an actual election and not merely be in a pilot or testing phase. The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the California Secretary of State or another relevant government authority. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational and used in an official statewide election. Temporary or partial implementations (e.g., limited to specific counties or districts) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Republican Party (US) propose any major legislation related to geopolitics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Republican Party (US) proposes major legislation related to geopolitics. 

For the purposes of this question, 'major legislation' is defined as a bill or resolution that:
- Addresses significant geopolitical issues, such as international trade, defense, alliances, or foreign aid.
- Is introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate by a member of the Republican Party.

The proposal must be documented in the official congressional records. Confirmation can be verified through the official websites of the House of Representatives or the Senate, or through reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, or Bloomberg.

In the case of multiple pieces of legislation, the question resolves as Yes if at least one piece meets the criteria outlined above.

If no such legislation is proposed by the Republican Party by the specified date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will a major breakthrough in biotechnology lead to a new treatment for a currently incurable disease by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major breakthrough in biotechnology leads to the development and official approval of a new treatment for a disease that is currently considered incurable as of 2023.

- "Major breakthrough in biotechnology" is defined as a significant and novel scientific discovery or technological advancement that directly contributes to the development of the new treatment.
- "New treatment" is defined as a therapy, drug, or medical procedure that has been officially approved by at least one of the following regulatory bodies: the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the European Medicines Agency (EMA), or another comparable national regulatory authority.
- "Currently incurable disease" refers to a disease that, as of 2023, has no known cure or treatment capable of completely eradicating it. Examples include, but are not limited to, Alzheimer's disease, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), and certain types of cancer.

The approval must be confirmed through official announcements from the relevant regulatory body or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If the treatment is approved in one country but not others, the question will still resolve as Yes.

In the event of partial or conditional approvals, the question will resolve based on the first instance of full approval by any of the specified regulatory bodies.

title: Will the US dollar experience a significant devaluation due to a scientific discovery by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the US dollar experiences a significant devaluation directly attributable to a scientific discovery. 'Significant devaluation' is defined as a drop of at least 20% in the US Dollar Index (USDX) within a 12-month period compared to its value immediately before the scientific discovery. The devaluation must be explicitly linked to the scientific discovery by at least three reputable sources, such as major financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, Wall Street Journal). The scientific discovery must be a new finding in fields such as technology, medicine, physics, or any other natural science, and must be recognized as such by the scientific community. The resolution will be based on data from authoritative financial sources such as the Federal Reserve, International Monetary Fund, or similar institutions. If no such devaluation occurs by the specified date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in computational physics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, there is a significant breakthrough in the field of computational physics that meets the following criteria:

- The breakthrough leads to a new method or algorithm that substantially improves the accuracy, efficiency, or capability of computational models in physics.
- The breakthrough is recognized and validated by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed journal of high repute (e.g., Nature, Science, Physical Review Letters).
- The breakthrough is cited by at least 50 independent research groups or institutions within a year of publication.

For the purposes of this question, a "significant breakthrough" is defined as one that fundamentally changes current computational practices or opens up new areas of research previously deemed infeasible.

In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the first one to meet these criteria will be considered for resolution.

title: Will there be a significant political movement related to golf regulations in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a significant political movement related to golf regulations arises in the United States. A "significant political movement" is defined as one that meets any of the following criteria:

- A new or existing political party officially includes golf regulations in its platform.
- Legislation regarding golf regulations is introduced in either house of Congress or any state legislature.
- A major political figure (e.g., sitting President, Governor, or prominent member of Congress) publicly advocates for changes to golf regulations.
- A grassroots organization related to golf regulations garners at least 100,000 signatures on a petition or organizes a rally with at least 10,000 participants.

The occurrence of any of these events must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Canada implement a national AI strategy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Canada officially implements a national AI strategy. The strategy must be a comprehensive plan or policy framework aimed at guiding the development, deployment, and regulation of artificial intelligence technologies across the country. 

The implementation must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation, such as a policy paper or legislative act. 

In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, Reuters, BBC, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The strategy must be national in scope, not limited to specific provinces or territories. Temporary or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will any major geopolitical event significantly impact the global basketball industry before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a major geopolitical event causes a significant impact on the global basketball industry. A 'major geopolitical event' is defined as any of the following:
- A declaration of war or armed conflict involving at least one country with a top 20 FIBA-ranked national basketball team.
- The imposition of significant international economic sanctions affecting the basketball industry, confirmed by at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- A major political upheaval (e.g., revolution, coup) in a country with a top 20 FIBA-ranked national basketball team, confirmed by at least three reputable news sources.

A 'significant impact' on the global basketball industry is defined as any of the following:
- The cancellation or postponement of a major international basketball tournament (e.g., FIBA World Cup, Olympics) due to the geopolitical event.
- The withdrawal of at least three top 20 FIBA-ranked national basketball teams from international competition for at least one year due to the geopolitical event.
- A major disruption in the operations of at least three major basketball leagues (e.g., NBA, EuroLeague, CBA) for at least one season due to the geopolitical event.

In the absence of clear outcomes, the resolution will be based on the consensus of reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will there be a significant advancement in the study of the effects of golf course pesticides on local wildlife by 2028?
Will a major MLB team fund a research project on sports turfgrass science by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a Major League Baseball (MLB) team officially funds a research project specifically focused on sports turfgrass science. 

The funding must be publicly announced by the MLB team or confirmed by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

The research project must be explicitly aimed at advancing knowledge or technology in the field of sports turfgrass science, including but not limited to turfgrass growth, maintenance, durability, and performance. 

General research funding not specifically aimed at sports turfgrass science will not count towards this question's resolution. 

In the event of partial funding or joint funding with other organizations, the question will resolve as Yes if the MLB team's contribution is substantial and integral to the project.

title: Will there be any significant advancements in computational methods for biotechnology applications by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there are significant advancements in computational methods for biotechnology applications, meeting any of the following criteria:
- Development of new algorithms or computational techniques that substantially improve the accuracy, speed, or cost-efficiency of biotechnological processes, such as gene editing, protein folding, or drug discovery.
- Creation of computational models or simulations that lead to breakthroughs in understanding complex biological systems, resulting in widely recognized publications in peer-reviewed journals.
- Implementation of AI-driven methods that significantly enhance the capabilities of biotechnological tools, validated by successful real-world applications or clinical trials.

The advancements must be documented in reputable sources, including peer-reviewed scientific journals or major conferences. Verification by at least two independent experts in the field is required.
In the event of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific community will be considered authoritative.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to develop advanced strategies in MLB coaching by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) is used to develop advanced strategies in Major League Baseball (MLB) coaching. 

The criteria for AI usage in MLB coaching include:
- AI must be employed to analyze data and suggest strategies for in-game decisions, player training, or team management.
- The AI system must be acknowledged by at least one official MLB team as a significant tool in their coaching strategy.
- The use of AI must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, ESPN, or MLB.com).

The resolution will be No if AI is only used for basic statistical analysis or data collection without influencing coaching decisions.

title: Will Amazon face any new regulations impacting its business operations before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Amazon is subjected to any new regulations that significantly impact its business operations. 'Significantly impact' is defined as any regulation that leads to one or more of the following outcomes:
- A decrease of at least 5% in annual revenue as reported in Amazon's official financial statements.
- A restructuring of any major segment of its business operations, such as e-commerce, AWS, or logistics.
- The imposition of fines or penalties exceeding $500 million.

The regulation must be enacted by a governmental authority in any country where Amazon operates. The enactment must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). In case of multiple regulations, the first to meet the criteria will determine the resolution.

title: Will Iran enter into a new nuclear agreement with major world powers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Iran enters into a new nuclear agreement with any of the following major world powers: the United States, Russia, China, the United Kingdom, France, or Germany.

The agreement must be officially signed and publicly announced by the Iranian government and at least one of the aforementioned countries. The agreement must pertain specifically to Iran's nuclear program and include terms related to nuclear activities, sanctions relief, or monitoring protocols.

Verification of the agreement must come from credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or an official government announcement from Iran and one of the major world powers involved.

In the event of multiple agreements, the question will resolve as Yes based on the first agreement that meets the criteria.

Temporary or provisional agreements that do not have long-term implications will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will an AI-driven technology be used to enhance golf training or performance by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI-driven technology is officially used to enhance golf training or performance.

The technology must meet the following criteria:
- AI-driven: The technology must utilize artificial intelligence for its primary functions, such as data analysis, swing prediction, personalized training programs, or real-time performance feedback.
- Official Use: The technology must be used by a professional golfer, a recognized golf training academy, or during a professional golf tournament.

Verification of the technology's use must come from at least one of the following sources:
- An official announcement from a professional golfer or their coaching team.
- Documentation or press release from a recognized golf training academy.
- Coverage by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

The technology must be operational and not in a prototype or trial phase.

title: Will Microsoft release an AI product that significantly impacts the market by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Microsoft releases an AI product that meets the following criteria:

- The product must be publicly available and marketed as a Microsoft product.
- The product must achieve significant market impact, defined as either:
  - Generating at least $1 billion in revenue within the first year of release, or
  - Being adopted by at least 10% of Fortune 500 companies within the first year of release, or
  - Receiving widespread recognition from at least three major technology publications (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, The Verge) as a groundbreaking or transformative technology.

The market impact must be verifiable through official financial reports, credible market analysis, or widespread media coverage from reputable sources. The product must be an AI-driven technology, where AI is a core component of its functionality.

title: Will Canada see a significant change in its political leadership by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there is a significant change in Canada's political leadership, defined as:

- The Prime Minister of Canada is replaced by a new individual who was not previously in the role.
- A change in the ruling party, where the party that holds the majority in the House of Commons is different from the party in power as of the resolution date.

The change must be confirmed by official government records or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will any country use machine learning algorithms to significantly influence a national election by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there is credible evidence that machine learning algorithms were used to significantly influence the outcome of a national election in any country.

"Significantly influence" means that the algorithms had a measurable impact on voter behavior or election results. This can include, but is not limited to:
- Targeted political advertising or misinformation campaigns driven by machine learning.
- Voter manipulation or suppression efforts using machine learning techniques.
- Strategic decision-making in campaign management based on machine learning insights.

Credible evidence must come from at least three reputable sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or equivalent. Alternatively, an official government report or a peer-reviewed academic study confirming the influence of machine learning on the election outcome is also acceptable.

If no such evidence is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Taiwan become a leader in robotics research and development by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Taiwan is recognized as a leader in robotics research and development based on the following criteria:

1. Publication Metrics: Taiwan must be among the top 5 countries in terms of the number of peer-reviewed research papers on robotics published in reputable scientific journals.
2. Patents: Taiwan must be among the top 5 countries in terms of the number of patents granted related to robotics technology.
3. Industry Impact: Taiwan must have at least 3 robotics companies recognized globally for innovation and market impact, as evidenced by features in major industry reports or rankings by reputable organizations such as IEEE, IFR (International Federation of Robotics), or similar.
4. Government Initiatives: Taiwan must have significant government-funded programs or initiatives supporting robotics research and development, as reported by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The question resolves as Yes if Taiwan meets at least three of the four criteria listed above. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

title: Will there be a major natural science discovery in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major natural science discovery is made in the United States and meets the following criteria:

- The discovery must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed journal of high impact (e.g., Nature, Science, PNAS).
- The discovery must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian).
- The discovery must be acknowledged by a major scientific body or institution (e.g., National Academy of Sciences, American Association for the Advancement of Science).

For the purposes of this question, a "major natural science discovery" is defined as a finding that substantially advances knowledge in fields such as biology, chemistry, physics, earth sciences, or astronomy. Incremental findings or discoveries that do not garner widespread recognition and acclaim do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will an OpenAI-developed system be used in any national election for vote counting or voter verification by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an OpenAI-developed system is officially used in any national election for either vote counting or voter verification.
The system must be publicly acknowledged by OpenAI as theirs and must be used in an official capacity by the national election authority of any country.
Verification of the system's use must come from either an official government announcement or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
The system must be used for the actual election process, not in a trial phase or for simulation purposes.
In the event of partial use (e.g., in specific regions or for specific tasks), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for nationwide implementation in future elections.

title: Will there be a significant scientific discovery related to the natural environment in Ukraine by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a significant scientific discovery related to the natural environment in Ukraine is announced and recognized by the scientific community. 

A 'significant scientific discovery' is defined as one that meets the following criteria:
- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.
- Recognized as a major advancement or breakthrough by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).
- Endorsed or validated by a recognized scientific authority or organization (e.g., National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, relevant international scientific bodies).

The discovery must pertain specifically to the natural environment within the geopolitical boundaries of Ukraine as recognized by the United Nations. This includes, but is not limited to, discoveries in fields such as ecology, geology, climatology, and biodiversity.

In the event of multiple discoveries, the most widely recognized and endorsed discovery will be considered for the resolution of this question. If no such discovery is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the NBA face a significant political controversy before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the National Basketball Association (NBA) faces a significant political controversy before January 1, 2028. A "significant political controversy" is defined as an event or series of events that meet the following criteria:

- The controversy must be widely reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).
- The controversy must involve political statements or actions by the NBA, its teams, or its players that result in widespread public debate or governmental response.
- The controversy must result in either official statements from the NBA addressing the issue or actions taken by governmental bodies in response to the controversy.

Examples of significant political controversies include, but are not limited to, public statements by NBA players or officials on geopolitical issues, governmental sanctions or investigations involving the NBA, or widespread protests or boycotts related to political statements or actions by the NBA.

If no such event occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a candidate from a new political party win the general election in Spain by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate from a political party that did not exist before January 1, 2024, wins the general election in Spain. 

A "new political party" is defined as a political party that was officially registered after January 1, 2024. 

Winning the general election is defined as having the candidate elected as the President of the Government of Spain (Prime Minister) following the election, confirmed through official election results announced by the Spanish Ministry of the Interior or another authoritative government body. 

In the event of a coalition government, the question will resolve as Yes if the candidate from the new political party is appointed as the President of the Government. 

If the election results are disputed or challenged, the resolution will be based on the final, certified results. In the absence of official certification, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered.

title: Will AI developed by DeepMind be used to predict election outcomes in any major country by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI developed by DeepMind is used to predict the outcome of a national election in any major country. A 'major country' is defined as one of the G20 nations. The prediction must be publicly announced before the election results are officially declared. Confirmation can come from an official statement by DeepMind or from credible reports by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The AI must be explicitly credited with making the prediction, and the prediction must pertain to the overall winner of the election or the distribution of seats in a parliamentary system. Predictions made for local or regional elections do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will any new medical research significantly influence voter turnout in major elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, new medical research is published that meets the following criteria:

- The research must be published in a peer-reviewed medical or scientific journal.
- The research must provide evidence of a significant influence on voter turnout in major elections, defined as national or presidential elections in any country.
- "Significant influence" is defined as a statistically significant change in voter turnout of at least 5% that can be directly attributed to the medical research findings.
- The influence must be recognized and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the majority consensus of the reputable news sources cited above.

title: Will artificial intelligence become a significant topic in the Republican Party (US) platform by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, artificial intelligence is explicitly mentioned as a significant topic in the official Republican Party platform of the United States.

For the purposes of this question, a "significant topic" is defined as one that has a dedicated section or subsection discussing AI policies, initiatives, or regulations. Mere mentions or passing references do not qualify.

The resolution will be based on the official platform document released by the Republican National Committee (RNC). In the absence of an official document, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered.

Edge cases and fall-back scenarios: If the platform is not updated or released by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Amazon launch an AI-driven service that revolutionizes e-commerce by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Amazon launches an AI-driven service that significantly transforms the e-commerce industry by meeting at least one of the following criteria: 

- The service introduces a novel AI technology that enhances the shopping experience, such as personalized shopping assistants, predictive purchasing, or advanced logistics optimization, and is widely adopted by consumers or businesses.
- The service results in a measurable increase of at least 25% in Amazon's e-commerce revenue within a year of its launch.
- The service is recognized by at least three major industry publications (e.g., TechCrunch, Wired, Forbes) or market research firms (e.g., Gartner, Forrester) as having a revolutionary impact on the e-commerce industry.

The launch must be officially announced by Amazon through a press release or public statement. The question resolves as No if none of these criteria are met by the resolution date.

title: Will there be any significant policy changes in the US related to Major League Baseball (MLB) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any of the following significant policy changes related to Major League Baseball (MLB) in the United States are officially enacted: 
- Changes to the rules of gameplay (e.g., pitch clock, designated hitter rule, etc.).
- Modifications to the league structure (e.g., expansion or contraction of teams).
- Changes in player contract regulations (e.g., salary cap, free agency rules).
- Implementation of new policies related to player health and safety (e.g., concussion protocols).

The policy changes must be confirmed by an official announcement from Major League Baseball (MLB) or the Major League Baseball Players Association (MLBPA). In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, The New York Times, The Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary changes or trials do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland host an international conference on quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Switzerland hosts an international conference focused on quantum computing.

An "international conference" is defined as a conference that:
- Has participants from at least 10 different countries.
- Features presentations or panels from recognized experts in the field of quantum computing.

The conference must be publicly announced and documented on an official website or through credible sources such as major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

The conference must be held physically in Switzerland, not virtually. The question resolves as NO if the conference is canceled or postponed beyond the resolution date.

title: Will Russia develop an AI system that becomes widely recognized for its impact on a global scale by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system developed in Russia becomes widely recognized for its impact on a global scale. The criteria for 'widely recognized' and 'impact on a global scale' are as follows:

- Widely Recognized: The AI system must be featured in reports by at least three major international news organizations (e.g., BBC, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) or acknowledged in major AI conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR).
- Impact on a Global Scale: The AI system must have demonstrable applications or influence in at least three different countries outside of Russia and must be cited or adopted by organizations, governments, or industries in those countries.

The recognition and impact must be verifiable through credible sources, and the AI system must be fully operational, not in a prototype or experimental phase. In the event of multiple AI systems meeting the criteria, the first one to achieve these milestones will determine the resolution.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass an impeachment resolution before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the US House of Representatives passes an impeachment resolution against a sitting President, Vice President, or any other federal official as outlined in Article II, Section 4 of the United States Constitution. 

The passage of the impeachment resolution must be confirmed by an official record from the Clerk of the US House of Representatives or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters). 

In the event of multiple impeachment resolutions, the question will resolve as Yes upon the passage of any one resolution. If no impeachment resolution is passed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Ukraine conduct a national election before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Ukraine conducts a national election before January 1, 2029. A national election refers to any election in which citizens vote to elect representatives to a national legislative body, such as the Verkhovna Rada (Ukrainian Parliament), or for the President of Ukraine.

The election must be officially sanctioned by the Ukrainian government and reported by at least three reputable news organizations, such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or Reuters. The election must be open to the general electorate and not limited to a specific subset of the population.

In the event of a disputed election, this question will resolve based on the outcome recognized by the majority of international observers and reputable news organizations. If no national election is held by the specified date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United States see a voter turnout of over 70% in the 2028 presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the voter turnout in the 2028 United States presidential election exceeds 70% as reported by the United States Election Assistance Commission (EAC) or another official government body overseeing federal elections. The voter turnout percentage should be calculated based on the total number of votes cast divided by the total number of eligible voters. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the EAC's report will take precedence. If the EAC does not provide a report, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used. The question will resolve as No if the turnout does not exceed 70% or if there is insufficient information to confirm the turnout percentage.

title: Will Microsoft develop a significant breakthrough in quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Microsoft announces a significant breakthrough in quantum computing, defined by any of the following criteria:

- Achieving quantum supremacy, where a quantum computer performs a calculation that is infeasible for any classical computer.
- Developing a quantum computer with at least 100 qubits that demonstrate stable and error-corrected operations.
- Announcing a commercially viable quantum computing service or product that is available to the public or businesses.

The breakthrough must be confirmed by an official announcement from Microsoft. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community, with validation from at least one peer-reviewed publication or a major scientific conference presentation.

title: Will a natural science discovery lead to a new method for improving baseball performance by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a discovery in the natural sciences leads to a new method that is widely recognized and adopted for improving baseball performance. 

The discovery must be:
- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.
- Reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The method must be:
- Implemented by at least one Major League Baseball (MLB) team in official games, or
- Approved by the MLB as a permissible method for improving player performance.

The improvement in performance must be measurable and significant, such as an increase in batting averages, pitching speeds, or fielding accuracy. 

In the event of multiple discoveries, the first to meet these criteria will be considered. If no such discovery is made, the question resolves as No.

title: Will Sweden achieve a significant scientific breakthrough in renewable energy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Sweden achieves a significant scientific breakthrough in the field of renewable energy. A 'significant scientific breakthrough' is defined as meeting at least one of the following criteria:

- Development of a new renewable energy technology that increases energy efficiency by at least 20% compared to existing technologies, as verified by independent scientific studies.
- Discovery or invention that leads to a reduction of renewable energy production costs by at least 30%, confirmed by industry reports and peer-reviewed publications.
- Implementation of a renewable energy solution that results in a measurable and sustained reduction of Sweden’s carbon emissions by at least 10%, as reported by the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency or equivalent authority.

The breakthrough must be recognized and reported by at least three major reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

title: Will the United States host the FIFA World Cup before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the United States hosts any FIFA World Cup match, whether as the primary host, co-host, or substitute host for another country. 

The hosting must be confirmed by an official announcement from FIFA or the United States Soccer Federation (USSF). In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The term 'host' includes hosting any official FIFA World Cup match, including group stage, knockout stage, or the final. Hosting only related events, such as draws or ceremonies, does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the European Union implement new regulations for the protection of endangered species by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements new regulations specifically aimed at the protection of endangered species.

To qualify as 'new regulations,' the measures must meet the following criteria:
1. They must be legally binding across all EU member states.
2. They must introduce new protective measures or significantly amend existing regulations to enhance the protection of endangered species.
3. They must be officially adopted and published in the Official Journal of the European Union.

The implementation of these regulations must be confirmed by an official announcement from the European Commission or the European Parliament, or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event that only some member states implement the regulations, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will AI predict the winner of the 2028 Olympic basketball tournament?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system correctly predicts the winner of the 2028 Olympic basketball tournament.
