An "AI system" is defined as any software utilizing machine learning, deep learning, or other AI techniques to analyze data and make predictions. The prediction must be made publicly available before the start of the Olympic basketball tournament. 

The correct prediction must be verified by the official results of the 2028 Olympic basketball tournament as published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC).

In the case of multiple AI systems making predictions, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one AI system makes a correct prediction. The prediction must be documented with a timestamp to confirm it was made before the tournament began.

title: Will Spain become a leader in quantum computing research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Spain is recognized as a leader in quantum computing research based on any of the following criteria:

- Publication: Spain-based researchers or institutions are among the top 10 in the world for the number of publications in leading quantum computing journals (e.g., Quantum, npj Quantum Information, Physical Review X).
- Funding: Spain ranks in the top 10 countries for government or private investment in quantum computing research and development.
- Innovation: Spain-based researchers or institutions make a groundbreaking discovery or technological advancement in the field of quantum computing, as recognized by at least three major scientific organizations or journals.
- Collaboration: Spain is a key participant in at least three major international quantum computing research collaborations or projects.

Confirmation must come from reputable sources such as government announcements, reports from major scientific organizations, or publications in leading scientific journals. If conflicting information arises, the consensus of the scientific community will be used to determine the resolution.

title: Will India enact significant political reforms by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, India enacts political reforms that meet the following criteria:

- Constitutional Amendments: Passage of constitutional amendments aimed at improving governance, transparency, or political accountability.
- Legislative Changes: Enactment of significant laws or amendments to existing laws that enhance democratic processes, reduce corruption, or increase political transparency.
- Institutional Reforms: Establishment or significant restructuring of political institutions to ensure greater accountability, transparency, or public participation.

The reforms must be confirmed by official government documentation or announcements. In the absence of such documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Minor changes or reforms limited to local or state levels without broader national impact do not count towards this question's resolution. The resolution will be based on the official enactment date of the reforms.

title: Will a third major political party emerge in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a third political party in the United States meets the following criteria:

- Official Recognition: The party must be officially recognized by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) as a national party.
- Electoral Success: The party must have won at least one seat in either the U.S. House of Representatives or the U.S. Senate in a general election.
- Membership: The party must have at least 5% of registered voters in at least 10 states, as verified by state election boards or other authoritative sources.
- Media Coverage: The party must be regularly covered by at least three major national news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, Fox News, BBC).

In the event of a merger between two existing minor parties, the new entity must still meet all of the above criteria independently to be considered a third major political party.

title: Will a significant breakthrough in the field of physics be made by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant breakthrough in the field of physics is announced and recognized by the scientific community. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Fundamentally changes our understanding of a major concept in physics (e.g., quantum mechanics, general relativity).
- Leads to the development of new technologies or methods with substantial impact.
- Is published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and cited by at least 100 other peer-reviewed papers within two years of publication.
- Receives a Nobel Prize in Physics or a similarly prestigious award.

The breakthrough must be confirmed by credible sources such as major scientific organizations (e.g., CERN, NASA) or reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the composition of the US Senate have a measurable impact on federal funding for natural sciences research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a measurable impact on federal funding for natural sciences research directly attributable to the composition of the US Senate. 

"Measurable impact" is defined as a statistically significant change in the federal budget allocation for natural sciences research compared to the previous fiscal year, as reported by the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) or the National Science Foundation (NSF).

"Composition of the US Senate" refers to the political party majority and the membership of key committees such as the Senate Committee on Appropriations and the Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

The change must be explicitly linked to legislative actions or decisions made by the Senate, as evidenced by official Senate records or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian).

title: Will a significant breakthrough in computational biology occur before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2029, a significant breakthrough in computational biology is announced and recognized by the scientific community. A 'significant breakthrough' is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Development of a new computational method or algorithm that substantially improves the accuracy, efficiency, or capabilities of biological data analysis.
- Discovery of a new biological mechanism or pathway through computational methods that leads to a major advancement in understanding or treating a disease.
- Creation of a computational model that accurately predicts complex biological phenomena and is adopted widely in the field.

The breakthrough must be confirmed by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major scientific conference, and recognized by leading experts in the field. In the absence of such recognition, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Nature, Science, Cell, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will Russia develop a quantum computer that demonstrates quantum supremacy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum computer developed by Russia demonstrates quantum supremacy. Quantum supremacy is defined as the ability of a quantum computer to solve a problem that classical computers practically cannot solve within a reasonable timeframe. The demonstration must be publicly acknowledged and documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by authoritative sources in the field, such as the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) or the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM). In the event of conflicting reports, consensus among these authoritative sources will determine the resolution. If no such demonstration occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will North Korea launch a cyberattack on a major international organization before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, there is credible evidence that North Korea launched a cyberattack on a major international organization. 

A "major international organization" is defined as an entity with significant international influence and recognition, such as the United Nations, World Health Organization, International Monetary Fund, or similar.

"Cyberattack" is defined as any deliberate attempt to compromise the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of the organization's data, systems, or networks. 

Credible evidence must come from an official statement by the affected organization, a statement by a national government, or credible reporting from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). 

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the majority of these sources. If no such cyberattack is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will Iran and the United States restore the nuclear deal by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Iran and the United States officially restore the nuclear deal, formally known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), or any equivalent agreement aimed at limiting Iran's nuclear capabilities in exchange for sanction relief. The restoration must be confirmed through official announcements from both the Iranian government and the United States government. In the absence of direct official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The agreement must be officially signed and ratified by both parties. Interim agreements, partial agreements, or agreements involving only some aspects of the JCPOA do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Amazon face antitrust legislation passed by the US Congress by 2028?
body: This question addresses the potential for new antitrust laws targeting major corporations like Amazon, and whether such legislation will be enacted by the US Congress by 2028.

title: Will machine learning algorithms significantly advance our understanding of natural sciences by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a significant advancement in our understanding of natural sciences directly attributed to the use of machine learning algorithms. 

"Significant advancement" is defined as a discovery or development that meets the following criteria:
- The advancement must be widely recognized by the scientific community as a major breakthrough in fields such as physics, chemistry, biology, or earth sciences.
- The role of machine learning algorithms in achieving this advancement must be explicitly acknowledged in peer-reviewed scientific publications or at major scientific conferences.
- The advancement must be covered by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

If there is any ambiguity or dispute over the significance of the advancement, the resolution will be based on the consensus of a panel of experts from relevant scientific fields.

title: Will Taiwan's 2028 presidential election result in a pro-independence candidate winning?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate who is publicly in favor of Taiwan's independence wins the 2028 presidential election in Taiwan.

A candidate is considered pro-independence if they have, at any point during their campaign, expressed support for Taiwan's independence from China either in speeches, official campaign materials, or policy proposals. 

The election result must be officially confirmed by Taiwan's Central Election Commission. In the event of a dispute or recount, the final decision recognized by the Central Election Commission will be used for resolution. 

If no candidate explicitly supports independence, or if the election is annulled or indefinitely postponed, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a NATO member country hold a national election that results in a significant shift in government by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a national election in any NATO member country results in a significant shift in government. A 'significant shift in government' is defined as a change in the ruling party or coalition, or a change in the head of government (e.g., Prime Minister or President) to a candidate from a different party or coalition.

The election results must be officially confirmed by the relevant national electoral authority. In the absence of official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If an election leads to a hung parliament or similar situation where no party has a clear majority but results in a new coalition or ruling agreement, this will also be considered a significant shift in government.

By-elections, local elections, and referendums do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the geopolitical influence of the United States in the Middle East increase by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there is clear and measurable evidence that the geopolitical influence of the United States in the Middle East has increased according to the following criteria:

- Military Presence: An increase in the number of U.S. military bases or personnel stationed in the Middle East.
- Diplomatic Engagement: More frequent or higher-level diplomatic visits or engagements between the U.S. and Middle Eastern countries compared to previous years.
- Economic Ties: An increase in trade volume, foreign direct investment, or economic aid from the U.S. to Middle Eastern countries.
- Strategic Alliances: Formation or strengthening of strategic alliances or defense agreements with Middle Eastern countries.

The evidence must be corroborated by official U.S. government statements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of clear evidence, or if the indicators are mixed, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Sweden implement a national AI strategy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Sweden officially implements a national AI strategy. The strategy must be a formal, government-approved document outlining Sweden's approach to the development, regulation, and promotion of artificial intelligence technologies. This implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or publication on a government website. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The strategy must be nationwide and not limited to specific regions or sectors. Temporary or trial strategies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Kingdom establish a new research center focused on computational mathematics by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom has officially established a new research center dedicated to computational mathematics. The establishment of the center must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from a recognized academic institution. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The center must be operational and conducting research in computational mathematics. Temporary research initiatives or expansions of existing centers do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Amazon develop a quantum computer that achieves quantum supremacy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Amazon develops a quantum computer that achieves quantum supremacy. Quantum supremacy is defined as the ability of a quantum computer to solve a problem that no classical computer can solve within a reasonable timeframe.

The achievement must be validated by one of the following:
- A peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal.
- Confirmation by at least two major independent research institutions or organizations specializing in quantum computing.

The validation must include a detailed description of the problem solved, the methodology used, and evidence that classical computers cannot solve the problem in a reasonable timeframe. Reports from reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered for additional context but are not sufficient for resolution on their own.

In the event of a dispute or ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific community will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will China implement a national AI strategy that significantly boosts its global AI competitiveness by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, China implements a national AI strategy that is recognized as significantly boosting its global AI competitiveness. The criteria for 'significantly boosts its global AI competitiveness' include:

1. Official Government Announcement: The Chinese government must officially announce and document the implementation of a comprehensive national AI strategy.
2. Global AI Ranking: China must move up at least two positions in a globally recognized AI competitiveness ranking (e.g., Tortoise Global AI Index) compared to its position as of January 1, 2024.
3. Industry Impact: Significant advancements in AI-related industries within China, such as increased funding, research output, and AI-driven innovations, as reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
4. International Acknowledgment: Recognition from international bodies or leading AI research institutions that China's AI strategy has measurably improved its global standing in AI research, development, and application.

If these criteria are not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant advancement in robotics that allows robots to consistently beat humans in a standard soccer game by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a team of robots defeats a team of professional human soccer players in a standard soccer game under the following conditions:

- The game must follow the official FIFA rules for a standard soccer match.
- The human team must consist of professional players from a recognized soccer league.
- The robot team must operate autonomously without direct human control during the match.
- The result must be verified by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of a dispute, the question will be resolved based on the consensus of a panel of experts in robotics and professional soccer.

title: Will the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party win more than 15% of the vote in the 2028 German federal elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the Alternative for Germany (AfD) party secures more than 15% of the total vote in the 2028 German federal elections.

The percentage of the vote will be determined based on the official election results published by the Federal Returning Officer (Bundeswahlleiter). If the official results are not available by the resolution date, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered.

In the event of a dispute over the election results, the question will resolve based on the outcome of any official recounts or legal challenges that conclude by the resolution date.

If the elections are postponed or canceled, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a candidate from California win the 2028 United States presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate who is a current resident of California wins the 2028 United States presidential election. A "current resident" is defined as an individual who has maintained primary residency in California for at least six months prior to the general election date. The candidate must be officially listed on the California voter registration rolls as of the general election date. The winner of the election is determined by the candidate who receives a majority of the Electoral College votes as certified by the United States Congress. In the event of a dispute or recount, the resolution will be based on the final certified result. If the election is not resolved by January 20, 2029, the question will be resolved based on the individual who is inaugurated as President on that date. Authoritative sources for determining the winner include official announcements by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) and reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a candidate with a background in Physics be elected to a national office in any European Union country by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate with a background in Physics is elected to a national office in any European Union country.

A "background in Physics" is defined as having at least a Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Physics or a closely related field, such as Applied Physics or Theoretical Physics, from a recognized institution.

"National office" refers to any elected position at the national level, such as a member of parliament, senator, president, or prime minister.

The election must be officially recognized by the relevant national electoral authority. Confirmation can come from an official government announcement or documentation, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of a disputed election, the question will resolve based on the final official outcome as determined by the relevant national judicial or electoral authority.

title: Will the European Union implement blockchain technology in its election process by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements blockchain technology in any part of its election process for any of its member states or for EU-wide elections.

The implementation must be confirmed through an official announcement by the European Union or its relevant electoral body. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The blockchain technology must be used in a live election, not in a pilot or trial phase. The use of blockchain technology for voter registration, vote casting, vote counting, or any other critical part of the election process qualifies for this question's resolution.

In the event of partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or types of elections), the question will resolve as Yes if the implementation is intended for broader application in future elections.

title: Will any European Union country have a voter turnout exceeding 80% in a national election by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any European Union country reports a voter turnout exceeding 80% in a national election. 

A 'national election' refers to an election in which officials are elected to a national legislative body or the head of state (e.g., parliamentary or presidential elections).

Voter turnout is defined as the percentage of registered voters who cast a ballot, as reported by the country's official election authority. 

The turnout percentage must be reported by a credible and authoritative source, such as the country's national election commission or a reputable international organization (e.g., the European Union, United Nations, or Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe). 

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of major international news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Canada host the FIFA World Cup before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Canada is officially announced as a host or co-host of the FIFA World Cup by FIFA.
The announcement must be confirmed by an official statement from FIFA or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
The hosting can be for either the men's or women's FIFA World Cup.
If Canada is announced as a co-host, the question will still resolve as Yes.
If no official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Canada and the United States enter into a new trade agreement by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Canada and the United States officially enter into a new trade agreement that meets the following criteria:

- The agreement must be formally signed by representatives of both countries and ratified by their respective legislative bodies.
- The agreement must be distinct from any existing trade agreements in place as of the date this question was posted.
- The agreement must cover at least two of the following areas: tariffs, trade in goods and services, intellectual property, labor standards, or environmental regulations.

Confirmation of the new trade agreement must come from official government announcements or documentation from both countries. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or provisional agreements do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI that can autonomously conduct scientific research by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, DeepMind develops an AI system that can autonomously conduct scientific research. The AI must be able to independently generate hypotheses, design and conduct experiments, analyze data, and draw conclusions without human intervention. The AI's research must result in at least one peer-reviewed publication in a reputable scientific journal, where the AI is credited as the primary author. Confirmation of the AI's capabilities must come from an official announcement by DeepMind or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, etc.). If the AI system is only partially capable or requires significant human assistance, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US Congress pass major legislation related to baseball by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States Congress passes legislation that meets the following criteria: 
- The legislation must be signed into law by the President of the United States. 
- The legislation must be directly related to the sport of baseball, including but not limited to issues such as player safety, league regulations, or funding for baseball programs. 
- The legislation must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian). 
- Amendments to existing laws do not count unless they significantly alter the legal landscape of baseball.
In the event of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on the consensus of legal experts as reported in reputable sources.

title: Will a candidate from the United States win the 2028 presidential election?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate from the United States wins the 2028 presidential election. 
A "candidate from the United States" is defined as an individual who is a natural-born citizen of the United States, as per Article II, Section 1, Clause 5 of the U.S. Constitution, and meets all other constitutional requirements to hold the office of President. 
The winner is determined based on the official results certified by the Federal Election Commission (FEC). 
In the event of a dispute or recount, the resolution will be based on the final certified result. 
If the election is not decided by December 31, 2028, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Amazon deploy a fully autonomous delivery drone service in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Amazon has officially deployed a fully autonomous delivery drone service operating within the United States. 

A "fully autonomous delivery drone service" is defined as a system where drones operate without human pilots, from the point of dispatch to the point of delivery. The service must be capable of completing deliveries without human intervention, including navigation, obstacle avoidance, and package handling.

The deployment must be confirmed by an official announcement from Amazon or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). The service must be operational and available to the general public, not in a trial or testing phase.

In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific cities or regions), the question will resolve as Yes if the service is intended for nationwide expansion. Temporary deployments for specific events do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Kingdom implement a nationwide AI-driven public transportation system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom has officially implemented a nationwide public transportation system driven primarily by artificial intelligence. The system must be operational and cover at least 80% of the country's public transportation routes, including buses, trains, and subways. The AI must be responsible for key functions such as scheduling, routing, and real-time adjustments based on traffic and passenger flow.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be in regular use by the public and not in a trial or pilot phase. Temporary deployments or limited trials do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Kingdom implement a nationwide AI policy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom government officially implements a nationwide AI policy. 

The policy must include comprehensive regulations or guidelines for the development, deployment, and ethical use of artificial intelligence across various sectors. 

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The policy must be enacted and not just proposed or under discussion. Temporary measures or sector-specific guidelines do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be any significant political movements related to artificial intelligence regulation in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a significant political movement in the United States specifically focused on the regulation of artificial intelligence (AI). A 'significant political movement' is defined as any of the following:

- Passage of federal legislation specifically regulating AI.
- Introduction of federal legislation specifically regulating AI that garners at least 50 co-sponsors.
- A major political party (Democratic or Republican) including a specific AI regulation policy in its official platform.
- Formation of a bipartisan congressional caucus focused on AI regulation.

The confirmation of such events must come from reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, or Bloomberg. In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus of at least three of these sources will determine the resolution.

title: Will there be any significant political movements related to DeepMind's AI research in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a significant political movement in the United States directly related to DeepMind's AI research. A significant political movement is defined as one that meets any of the following criteria:

- Legislative Action: Introduction or passage of federal or state legislation specifically addressing DeepMind's AI research.
- Executive Action: Issuance of executive orders or directives by the President or state governors directly concerning DeepMind's AI research.
- Public Policy Debate: Major public policy debates in Congress or state legislatures where DeepMind's AI research is a central topic, covered by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- Advocacy and Lobbying: Formation of advocacy groups or significant lobbying efforts focused on influencing public policy related to DeepMind's AI research, with coverage in at least three major news organizations.

The resolution will be based on credible reports from major news organizations or official government announcements. The movement must be primarily focused on DeepMind's AI research, not AI research in general.

title: Will OpenAI release a major geopolitical analysis tool by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, OpenAI officially releases a major geopolitical analysis tool. 

The tool must meet the following criteria:
- It must be capable of analyzing and making predictions about geopolitical events or trends.
- It must be publicly accessible or available for use by governmental or large-scale institutional clients.
- The release must be confirmed by an official announcement from OpenAI or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

A "major" tool is defined as one that is widely recognized as a significant advancement or contribution in the field of geopolitical analysis. 

In the event of a partial release or beta version, the question will resolve as Yes if the tool is intended for full deployment and meets the above criteria. 

If no such tool is released by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Kingdom implement a nationwide quantum computing strategy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom has officially implemented a nationwide quantum computing strategy. This strategy must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation and must outline a comprehensive plan for the development, deployment, and integration of quantum computing technologies across various sectors, including but not limited to research, industry, and public services. The strategy must include specific goals, timelines, and allocated funding. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Partial or pilot implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new political party win a majority in the Swiss parliamentary elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party that did not have any seats in the Swiss Federal Assembly as of January 1, 2023, wins a majority of the seats in the National Council or the Council of States in a federal election. 

The majority is defined as more than 50% of the total seats in either the National Council or the Council of States. 

The results must be officially confirmed by the Swiss Federal Council or reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

In the event of a coalition, only the party with the highest number of seats within the coalition will be considered.

title: Will a new political party win a majority in the Spanish parliamentary elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party that did not have any seats in the Spanish Parliament (Cortes Generales) as of January 1, 2024, wins a majority of seats in the Spanish parliamentary elections.

A majority is defined as more than half of the total seats in the Congress of Deputies (currently 176 out of 350 seats).

The outcome must be confirmed by official election results released by the Spanish Ministry of the Interior or another authoritative government body.

In the event of a coalition government, this question will resolve as No unless a single new party, as defined above, wins a majority of seats on its own.

title: Will NATO launch any major environmental initiatives or policies by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, NATO officially launches any major environmental initiative or policy. 
A "major environmental initiative or policy" is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:
- Involves a commitment of at least $1 billion in funding.
- Affects at least 3 member countries.
- Is explicitly aimed at addressing climate change, reducing carbon emissions, or protecting biodiversity.

The launch of such an initiative or policy must be confirmed by an official NATO announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question resolves as NO if no such initiative or policy is launched by the specified date.

title: Will there be any significant advancements in the understanding of the physics of a baseball's trajectory by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there are peer-reviewed publications or official announcements recognized by the scientific community that demonstrate significant advancements in the understanding of the physics of a baseball's trajectory. Significant advancements are defined as:

- New models or theories that provide a more accurate prediction of a baseball's flight path under various conditions (e.g., different pitches, weather conditions, spin rates).
- Empirical evidence or experimental data that lead to a revision of existing theories or models.
- Technological innovations that allow for more precise measurement and analysis of a baseball's trajectory.

The advancements must be acknowledged by reputable sources such as major scientific journals (e.g., Nature, Science, Physical Review Letters) or recognized scientific organizations (e.g., American Physical Society).

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI that can accurately predict natural disasters by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, DeepMind develops an artificial intelligence system that can accurately predict natural disasters such as earthquakes, hurricanes, or floods. The system must meet the following criteria:

- Accuracy: The AI must achieve a prediction accuracy rate of at least 85% for each type of natural disaster it is designed to predict.
- Verification: The accuracy of the AI's predictions must be verified by at least two independent scientific studies published in peer-reviewed journals.
- Deployment: The AI must be operationally deployed and used by at least one governmental or international agency responsible for disaster management or response.

The development and deployment of such an AI system must be confirmed by an official announcement from DeepMind or the deploying agency. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event that the AI system is only partially capable (e.g., it can predict some but not all types of natural disasters), the question will resolve as Yes if the system meets the accuracy and verification criteria for at least one type of natural disaster.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a new resolution addressing the Russo-Ukrainian conflict by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the United Nations General Assembly or the United Nations Security Council adopts a new resolution specifically addressing the Russo-Ukrainian conflict.

The resolution must be formally adopted and published on the official United Nations website. The resolution must explicitly reference the Russo-Ukrainian conflict in its title or main text.

In the event of multiple resolutions, the first resolution to meet these criteria will determine the outcome. If no such resolution is adopted by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Ukraine regain full control of its territories currently occupied by Russia by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Ukrainian government has regained full control over all territories that were occupied by Russia as of the resolution date of this question.

"Full control" is defined as:
- The Ukrainian government has established administrative and military control over the territories.
- No foreign military presence is operating in these territories without the explicit consent of the Ukrainian government.
- Ukrainian law is being enforced without significant opposition.

The resolution will be based on official announcements from the Ukrainian government or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the California state government introduce new policies related to Major League Baseball by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the California state government officially introduces new policies directly related to Major League Baseball (MLB). The policies must be enacted through legislation, executive order, or regulatory changes and must be publicly documented.

The new policies should specifically mention Major League Baseball or its operations within California. General sports policies that do not explicitly mention MLB will not be considered.

The introduction of such policies must be confirmed through official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policies must be in effect, not merely proposed or under discussion.

In case of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert analysis from reputable sources.

title: Will a new political party gain significant influence in Sweden before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a new political party (founded after January 1, 2023) gains significant influence in Sweden, defined by any of the following criteria:

- Winning at least 5% of the national vote in a general election.
- Securing at least 10 seats in the Riksdag (Swedish Parliament).
- Forming a coalition government with one or more existing parties.

The verification of the above criteria must be confirmed through official election results or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will artificial intelligence play a significant role in a breakthrough discovery in particle physics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) plays a significant role in a breakthrough discovery in particle physics. 

"Significant role" is defined as AI being essential to the discovery process, either through data analysis, experimental design, or theoretical modeling. 

"Breakthrough discovery" is defined as a discovery that is widely recognized by the scientific community as a major advancement in particle physics. 

The discovery must be acknowledged by at least two of the following authoritative sources: CERN, Fermilab, the American Physical Society, or a publication in a leading peer-reviewed scientific journal such as Nature or Science. 

In the event of multiple discoveries, the resolution will be based on the first one meeting these criteria.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to develop a revolutionary basketball training program by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an artificial intelligence (AI) system is used to develop a basketball training program that is widely recognized as revolutionary by the basketball community. The program must meet the following criteria:

- Innovation: Introduces novel training techniques or methodologies that significantly differ from existing programs.
- Effectiveness: Demonstrates a measurable improvement in player performance metrics (e.g., shooting accuracy, speed, agility) compared to traditional training methods.
- Adoption: Is adopted by at least three professional basketball teams or national basketball federations.
- Endorsement: Receives endorsements or positive reviews from at least two reputable basketball organizations or authorities (e.g., FIBA, NBA, NCAA).

The development and deployment of the program must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC Sport, The New York Times, The Guardian).

title: Will Japan implement nationwide AI regulations by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Japan officially implements nationwide regulations specifically governing the development, deployment, and use of artificial intelligence technologies.

The regulations must be enacted through formal legislative or regulatory processes and must be applicable across the entire country.

The implementation of such regulations must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Regulations implemented at local or regional levels, or guidelines that are not legally binding, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Catalonia gain independence from Spain by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Catalonia officially gains independence from Spain. 

"Officially gains independence" is defined as:

- A declaration of independence by the Catalan government that is recognized by the Spanish government, or
- Recognition of Catalonia as an independent country by at least 50% of the member states of the United Nations, or
- Admission of Catalonia as a member state of the United Nations.

The resolution will be based on official announcements from the relevant governments or recognition by international bodies, such as the United Nations. In the absence of official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

title: Will the outcome of the Russo-Ukrainian War influence the results of the 2028 Ukrainian presidential election?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, credible evidence demonstrates that the outcome of the Russo-Ukrainian War has had a significant influence on the results of the 2028 Ukrainian presidential election. "Significant influence" is defined as any of the following:
- A major shift in voter sentiment directly attributable to the war, as reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- An official statement from the Ukrainian government or the Central Election Commission of Ukraine attributing the election results to the war's outcome.
- Academic or expert analysis published in a peer-reviewed journal or by a recognized think tank concluding that the war's outcome was a decisive factor in the election.

In the absence of such evidence, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will advancements in quantum computing be used to secure voting systems by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum computing-based system is officially used to secure any part of a voting system in a governmental election.
The system must be publicly acknowledged by the relevant electoral authority and reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
The use of quantum computing must be a key component in the security mechanism, such as encryption, voter authentication, or vote tallying.
Experimental or pilot projects do not count unless they are used in an actual governmental election.
In the event of multiple systems, the question resolves as Yes if at least one system meets the criteria.

title: Will a new information technology be implemented in national elections to improve transparency by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new information technology is officially implemented in any national election with the explicit purpose of improving transparency. The technology must meet the following criteria:

- Official Implementation: The technology must be officially adopted and used in at least one national election.
- Purpose: The primary purpose of the technology must be to improve transparency in the electoral process. This includes, but is not limited to, technologies for secure and transparent voting, real-time result reporting, or enhanced voter verification.
- Verification: The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question does not resolve based on trials, pilot programs, or proposals. The technology must be used in an actual national election.

title: Will any scientific research related to the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to a major breakthrough in natural sciences by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, scientific research directly related to the Russo-Ukrainian War leads to a major breakthrough in the natural sciences. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that meets the following criteria:

- Recognized by the scientific community as significantly advancing knowledge or technology in fields such as physics, chemistry, biology, earth sciences, or related disciplines.
- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of high repute (e.g., Nature, Science, The Lancet).
- Cited by at least 100 other scientific publications within two years of its initial publication.

The question resolves as YES if the breakthrough is confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) and recognized by a major scientific organization (e.g., National Academy of Sciences, Royal Society). If no such breakthrough is recognized by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Joe Biden endorse a major AI policy before the end of his current term in office?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before the end of Joe Biden's current term in office, he officially endorses a policy specifically focused on artificial intelligence (AI).

The endorsement must be in the form of a public announcement, official document, or policy statement explicitly supporting or outlining an AI-related strategy, regulation, or initiative. General mentions of AI in speeches or documents do not count unless they are part of a broader AI policy endorsement.

The endorsement must be reported by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) or documented in official government records. If Joe Biden's term ends prematurely, the question resolves based on the actions taken up to that date.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) propose significant AI regulations in their 2028 platform?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the official platform of the Democratic Party (US) for the 2028 election includes a proposal for significant AI regulations. 

"Significant AI regulations" are defined as policies that aim to govern the development, deployment, or use of artificial intelligence technologies. These policies must address at least one of the following areas:
- Ethical guidelines and standards for AI development and use.
- Data privacy and protection in the context of AI.
- AI accountability and transparency measures.
- Regulations on the use of AI in critical sectors such as healthcare, finance, and law enforcement.

The platform must be an official document released by the Democratic Party and available on their official website or through a formal announcement. In the event of ambiguity, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters) will be used to determine the presence of such proposals in the platform.

title: Will Switzerland join the European Union by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Switzerland has completed the process of joining the European Union. This includes the formal application, acceptance by the European Union, and the official ratification of membership by both Switzerland and the European Union.

The confirmation of Switzerland joining the EU must be verified through official announcements from the Swiss government and the European Union, or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of full ratification but with substantial progress, such as an official application and acceptance pending final ratification, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a major political event or shift in the US political landscape by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any of the following events occur in the United States:
- The impeachment and removal from office of a sitting President.
- The resignation of a sitting President.
- A significant change in the control of either the House of Representatives or the Senate, defined as a shift of at least 10 seats in the House or 5 seats in the Senate from one party to another in a single election cycle.
- The emergence of a new political party that wins at least 5% of the popular vote in a general election.

The occurrence of these events must be confirmed by reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or official government announcements. In the event of ambiguity, the consensus of at least three major news organizations will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will any country implement a national policy on quantum computing research funding by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any country officially implements a national policy specifically dedicated to funding quantum computing research. 

The policy must be publicly documented and include dedicated budget allocations or funding mechanisms aimed explicitly at advancing quantum computing research. 

The implementation of such a policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

Temporary or one-time funding initiatives do not count towards this question's resolution. The policy must indicate a long-term commitment to funding quantum computing research.

title: Will the United States pass a federal data privacy law by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States Congress passes and the President signs into law a federal data privacy legislation that establishes comprehensive data privacy rights for individuals. 
The legislation must include, at a minimum, the following provisions:
- Rights for individuals to access, correct, and delete personal data held by companies.
- Requirements for companies to obtain explicit consent before collecting or sharing personal data.
- Provisions for data breach notifications.
- Enforcement mechanisms, including penalties for non-compliance.

The passage of the law must be confirmed by official government sources such as the U.S. Congress website or the White House. In the absence of official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian) are sufficient.

In the event of multiple laws being passed, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the above criteria. If no such law is passed, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will France hold a referendum on leaving the European Union by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, France holds a national referendum where the primary question asked is whether France should leave the European Union. The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the French government and conducted according to French electoral laws. The question will resolve as No if no such referendum is held by the specified date. In the event of ambiguity, the confirmation of the referendum being held must come from reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or official French government announcements.

title: Will machine learning algorithms achieve human-level performance in medical diagnosis by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, machine learning algorithms achieve human-level performance in medical diagnosis across a range of medical conditions.

The criteria for "human-level performance" are as follows:

- Accuracy: The machine learning algorithm must demonstrate diagnostic accuracy comparable to or exceeding that of a board-certified medical doctor in at least three distinct medical specialties (e.g., radiology, pathology, dermatology).
- Peer Review: The performance must be documented in at least two peer-reviewed journals or presented at major medical conferences.
- Clinical Trials: The algorithm must be validated through clinical trials or real-world clinical settings and show consistent results.
- Regulatory Approval: The algorithm must receive approval or clearance from at least one major regulatory body (e.g., FDA, EMA) for use in clinical settings.

In case of partial achievement (e.g., human-level performance in fewer than three specialties), the question will resolve as No. The use of machine learning algorithms as an assistive tool rather than as a primary diagnostic tool does not count towards this question's resolution.

Authoritative sources for verification include peer-reviewed scientific journals, major medical conferences, and announcements from regulatory bodies.

title: Will Ukraine become a global leader in software development by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Ukraine is recognized as a global leader in software development based on the following criteria:

- Industry Recognition: Ukraine is listed among the top 5 countries for software development in at least two reputable industry rankings or reports (e.g., Gartner, IDC, Forrester, Stack Overflow).
- Market Share: Ukrainian software development companies collectively hold at least a 10% share of the global software development market, as reported by a reputable market research firm.
- Innovation and Contributions: Ukraine is credited with significant contributions to at least 5 major open-source projects or has produced at least 5 widely recognized and used software products or platforms.

The resolution will be based on data and reports available as of the resolution date. In case of conflicting reports, a consensus will be sought from at least three reputable sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

title: Will biotechnology advancements lead to the creation of fully synthetic organs by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, fully synthetic organs are created and meet the following criteria:

- Functionality: The synthetic organ must perform the same function as its natural counterpart in the human body.
- Biocompatibility: The synthetic organ must be biocompatible, causing no adverse immune response in the human body.
- Successful Implantation: The organ must be successfully implanted in a human patient and demonstrate normal function for at least six months post-implantation.

The creation and successful implantation must be verified by peer-reviewed publications or documented in credible medical journals. Confirmation from at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) is also required. In the absence of such publications, official announcements from recognized medical institutions or regulatory bodies (e.g., FDA, EMA) will suffice.

title: Will Taiwan hold a presidential election that is deemed free and fair by international observers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Taiwan holds a presidential election that is deemed free and fair by a consensus of international observers. 

"Free and fair" means that the election process, including voting and counting, is conducted without significant irregularities, fraud, or coercion, and that the results reflect the will of the voters.

The assessment must come from at least three reputable international organizations, such as the Carter Center, the European Union Election Observation Mission, and the International Republican Institute. 

If there is disagreement among observers, the resolution will be based on the majority opinion of these organizations. If no international observers are present, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major advancement in biotechnology influence the outcome of a national election by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major advancement in biotechnology is widely recognized as having influenced the outcome of a national election in any country.

A "major advancement in biotechnology" is defined as a breakthrough or significant improvement in the field of biotechnology, such as gene editing, synthetic biology, or biopharmaceuticals, that has substantial societal, economic, or political impact.

The influence on the election outcome must be documented by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) and acknowledged by political analysts or experts as a significant factor in the election results.

The national election must be an official, government-sanctioned election for a national office (e.g., presidency, parliament, congress) and not a local or regional election.

In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus among the majority of the cited reputable sources will determine the resolution.

title: Will AI-driven analytics become a standard tool in professional basketball by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven analytics are officially recognized as a standard tool in professional basketball leagues such as the NBA, EuroLeague, or CBA. 

"AI-driven analytics" refers to the use of artificial intelligence to analyze player performance, game strategies, or other relevant basketball metrics.

The recognition of AI-driven analytics as a standard tool must be confirmed by official league announcements or documentation. In the absence of official announcements, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, BBC Sport) are sufficient.

The AI-driven analytics must be actively used in decision-making processes by teams or leagues, not merely available as an option.

In the event of partial adoption (e.g., limited to specific teams or regions), the question will resolve as Yes if there is a clear and official intention for league-wide adoption. Temporary trials or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Japan's investment in renewable energy result in a 50% reduction in carbon emissions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Japan's carbon emissions are reduced by at least 50% compared to the baseline year of 2020. The reduction must be directly attributable to investments in renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, and geothermal power.

The primary source for verification will be Japan's Ministry of the Environment or an equivalent authoritative body. In the absence of official government data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

The reduction must be demonstrated through comprehensive and transparent data, and the investments must be clearly linked to the observed reduction in emissions. Temporary reductions due to economic downturns, natural disasters, or other non-investment-related factors do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Iran's air quality improve by 50% by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Iran's air quality shows a 50% improvement based on the Air Quality Index (AQI) over the baseline average AQI measured in 2023.

The improvement must be confirmed by data from at least two of the following sources: Iran's Department of Environment, the World Health Organization (WHO), or a peer-reviewed scientific study.

The baseline AQI will be calculated as the average of daily AQI values across major cities in Iran (including Tehran, Mashhad, Isfahan, Karaj, Shiraz, and Tabriz) for the year 2023.

A 50% improvement means that the average AQI for the year 2027 must be at least 50% lower than the baseline AQI of 2023.

In case of discrepancies between sources, the median value will be considered.

If data is unavailable or insufficient to determine the resolution, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new species of mammal be discovered by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new species of mammal is discovered and officially recognized by the scientific community. The discovery must meet the following criteria:

- The species must be formally described in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- The description must include genetic analysis distinguishing the new species from all previously known species.
- The species must be recognized as valid by the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) or a similar authoritative body.

In the event of a dispute over the validity of the species, the question will remain unresolved until a consensus is reached within the scientific community or an authoritative body makes a final determination.

title: Will Germany experience a significant political shift (e.g., change in government or major policy reform) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Germany experiences a significant political shift, defined as one of the following:

- Change in Government: A new political party or coalition takes control of the German federal government, resulting in a new Chancellor.
- Major Policy Reform: Implementation of a policy reform that significantly alters Germany's domestic or foreign policy, confirmed through legislation passed by the Bundestag and Bundesrat.

The change must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). In the absence of such reports, official government announcements or documentation confirming the change are sufficient.

This question resolves as NO if none of the above criteria are met by the resolution date.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to make significant discoveries related to black holes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) is used to make significant discoveries related to black holes, as evidenced by one or more of the following criteria:

- Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of a discovery directly attributed to AI analysis or modeling that advances our understanding of black holes.
- Official announcements by reputable scientific organizations (e.g., NASA, ESA, or major research universities) crediting AI with a significant discovery regarding black holes.
- Coverage by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) reporting on the AI-driven discovery and its significance.

A "significant discovery" is defined as one that is widely recognized by the scientific community as advancing the understanding of black holes, such as new insights into their formation, behavior, or properties.

If there is any ambiguity or dispute over whether a discovery meets these criteria, the consensus of the scientific community will be used to determine the resolution.

title: Will a machine learning algorithm win a major international chess tournament by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a machine learning algorithm wins a major international chess tournament. A "major international chess tournament" is defined as one of the following: the World Chess Championship, Candidates Tournament, or any tournament organized by FIDE (Fédération Internationale des Échecs) with at least 10 grandmasters participating. The machine learning algorithm must compete directly against human players and not as part of a human-machine team. The victory must be confirmed by official tournament results published by FIDE or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will China achieve a significant breakthrough in quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, China achieves a significant breakthrough in quantum computing. A 'significant breakthrough' is defined as any of the following:
- Demonstration of quantum supremacy, where a quantum computer performs a calculation infeasible for any classical computer within a reasonable time frame.
- Development of a quantum computer with at least 100 qubits that can maintain coherence long enough to perform complex calculations.
- Achievement of a major advancement in quantum error correction that significantly enhances the stability and scalability of quantum computers.

The breakthrough must be confirmed through a public announcement by a recognized Chinese scientific institution or government body, such as the Chinese Academy of Sciences or the Ministry of Science and Technology of China. Additionally, the breakthrough must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of multiple claims, the first to be confirmed by the specified sources will be considered for resolution.

title: Will a new species of plant be discovered in India before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a new species of plant is discovered in India before January 1, 2028. The discovery must be confirmed by the following criteria:

- The plant must be classified as a new species by a recognized taxonomic authority, such as the International Plant Names Index (IPNI) or a peer-reviewed botanical journal.
- The discovery must be documented with a formal scientific description, including morphological details and, if available, genetic analysis.
- The plant must be found within the geographical boundaries of India.

In the event of multiple discoveries, the first documented and verified discovery will be considered for the resolution of this question. If no new species of plant is discovered and verified by the specified date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will quantum computing achieve a major breakthrough in error correction by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a major breakthrough in quantum computing error correction that meets the following criteria:

- Demonstrated Improvement: An error correction method that significantly reduces error rates in quantum computations, achieving at least a 10-fold improvement over the best-known methods as of January 1, 2024.
- Peer-Reviewed Publication: The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.
- Independent Verification: The method must be independently verified by at least two separate research groups, not affiliated with the original developers.
- Practical Applicability: The error correction method must be shown to be practically implementable on existing or near-term quantum computing hardware.

This question resolves as YES upon meeting all the above criteria, confirmed by reputable sources such as Nature, Science, or similar peer-reviewed journals. Otherwise, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will Donald Trump publicly endorse a major technology initiative by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Donald Trump makes a public endorsement of a major technology initiative. A 'major technology initiative' is defined as a project or program that aims to significantly advance technology in fields such as artificial intelligence, renewable energy, biotechnology, or space exploration. The endorsement must be made through an official channel, such as a press release, a public speech, or a verified social media account. The endorsement must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). Endorsements of products, companies, or minor projects do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will NATO member countries collaborate on a significant computing project by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, NATO member countries officially collaborate on a significant computing project. The criteria for a 'significant computing project' are as follows:

- The project must involve at least three NATO member countries.
- The project must be officially announced and documented by NATO or the governments of the involved member countries.
- The project must aim to achieve a substantial advancement in computing technology, such as quantum computing, AI research, cybersecurity, or large-scale data processing.
- The collaboration must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of ambiguity, the question will resolve based on the consensus of expert analysis from reputable sources. Temporary or minor collaborations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will DeepMind achieve a major breakthrough in natural sciences by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, DeepMind achieves a major breakthrough in the natural sciences. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery, innovation, or advancement that meets the following criteria:

- Recognized by the scientific community as a significant contribution to the field of natural sciences (e.g., physics, chemistry, biology).
- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal with an impact factor of at least 10.
- Covered by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The breakthrough must be attributed primarily to DeepMind, either through direct research or collaboration where DeepMind's contribution is explicitly acknowledged as critical. In the event of a dispute over the significance or attribution of the breakthrough, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the scientific community and coverage by reputable news sources.

title: Will the United States implement new federal regulations to protect endangered species by 2028?
Will the NBA introduce a mid-season tournament before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the National Basketball Association (NBA) officially introduces and conducts a mid-season tournament. The tournament must meet the following criteria:

- The tournament is held between the start and end of the regular NBA season.
- It involves all or a majority of NBA teams.
- The tournament results in a distinct championship or title separate from the NBA Finals.
- Official NBA documentation or announcements confirm the tournament's introduction and execution.

The question will resolve as No if no such tournament is introduced and conducted by the specified date, or if the tournament is canceled before completion.

title: Will a quantum computer be used to influence or predict election outcomes by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum computer is used to either influence or predict election outcomes in any country.

- "Quantum computer" is defined as a computer that uses quantum-mechanical phenomena, such as superposition and entanglement, to perform operations on data.
- "Influence election outcomes" means the quantum computer is used in any capacity to affect the results of an election, such as through voter targeting, campaign strategies, or election security.
- "Predict election outcomes" means the quantum computer successfully forecasts the results of an election with a higher accuracy than traditional methods, as verified by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
