The use of the quantum computer must be documented in credible reports from at least three major news organizations or confirmed by an official government announcement. The quantum computer must be operational and not merely experimental or in a trial phase.

title: Will a significant scientific discovery be made in the field of natural sciences by a member of the Democratic Party (US) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant scientific discovery in the field of natural sciences is made by a member of the Democratic Party (US). 

A "significant scientific discovery" is defined as one that is recognized by the scientific community and meets at least one of the following criteria:
- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal with an impact factor of 10 or higher.
- Results in a patent filed with the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO).
- Receives coverage in at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, or Bloomberg).

A "member of the Democratic Party (US)" is defined as an individual who is registered as a member of the Democratic Party at the time of the discovery. Verification of party membership can be through official voter registration records or a public statement from the individual.

In the event of a collaborative discovery, the question resolves as Yes if a registered Democrat is listed as the lead author or principal investigator of the study or patent. If there is ambiguity in authorship, the question resolves based on the individual who is primarily credited in the scientific community or media coverage.

title: Will Taiwan establish a new national park or significant conservation area by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Taiwan officially establishes a new national park or a significant conservation area. The establishment must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from the Taiwanese government.

A 'significant conservation area' is defined as a protected area of at least 10,000 hectares dedicated to the preservation of biodiversity, ecosystems, and natural resources. The area must be designated for long-term conservation purposes and recognized by an authoritative conservation organization such as the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN).

The announcement must be covered by at least two major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or published in an official government gazette. Temporary designations or areas established for purposes other than conservation do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Microsoft develop a significant new technology for environmental monitoring by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Microsoft officially announces and releases a new technology specifically designed for environmental monitoring that meets the following criteria:

- The technology must be innovative and represent a significant advancement over existing solutions in the field of environmental monitoring.
- It must be capable of collecting, analyzing, and reporting environmental data (such as air quality, water quality, deforestation, or climate change metrics) with a high degree of accuracy and reliability.
- The technology must be recognized as significant by at least three reputable sources, such as major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or scientific journals.

The question will resolve as No if no such technology is announced and released by the specified date.

title: Will the United Nations implement a global cybersecurity policy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially implements a global cybersecurity policy. 

The policy must meet the following criteria:
- Be formally adopted by the United Nations General Assembly or Security Council.
- Include specific measures for international cooperation on cybersecurity issues, such as information sharing, incident response coordination, and capacity building.
- Be publicly accessible and documented in official UN records.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official UN announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary or non-binding resolutions, or policies limited to specific regions or member states, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant natural sciences discovery related to Sweden by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant discovery in the natural sciences is made and is directly related to Sweden. A 'significant discovery' is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized as a major advancement by the scientific community.
- Awarded a major scientific prize (e.g., Nobel Prize, Breakthrough Prize).
- Recognized by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) as a groundbreaking discovery.

The discovery must have a clear and direct connection to Sweden, either through the location of the research, the nationality of the lead scientist(s), or the primary affiliation of the research institution(s).

title: Will there be any significant discoveries related to the impact of sports activities on local ecosystems by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there are significant discoveries related to the impact of sports activities on local ecosystems that meet the following criteria:

- The discovery must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- The discovery must be recognized as significant by at least three independent experts in the field of ecology or environmental science.
- The discovery must provide new insights into how sports activities influence local ecosystems, such as changes in biodiversity, soil composition, water quality, or other ecological factors.

The question resolves based on the date of the publication of the discovery. In the event of multiple discoveries, the first one to meet all criteria will be considered for resolution.

title: Will OpenAI's technology be a significant topic in any US national election campaign before the end of 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2029, OpenAI's technology is a significant topic in any US national election campaign. A 'significant topic' is defined as one that is mentioned by at least two major party candidates (Democratic or Republican) in speeches, debates, or official campaign materials (e.g., policy documents, websites). The mention must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, Fox News). If the technology is only mentioned in passing or by candidates of minor parties, this question resolves as No.

title: Will a new breakthrough in Medicine significantly increase the average human lifespan by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new breakthrough in Medicine is announced and recognized by the scientific and medical communities that significantly increases the average human lifespan. 

"Significantly increase" is defined as an increase of at least 5 years in the global average human lifespan, compared to the average lifespan as of January 1, 2023. 

The breakthrough must be documented in at least one peer-reviewed medical journal and corroborated by reputable sources such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). 

In the absence of official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The increase in lifespan must be directly attributed to the breakthrough and not to other unrelated factors. 

If no such breakthrough is recognized by the resolution date, this question resolves as No.

title: Will a new technology in Information Technology enable real-time translation of multiple languages by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new technology in Information Technology (IT) enables real-time translation of multiple languages. 

The criteria for real-time translation are:
- The technology must support at least five different languages.
- Translation must occur with a latency of no more than 1 second per sentence.
- The translation quality must achieve at least an 85% accuracy rate based on BLEU (Bilingual Evaluation Understudy) score or a similar metric.

The technology must be publicly available and actively used by at least one major tech company or organization. 

Confirmation of the technology's capabilities must come from either:
- An official announcement by a major tech company or organization (e.g., Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Apple).
- Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

This question resolves as NO if these criteria are not met by the resolution date.

title: Will Taiwan implement AI regulations to boost its semiconductor industry by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Taiwan implements official regulations specifically designed to boost its semiconductor industry through the use of artificial intelligence (AI). The regulations must meet the following criteria:

- Official Implementation: The regulations must be officially adopted and published by the Taiwanese government.
- Specific to AI and Semiconductors: The regulations must explicitly mention the use of AI to enhance or support the semiconductor industry.
- Verification: The implementation of these regulations must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event of partial regulations or pilot programs, the question will resolve as Yes if the regulations are intended for nationwide implementation. Temporary measures or regulations not explicitly mentioning AI in the context of the semiconductor industry do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to improve public services in Sweden by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) is officially utilized to improve any public services in Sweden. Public services include but are not limited to healthcare, education, transportation, public safety, and administrative services. 

The use of AI must be confirmed through official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The AI application must be operational and not merely in a pilot or trial phase. Temporary uses for specific events or limited trials do not count towards this question's resolution. 

Examples of AI applications include but are not limited to: predictive analytics for resource allocation, AI-driven diagnostics in healthcare, automated administrative processes, and AI-enhanced public safety measures.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to enhance soccer training programs by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) is used to enhance soccer training programs in any of the following ways:

- Performance Analysis: AI systems are used to analyze player performance, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
- Injury Prevention: AI is employed to predict and prevent injuries by analyzing player data and suggesting preventive measures.
- Personalized Training: AI is used to create personalized training programs tailored to individual players based on their strengths, weaknesses, and performance data.
- Tactical Analysis: AI systems are utilized to analyze team tactics and provide strategic recommendations.

The use of AI must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC Sport, Sky Sports) or official announcements from recognized soccer clubs or associations.

If AI is used in any other significant way to enhance soccer training programs not mentioned above, the question will resolve as Yes, provided the usage is confirmed by credible sources as described above.

Temporary or experimental uses of AI that are not integrated into regular training programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Kingdom achieve a significant breakthrough in renewable energy technology by 2028?
Will North Korea publish a peer-reviewed scientific paper in a major international journal by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a scientific paper authored by researchers affiliated with a North Korean institution is published in a major international peer-reviewed journal. 

For the purposes of this question, a 'major international journal' is defined as one indexed in the Web of Science, Scopus, or PubMed databases, or one with an impact factor of at least 5 according to the Journal Citation Reports.

The paper must be original research and not a review, commentary, or editorial. The affiliation of the authors must be clearly stated in the publication, and the paper must be accessible to the public either freely or through institutional access.

In the event of retraction or significant controversy regarding the authenticity of the research, the question will resolve as No unless the issues are satisfactorily addressed by the journal and the paper remains published.

title: Will advancements in Information Technology significantly enhance climate change models by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, advancements in Information Technology (IT) lead to significant enhancements in climate change models used by major climate research organizations such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), NASA, or the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF). 

Significant enhancements are defined as:
- Improved accuracy in predicting climate patterns and trends, as evidenced by peer-reviewed publications or official reports from the aforementioned organizations.
- The integration of new IT techniques, such as machine learning, quantum computing, or advanced data analytics, that result in demonstrable improvements in model performance.

The enhancements must be recognized and validated by at least two reputable sources, including scientific journals, official reports from major climate research organizations, or credible news outlets (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the Republican Party (US) endorse any major scientific breakthroughs in renewable energy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Republican Party (US) officially endorses a scientific breakthrough in renewable energy. A 'scientific breakthrough' is defined as a significant advancement or discovery in the field of renewable energy that is recognized by the scientific community and has the potential for substantial impact on energy production or efficiency. The endorsement must be documented through an official statement or policy document from the Republican National Committee (RNC) or a public announcement by a prominent Republican leader (e.g., the President, a Senator, or a House Representative). In the absence of an official statement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must be explicitly mentioned and supported as a positive development for renewable energy by the endorsing party. Endorsements of general renewable energy policies or technologies that do not specify a particular breakthrough do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a Swedish scientist win a Nobel Prize in Chemistry by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a scientist of Swedish nationality is announced as a Nobel Prize winner in Chemistry. The nationality of the scientist will be determined based on the official Nobel Prize announcement and accompanying documentation. If the prize is awarded to a team, at least one member must be of Swedish nationality for the question to resolve as Yes. The Nobel Prize in Chemistry must be recognized by the official Nobel Prize organization (Nobelprize.org).

title: Will Iran develop an AI system that is internationally recognized by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Iran develops an AI system that meets the following criteria:

- The AI system must be developed primarily by Iranian researchers or institutions.
- The AI system must achieve international recognition through one of the following means:
  - Winning or placing in the top three positions in an internationally recognized AI competition (e.g., ImageNet, Kaggle competitions, DARPA challenges).
  - Publication of a research paper detailing the AI system in a top-tier peer-reviewed AI journal or conference (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, AAAI), with the AI system being the primary focus of the paper.
  - Adoption or implementation of the AI system by a major international organization or corporation, with public acknowledgment of its Iranian origin.

Verification must come from reputable sources such as official announcements, publications, or reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus of the majority of these sources will be used to determine the resolution.

title: Will China become the world's largest economy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, China is recognized as the world's largest economy based on any of the following metrics:

- Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in nominal terms, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank.
- Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) GDP, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank.

The determination must be based on official reports published by the IMF or the World Bank. In the absence of such reports, credible reports from at least three major financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times, The Wall Street Journal) will be considered.

In case of conflicting data, the question will resolve based on the majority consensus among the sources mentioned above.

title: Will the European Union implement a unified military force by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements a unified military force. The criteria for a unified military force are as follows:

- The force must be established by an official EU directive or treaty ratified by all member states.
- The force must operate under a single command structure that is distinct from individual member states' military forces.
- The force must be capable of independent military operations, including deployment, logistics, and command and control.

The implementation must be confirmed by official EU documentation or announcements. In the absence of such documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary coalitions or joint exercises do not count towards this question's resolution. The force must be a permanent and standing military entity.

title: Will a new geopolitical alliance involving at least three countries be formed by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new geopolitical alliance involving at least three countries is officially formed and announced. 

The alliance must be formalized through a treaty, agreement, or official declaration, and must be recognized by the governments of the member countries. 

The formation of the alliance must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

The alliance must have a defined purpose, such as military cooperation, economic collaboration, or political partnership. 

Temporary coalitions for specific events or informal agreements do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Russia implement online voting in national elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Russian government officially implements an online voting system for national elections. The system must be available for use by the general population in at least one national election (presidential or parliamentary).

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The system must be operational and not in a pilot or trial phase. Temporary implementations for specific events or limited use in regional or local elections do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States implement a nationwide universal healthcare system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States implements a universal healthcare system that meets the following criteria:

- Coverage: The system must provide healthcare coverage to all U.S. residents, regardless of income, employment status, or pre-existing conditions.
- Legislation: The implementation must be enacted through federal legislation, signed into law by the President, and come into effect by the resolution date.
- Services: The system must include primary, preventive, and emergency medical services.
- Verification: The implementation must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if such a system is not implemented by the resolution date, or if the system is only partially implemented or limited to specific states.

title: Will a significant geopolitical event impact the baseball industry by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant geopolitical event directly impacts the baseball industry in any of the following ways:

- Major League Baseball (MLB) or another prominent baseball league (e.g., Nippon Professional Baseball, KBO League) experiences a suspension or cancellation of games lasting at least one month due to geopolitical tensions or conflicts.
- A major baseball tournament (e.g., World Baseball Classic, Olympics) is postponed or relocated due to geopolitical reasons.
- A significant number of baseball players (at least 10% of active players in a major league) are unable to participate in their respective leagues due to travel restrictions or safety concerns arising from geopolitical events.
- Official statements from recognized baseball organizations (e.g., MLB, International Baseball Federation) explicitly attribute disruptions in the baseball industry to geopolitical events.

Geopolitical events include, but are not limited to, wars, international sanctions, and diplomatic conflicts. The resolution will be based on announcements from credible news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official statements from relevant organizations.

title: Will robotics technology play a crucial role in a geopolitical conflict by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, robotics technology is documented to have played a crucial role in a geopolitical conflict. For the purposes of this question, 'robotics technology' is defined as autonomous or semi-autonomous systems capable of performing tasks without human intervention, including but not limited to drones, unmanned ground vehicles, and robotic soldiers.

A 'geopolitical conflict' is defined as a conflict involving at least two sovereign states or a state and a significant non-state actor (e.g., a major insurgent group).

To qualify as 'crucial,' robotics technology must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) as having a significant impact on the outcome or progression of the conflict. This could include, but is not limited to, altering the strategic balance, achieving a decisive victory in a major battle, or significantly influencing peace negotiations.

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the majority of reputable sources.

title: Will China implement significant new regulations on information technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Chinese government officially implements significant new regulations specifically targeting information technology. 

"Significant new regulations" are defined as:
- New laws or amendments to existing laws passed by the National People's Congress or its Standing Committee.
- Major directives or policies issued by the State Council or relevant ministries that introduce new compliance requirements, restrictions, or oversight mechanisms for information technology companies.

The implementation must be confirmed by official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question will not resolve as Yes based on minor updates, clarifications, or extensions of existing regulations, unless these changes introduce substantial new requirements or restrictions.

title: Will there be a major change in the US election process involving the use of blockchain technology by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the United States officially implements a major change in its election process that involves the use of blockchain technology. This change must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from a federal or state election authority. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The change must be operational and used in at least one federal or state election. Temporary trials or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution. A 'major change' is defined as one that affects the voting or vote-counting process for a significant portion of the electorate, such as the introduction of blockchain-based voting systems or blockchain-secured voting records.

title: Will Japan experience a significant earthquake (magnitude 7.0 or higher) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Japan experiences an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0 or higher on the Richter scale by December 31, 2028.
The earthquake's magnitude must be confirmed by the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) or the United States Geological Survey (USGS).
In the event of discrepancies between sources, the value reported by the JMA will take precedence.
Aftershocks and foreshocks are not considered unless they independently meet the magnitude criterion.
If no such earthquake occurs by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a scientific study establish a link between Donald Trump and climate change by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a peer-reviewed scientific study establishes a statistically significant link between actions or policies of Donald Trump and measurable changes in climate patterns.

The study must be published in a reputable scientific journal and be widely recognized by the scientific community, including citations or endorsements by at least two authoritative sources such as the IPCC (Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change) or NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration).

The link must be directly attributable to Donald Trump's actions or policies, not indirect associations. In the event of multiple studies with conflicting conclusions, the question will resolve as No unless a clear consensus is reached within the scientific community.

Edge cases include:
- Studies that only suggest potential links without statistical significance do not count.
- Non-peer-reviewed articles or studies do not count.
- Studies that focus on indirect associations or speculative connections do not count.

title: Will there be a major geopolitical conflict involving a significant medical crisis by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a geopolitical conflict occurs that results in a significant medical crisis. The criteria for a 'major geopolitical conflict' include:

1. Involvement of at least two sovereign states or organized armed groups with political objectives.
2. Armed conflict resulting in at least 1,000 combat-related deaths within a calendar year, as verified by reputable sources such as the United Nations, International Crisis Group, or major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

The criteria for a 'significant medical crisis' include:

1. An outbreak of disease or other medical condition directly attributable to the conflict, resulting in at least 10,000 confirmed cases or 1,000 deaths, as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), or similar reputable health organizations.
2. Overwhelming of local healthcare infrastructure, leading to international humanitarian intervention, as verified by reports from reputable organizations such as Médecins Sans Frontières (Doctors Without Borders), the Red Cross, or similar entities.

In case of ambiguity or conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of the aforementioned reputable sources.

title: Will quantum computing play a significant role in Swedish national security policies by 2028?
body:
This question resolves as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, quantum computing is officially incorporated into Swedish national security policies in any of the following ways:

- Encryption and Cryptography: Deployment of quantum-resistant encryption methods or quantum key distribution for securing national communications.
- Intelligence and Surveillance: Utilization of quantum computing for intelligence gathering, data analysis, or surveillance activities.
- Defense Systems: Integration of quantum computing technologies in defense strategies, weapon systems, or cybersecurity measures.

The incorporation must be confirmed by an official announcement or documentation from the Swedish government or relevant national security agencies. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
Temporary or experimental uses do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will an AI system be used to create a detailed psychological profile of Donald Trump by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system is used to create a detailed psychological profile of Donald Trump that meets the following criteria:

- The AI system must utilize machine learning or other artificial intelligence techniques to analyze data and generate the psychological profile.
- The profile must include assessments of personality traits, behavioral tendencies, and potential psychological conditions.
- The profile must be created using data sources such as speeches, interviews, social media activity, or other publicly available information.
- The creation of the profile must be confirmed by a reputable news organization (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through an official announcement from a recognized institution or organization specializing in AI or psychology.

In the event of multiple profiles, the first profile to meet these criteria will be considered for resolution. The question will resolve as No if no such profile is created by the resolution date.

title: Will Catalonia hold a legally recognized independence referendum by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Catalonia holds an independence referendum that meets the following criteria:

- Legally Recognized: The referendum must be officially recognized by the Spanish government or an authoritative international body such as the United Nations or the European Union.
- Public Vote: The referendum must involve a public vote open to the eligible voting population of Catalonia.
- Independence Question: The referendum must explicitly ask voters whether Catalonia should become an independent country, separate from Spain.

Confirmation of the referendum's legal recognition must come from official announcements by the Spanish government or authoritative international bodies. Reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are also acceptable.

If no such referendum is held by the resolution date, this question resolves as No.

title: Will the US Senate pass any major legislation related to foreign policy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States Senate passes any major legislation related to foreign policy. 

"Major legislation" is defined as any bill or joint resolution that significantly impacts U.S. foreign relations or national security, such as treaties, defense agreements, international trade deals, or significant diplomatic initiatives. 

The passage must be confirmed by official records from the United States Senate or reputable news sources such as the New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, or Reuters. 

In case of ambiguity regarding the significance of the legislation, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert analysis from at least three major news organizations. 

If no major legislation is passed by the specified date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party win the 2028 presidential election in the United States?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the candidate from the Democratic Party wins the 2028 United States presidential election. The winning candidate must receive a majority of the electoral votes as certified by the United States Congress during the official count in January 2029. In the event of a dispute or legal challenge, the resolution will be based on the final, certified outcome as determined by the appropriate legal or governmental authority. If the election results are not certified by January 31, 2029, the resolution date will be extended until the final certification is made.

title: Will there be a new nuclear agreement between Iran and the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new nuclear agreement between Iran and the United States is officially announced and documented. 

The agreement must include terms related to the regulation, limitation, or monitoring of Iran's nuclear program and must be recognized by both the Iranian and United States governments. 

The resolution will be based on official announcements from either the United States government (e.g., the White House, State Department) or the Iranian government (e.g., the President of Iran, Ministry of Foreign Affairs). In the absence of official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The agreement must be new, meaning it is not an extension or minor amendment of an existing agreement but a distinct and significant arrangement.

title: Will Amazon integrate AI to fully automate its warehouse operations by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Amazon has fully integrated AI to automate all its warehouse operations. "Fully automate" means that no human intervention is required for the entire process of inventory management, order picking, packing, and shipping within any of Amazon's warehouses. The automation must be confirmed by an official announcement from Amazon or verified through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). Partial automation or automation limited to specific tasks or sections of the warehouse does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI-driven biotechnology innovations lead to a major breakthrough in cancer treatment by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI-driven biotechnology innovation leads to a major breakthrough in cancer treatment, defined by the following criteria:

- The breakthrough must be publicly announced and documented by a reputable medical or scientific organization, such as the American Cancer Society, National Cancer Institute, World Health Organization, or a peer-reviewed medical journal.
- The breakthrough must demonstrate a statistically significant improvement in patient outcomes (e.g., survival rates, remission rates) in clinical trials compared to existing standard-of-care treatments.
- The innovation must be directly attributed to AI-driven biotechnology, meaning that AI played a crucial role in the development or discovery of the treatment.

In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the first to meet these criteria will be considered. If no breakthrough meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Donald Trump launch a tech startup focused on AI or quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Donald Trump launches a tech startup that is publicly stated to focus primarily on artificial intelligence (AI) or quantum computing.

The startup must be registered as a business entity, and there must be a formal announcement or documentation indicating its focus on AI or quantum computing. The announcement can come from Donald Trump himself, a spokesperson, or official company communications.

Verification will rely on reputable news sources, such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or official government or business registration records. If no such announcement or documentation is found by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) pass significant legislation to boost quantum computing research funding by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Democratic Party in the United States successfully passes legislation that significantly increases funding for quantum computing research. 

"Significant legislation" is defined as a law or set of laws that allocate at least $1 billion in new funding specifically for quantum computing research and development. 

The legislation must be signed into law by the President and must be documented in official government records. 

Confirmation of the legislation's passage must come from at least two reputable news sources, such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, or Reuters. 

In case of partial funding or ambiguous cases, the question will resolve as Yes only if the allocated funding meets or exceeds the $1 billion threshold.

title: Will a new species of plant be discovered on a golf course by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new species of plant is discovered on a golf course and meets the following criteria:

- The plant must be identified as a new species by a recognized botanical authority, such as the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew or the United States Botanical Garden.
- The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed botanical journal or confirmed by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The plant must be found on an area officially designated as a golf course at the time of discovery.

If the plant is discovered in an area that was previously a golf course but has since been repurposed, this question will resolve as No. Hybrid or genetically modified plants do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Joe Biden's administration fund a major breakthrough in renewable energy research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Biden administration allocates funding for a project or initiative that leads to a major breakthrough in renewable energy research. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly advances the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, or scalability of renewable energy technologies.

The breakthrough must be recognized as such by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE), the International Energy Agency (IEA), or a peer-reviewed scientific journal. Additionally, the breakthrough must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if any single breakthrough meets the above criteria. If no such breakthrough is recognized by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will France achieve its goal of reducing carbon emissions by 40% from 1990 levels by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, France achieves a reduction in carbon emissions by 40% from 1990 levels. 

The official measurement of carbon emissions must be reported by France's Ministry of Ecological Transition or an equivalent authoritative body. The reduction must be confirmed in official government documentation or reports. 

In the absence of official government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The reduction must be in line with international standards for measuring carbon emissions. Temporary reductions due to extraordinary circumstances (e.g., natural disasters, pandemics) will not count unless they are part of a sustained, long-term trend.

title: Will Google develop a quantum computer that demonstrates clear advantages over classical computers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google develops a quantum computer that demonstrates clear advantages over classical computers in solving at least one practical problem. The demonstration of advantage must meet the following criteria:

1. Performance: The quantum computer must solve a problem faster or more efficiently than the best-known classical algorithm for the same problem.

2. Practical Problem: The problem solved must have practical applications in fields such as cryptography, optimization, material science, or any other domain where quantum computing is expected to have an impact.

3. Verification: The performance and practical advantage must be verified by independent experts in the field and documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by a major conference presentation.

4. Public Announcement: Google must officially announce the achievement, or it must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

In the event of a partial achievement, where the quantum computer shows advantages in limited or specific cases, the question will resolve as Yes only if the achievement is recognized as a significant milestone by the scientific community.

title: Will AI-driven research lead to a major breakthrough in understanding human biology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven research leads to a major breakthrough in understanding human biology. 

A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that significantly advances the field of human biology, such as:
- Identification of a previously unknown biological mechanism or process;
- Development of a novel therapeutic approach with demonstrable efficacy in treating a major disease;
- Creation of a new technology or method that substantially enhances biological research capabilities.

The breakthrough must be recognized and validated by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major scientific conference. 

Additionally, the breakthrough must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will North Korea publicly demonstrate an AI technology that significantly impacts its economy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, North Korea publicly demonstrates an artificial intelligence (AI) technology that has a significant impact on its economy. The criteria for 'significant impact' are as follows:

- The AI technology must be officially announced and demonstrated by the North Korean government.
- The AI technology must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).
- The AI technology must lead to a measurable change in at least one of the following economic indicators by at least 5% compared to the previous year: GDP, industrial output, agricultural productivity, or trade volume.
- The measurable change must be confirmed by data from international organizations such as the United Nations, World Bank, or International Monetary Fund.

If there are conflicting reports on the impact, the consensus of the majority of the reputable sources will be used. If no demonstration occurs or the impact cannot be verified, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will there be a significant political event related to physics research funding in Switzerland before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a significant political event related to physics research funding occurs in Switzerland. A "significant political event" is defined as any of the following:

- A change in government policy that increases or decreases physics research funding by at least 20%.
- The passing of a new law or amendment specifically targeting physics research funding.
- A major political party including a specific pledge about physics research funding in their official platform.
- A public referendum or popular vote deciding on physics research funding.

The event must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to count towards this question's resolution. Internal policy changes within research institutions or minor budget adjustments do not qualify as significant political events.

title: Will a candidate endorsed by DeepMind win a major election before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2029, a candidate endorsed by DeepMind wins a major election. 

A "major election" is defined as a national-level election for a head of state, head of government, or legislative body in any country. 

An endorsement is defined as a public declaration of support for a candidate by DeepMind, through an official statement or press release. 

The candidate must be explicitly mentioned by name in the endorsement. 

Winning is defined as being officially declared the winner of the election by the relevant electoral authority. 

In case of a dispute or recount, the question will resolve based on the final official result. 

If no such endorsement or win occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as No.

title: Will Donald Trump run for the US Congress by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Donald Trump officially files as a candidate to run for a seat in the US Congress (either the House of Representatives or the Senate).
The filing must be confirmed by official government records or announcements. In the absence of official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
If Donald Trump announces an intention to run but does not officially file, this question resolves as No.
If Donald Trump files to run for a different office (e.g., President, Governor), this question resolves as No.

title: Will a significant robotics policy be enacted by the US Congress by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the US Congress passes and the President signs into law a significant robotics policy. A "significant robotics policy" is defined as legislation that specifically addresses the regulation, funding, or development of robotics technology, including but not limited to autonomous systems, AI integration in robotics, or robotics in manufacturing. The policy must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian) as a significant policy change in the field of robotics. If no such policy is enacted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the composition of the US Congress change significantly after the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, after the 2028 elections, there is a significant change in the composition of the US Congress. A 'significant change' is defined as:

- A shift in the majority control of either the House of Representatives or the Senate to a different party.
- An increase or decrease of at least 10% in the number of seats held by any single party in either the House of Representatives or the Senate.

The official results must be confirmed by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or reported by at least three major news organizations (such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

title: Will China lead the world in renewable energy production by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, China is the leading country in renewable energy production, measured in total terawatt-hours (TWh) produced annually from renewable sources, including solar, wind, hydroelectric, and geothermal energy. The primary source for this data will be the International Energy Agency (IEA). In the absence of IEA data, the resolution will be based on reports from at least three of the following reputable sources: BloombergNEF, REN21, BP Statistical Review of World Energy, or major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). If there is a tie in renewable energy production, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant shift in US foreign policy towards China by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a significant shift in US foreign policy towards China, as evidenced by one or more of the following:

- Official changes in treaties, trade agreements, or defense pacts between the US and China.
- Major policy announcements by the US government indicating a shift in diplomatic, economic, or military stance towards China.
- Significant changes in US military presence or activities in the Asia-Pacific region directly related to China.
- Formal statements or documents from the US Department of State or the White House outlining a new strategic approach to China.

The shift must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of such reports, an official announcement from the US government is sufficient.

This question resolves as NO if no such significant shift is confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will Microsoft face any major antitrust actions from the US government by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Microsoft faces major antitrust actions initiated by the US government. Major antitrust actions are defined as:

- Formal charges or lawsuits filed by the United States Department of Justice (DOJ) or the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) alleging violations of federal antitrust laws.
- Consent decrees or settlements requiring significant changes to Microsoft's business practices, structure, or operations to address antitrust concerns.

Confirmation of such actions must come from official announcements or documentation from the DOJ, FTC, or other relevant government bodies. Reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., The New York Times, Washington Post, Wall Street Journal) are also acceptable as confirmation.

If no such actions are taken by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan launch a new space mission related to natural sciences by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Japan officially launches a space mission primarily focused on natural sciences. 
The mission must be publicly announced by JAXA (Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency) or any other official Japanese government body responsible for space missions. 
The natural sciences include, but are not limited to, astronomy, earth sciences, planetary science, and life sciences. 
The mission must reach at least the launch phase to be considered. Announcements of planned missions or missions that are canceled before launch do not count towards this question's resolution. 
Confirmation of the launch must come from either JAXA or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Israel announce a major breakthrough in renewable energy technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Israel announces a major breakthrough in renewable energy technology. A 'major breakthrough' is defined as a development that significantly advances the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, or scalability of renewable energy sources (e.g., solar, wind, bioenergy, hydro, geothermal).

The breakthrough must be confirmed through an official announcement by an Israeli government agency (e.g., Ministry of Energy) or a reputable Israeli research institution (e.g., Technion – Israel Institute of Technology).

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The breakthrough must be recognized by the international scientific community, evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals or presentations at major scientific conferences.

Incremental improvements or announcements of future potential breakthroughs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the US Congress pass legislation significantly increasing funding for climate change research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the United States Congress passes legislation that meets the following criteria:

- The legislation must explicitly allocate additional funding for climate change research.
- The increase in funding must be at least 50% greater than the average annual funding for climate change research over the previous five years.
- The legislation must be signed into law by the President of the United States.

For the purposes of this question, 'climate change research' includes research related to understanding, mitigating, and adapting to climate change, as conducted by governmental agencies, universities, or other research institutions. The passage of the legislation must be reported by at least three reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or Reuters.

title: Will North Korea launch a satellite for scientific research purposes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, North Korea successfully launches a satellite specifically for scientific research purposes.

The satellite must be designed primarily for scientific research, such as Earth observation, space science, or atmospheric studies, rather than for military or communication purposes. The launch must be confirmed by an official announcement from the North Korean government or verified by credible reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

The satellite must reach its intended orbit and be operational. In the event of multiple launches, only the first successful launch will be considered for this question's resolution.

title: Will an AI algorithm predict the value of the US dollar with over 95% accuracy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI algorithm is developed that can predict the value of the US dollar against a basket of major currencies (including but not limited to the Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, and Swiss Franc) with an accuracy of at least 95% over a period of at least one year.

The accuracy must be validated by an independent financial or academic institution, such as the Federal Reserve, European Central Bank, or a top-tier university's economics department.

The prediction accuracy should be based on daily closing values and must account for at least 95% of the variance (R^2 ≥ 0.95) in the actual values over the specified period.

Reports or claims by the developing entity alone are not sufficient; independent verification and publication in a peer-reviewed financial or economic journal are required. In case of multiple claims, the first verified instance will be considered for resolution.

Temporary or short-term predictions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States implement regulations on AI technologies developed by OpenAI before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the United States government officially implements regulations specifically targeting AI technologies developed by OpenAI. The regulations must be enacted through federal legislation, executive orders, or formal regulatory agency rules explicitly mentioning OpenAI or its AI technologies.

The implementation of such regulations must be confirmed by official government documentation or announcements. In the absence of official documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient.

Regulations that apply generally to all AI technologies or companies, without specifically targeting OpenAI, do not count towards this question's resolution. The regulations must be in effect, not merely proposed or under consideration.

title: Will Microsoft be involved in any major political scandals in the United States before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Microsoft is confirmed to be involved in a major political scandal in the United States. A 'major political scandal' is defined as an event involving Microsoft that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Results in a formal investigation by a U.S. Congressional committee or a federal agency (e.g., FBI, SEC).
- Leads to the resignation or dismissal of a high-ranking Microsoft executive (e.g., CEO, President, or Board Member) due to political reasons.
- Is widely reported as a major scandal by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The involvement of Microsoft must be direct and significant, not merely tangential or incidental. This question resolves as NO if no such scandal is confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will North Korea conduct a successful intercontinental ballistic missile test by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, North Korea successfully conducts an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) test that meets the following criteria:

- The missile must travel a minimum distance of 5,500 kilometers (3,418 miles).
- The missile must be launched from North Korean territory and reach its intended target area without any major malfunctions or deviations from its planned trajectory.
- The success of the test must be confirmed by at least three credible sources, such as major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or official government statements from countries with satellite monitoring capabilities (e.g., the United States, South Korea, Japan).

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the majority of credible sources.

title: Will Ukraine hold a presidential election by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Ukraine holds a presidential election that meets the following criteria:

- The election must be officially recognized by the Ukrainian government and international observers such as the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE) or the United Nations (UN).
- The election must be open to the general public and follow the standard democratic process, including campaigning, voting, and the announcement of results.
- The election must be deemed free and fair by at least two reputable international monitoring organizations (e.g., OSCE, UN, European Union).

If the election is postponed or canceled for any reason, this question will resolve as No unless a new election date is officially announced and takes place before the resolution date.

title: Will there be significant election-related events in any country related to soccer by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there are significant election-related events in any country directly related to soccer. 

"Significant election-related events" are defined as:
- National elections being influenced or having campaigns centered around soccer-related issues (e.g., policies affecting national soccer leagues, major soccer events like the World Cup, or soccer-related corruption scandals).
- Official statements or documents from government bodies or major political parties explicitly linking election outcomes or campaigns to soccer-related issues.
- Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the influence of soccer on election outcomes or campaigns.

The event must be directly related to soccer and not merely involve a politician or candidate who is a soccer fan or has a background in soccer. The influence must be substantial enough to be a major talking point in the election.

title: Will California implement state-wide regulations for the use of robotics in public services by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, California enacts state-wide regulations specifically governing the use of robotics in public services. 

"Robotics in public services" refers to the deployment of robotic systems in services provided by the state, such as healthcare, law enforcement, public transportation, sanitation, and other government-operated services.

The regulations must be officially passed by the California State Legislature and signed into law by the Governor. 

The enactment of such regulations must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary regulations or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution. The regulations must be intended for long-term implementation and cover the entire state of California.

title: Will there be a significant geopolitical conflict involving the use of advanced robotics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there is a significant geopolitical conflict involving the use of advanced robotics. 

A "significant geopolitical conflict" is defined as a conflict between two or more nations or organized groups within nations that results in at least 1,000 combat-related fatalities, as reported by reputable sources such as the BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, or Washington Post.

"Advanced robotics" refers to autonomous or semi-autonomous robots that can perform complex tasks without human intervention, including but not limited to, drones, unmanned ground vehicles, or robotic soldiers.

The involvement of advanced robotics must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The conflict must be recognized as ongoing or having occurred within the specified timeframe.

title: Will there be a significant scientific discovery related to the natural environment in Israel by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant scientific discovery related to the natural environment in Israel is announced and recognized by the scientific community. 

A "significant scientific discovery" is defined as a discovery that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal with an impact factor of at least 5.
- Recognized by a major scientific award or honor.
- Cited by at least 10 peer-reviewed articles within two years of publication.

The discovery must be directly related to the natural environment in Israel, which includes but is not limited to: biodiversity, ecosystems, climate, geology, and natural resources. 

Confirmation of the discovery must come from reputable sources such as scientific journals, major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), or official announcements from recognized scientific institutions.

In the event of ambiguity or dispute, the resolution will be based on the consensus of experts in the relevant field.

title: Will there be a significant scientific discovery in the field of natural sciences that impacts the sport of Baseball by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a significant scientific discovery in the field of natural sciences (such as biology, chemistry, or physics) is announced and recognized by the scientific community, and it has a direct and substantial impact on the sport of Baseball. 

The impact must be evident through one or more of the following:
- Changes to the official rules or regulations of Baseball by a major governing body (e.g., Major League Baseball).
- Adoption of new practices, techniques, or equipment in professional Baseball that are directly attributed to the scientific discovery.
- Widespread media coverage in reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) linking the scientific discovery to changes or advancements in Baseball.

The scientific discovery must be validated by peer-reviewed publication or endorsement by a recognized scientific authority. The question resolves as NO if no such discovery is announced and recognized by the resolution date.

title: Will a new geopolitical alliance involving major basketball-playing nations be formed by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new geopolitical alliance is officially formed involving at least three nations recognized for their significant contributions to international basketball. 

The alliance must meet the following criteria:
- The participating nations must be officially recognized by FIBA (International Basketball Federation) as having national basketball teams that have competed in international tournaments.
- The formation of the alliance must be confirmed by official government announcements from each of the participating nations or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The alliance must have a formal agreement or treaty outlining its objectives, which may include, but are not limited to, cooperation in sports, economic collaboration, or political alignment.

Temporary or informal agreements, or alliances formed solely for specific events, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the US Congress pass significant legislation related to California by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the United States Congress passes legislation that meets the following criteria:

- The legislation must specifically address issues or policies directly related to the state of California.
- The legislation must be signed into law by the President of the United States.
- The legislation must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters).

For the purposes of this question, 'significant legislation' is defined as:
- Any federal law that allocates at least $1 billion in funding to California-specific projects or initiatives.
- Any federal law that enacts substantial regulatory changes affecting California.
- Any federal law that addresses major social, economic, environmental, or political issues specific to California.

In the event of multiple pieces of legislation, the question resolves as Yes upon the passage of the first qualifying law.

title: Will a third-party candidate win a significant number of electoral votes in the United States presidential election by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a third-party candidate wins at least one electoral vote in the United States presidential election. A 'third-party candidate' is defined as any candidate not representing the Democratic or Republican parties. The win must be confirmed by official results from the Federal Election Commission (FEC). In the event of a dispute, the question will resolve based on the consensus of three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

title: Will the European Union expand to include more than 30 member states by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union (EU) officially expands to include more than 30 member states. The official expansion must be confirmed by an announcement from the European Union or documentation from an official EU source. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or provisional memberships do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will China implement a nationwide policy on AI ethics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the government of China officially implements a nationwide policy specifically focused on AI ethics.

The policy must include guidelines or regulations addressing ethical considerations in the development, deployment, and use of artificial intelligence technologies.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Local or regional policies, or policies that do not specifically focus on AI ethics, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a breakthrough in quantum computing significantly advance AI algorithms by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a breakthrough in quantum computing significantly advances AI algorithms. 

A "breakthrough in quantum computing" is defined as a development that achieves at least one of the following:
- Quantum Supremacy: Demonstration of a quantum computer solving a problem that classical computers practically cannot.
- Quantum Advantage: Demonstration of a quantum computer performing a task significantly faster or more efficiently than the best-known classical algorithms for the same task.

A "significant advance in AI algorithms" is defined as one of the following:
- Improvement in AI performance metrics (e.g., accuracy, speed, efficiency) by at least 50% over the best classical algorithms, as validated by peer-reviewed publications.
- Development of new AI algorithms or models that were previously infeasible without quantum computing, as evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals or presentations at major AI conferences.

The breakthrough must be confirmed by credible sources such as peer-reviewed scientific journals, major AI or quantum computing conferences, or official announcements from leading research institutions (e.g., MIT, Stanford, Google AI, IBM Research).

title: Will the European Union implement a standardized electronic voting system for all member states by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements a standardized electronic voting system that is used across all its member states for at least one election.

The system must meet the following criteria:
- The system must be officially recognized and endorsed by the European Commission.
- It must be used in at least one general election or EU-wide election in each member state.
- The system must include provisions for voter authentication, vote recording, and result tallying.
- The system must be certified for security and integrity by an independent body recognized by the EU.

Confirmation of implementation must come from an official EU announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Partial implementations, pilot programs, or systems used only at the local or regional level do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major cybersecurity incident influence the outcome of a national election by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a major cybersecurity incident demonstrably influences the outcome of a national election in any country.

A 'major cybersecurity incident' is defined as a cyber attack or breach that significantly disrupts or alters the electoral process, voter data, or election results. Examples include but are not limited to:
- Hacking of voting machines or election infrastructure resulting in altered vote counts.
- Unauthorized access to and dissemination of sensitive voter information leading to voter suppression or manipulation.
- Cyber attacks on political parties or candidates that lead to significant changes in voter behavior.

The influence on the election outcome must be confirmed by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or an official government investigation. The incident must be widely recognized as having a decisive impact on the election results, not merely causing disruptions or delays.

In the case of multiple incidents, the question will resolve as Yes if any single incident meets the criteria above.

title: Will the Chinese government take significant political actions in the context of the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Chinese government takes any of the following significant political actions in the context of the Russo-Ukrainian War:

1. Military Intervention: Deployment of Chinese military forces in support of either Russia or Ukraine.
2. Diplomatic Mediation: Officially brokered a peace agreement or ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine, recognized by both parties.
3. Economic Sanctions: Imposition of significant economic sanctions against either Russia or Ukraine, officially announced by the Chinese government.
4. Military Aid: Provision of substantial military aid (weapons, technology, intelligence) to either Russia or Ukraine, officially confirmed by the Chinese government or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of official announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient for resolution.

Temporary or symbolic actions, such as brief diplomatic statements or minor economic measures, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major geopolitical event affect the FIFA World Cup by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a major geopolitical event causes one or more of the following to occur in relation to the FIFA World Cup:

- Cancellation or postponement of the tournament.
- Withdrawal of three or more participating national teams.
- Change of the host country.

A 'major geopolitical event' is defined as an event involving political, military, or economic actions between nations or significant internal conflicts within a nation that are widely reported by reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

The resolution will be based on official announcements from FIFA or credible reports from at least three major news organizations.

title: Will a geopolitical event lead to the relocation of an MLB team by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a Major League Baseball (MLB) team relocates due to a geopolitical event. A 'geopolitical event' is defined as an event involving political, economic, or military actions between two or more countries that significantly impacts the team's ability to operate in its current location.

The relocation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the MLB or the team itself. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary relocations (e.g., for a season) do not count; the relocation must be intended as permanent. The question resolves as No if no such relocation occurs by the specified date.

title: Will Gavin Newsom win the California gubernatorial election in 2028?
body:
