This question will resolve as Yes if Gavin Newsom is declared the winner of the California gubernatorial election in 2028.

The declaration must be made by the California Secretary of State, who is the authoritative source for election results in California.

In the event of a recount or legal challenge, the resolution will be based on the final certified result as announced by the California Secretary of State.

If Gavin Newsom is unable to complete the campaign due to unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the 2028 United States presidential election have a voter turnout higher than 60%?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the official voter turnout for the 2028 United States presidential election is greater than 60%. The official voter turnout is defined as the percentage of eligible voters who cast a ballot in the election.

The official source for this data will be the United States Federal Election Commission (FEC). If the FEC does not provide the data by the resolution date, reputable sources such as the United States Census Bureau or major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian) will be used.

In the event of discrepancies between sources, the FEC data will take precedence. If FEC data is unavailable, the majority consensus among the other sources will be used.

title: Will China implement a national quantum computing network by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, China has officially implemented a national quantum computing network. The network must meet the following criteria:

- National Scope: The network must connect multiple quantum computers across different regions of China, forming an integrated system.
- Operational Status: The network must be fully operational, not in a trial or experimental phase.
- Official Confirmation: The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from a recognized Chinese authority, such as the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) or the Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS).
- Independent Verification: In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Xinhua News Agency, China Daily, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient.

Edge Cases:
- Partial Deployments: If the network is only partially deployed or operational in limited areas, the question will resolve as No unless there is a clear and official plan for nationwide expansion within the specified timeframe.
- Temporary Implementations: Temporary or event-specific implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Google release a groundbreaking AI product by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google releases an AI product that is widely recognized as groundbreaking by the tech community. For the purposes of this question, "groundbreaking" is defined as a product that introduces a significant technological advancement or a new application of AI that has not been previously achieved or widely adopted. The product must be recognized as groundbreaking by at least two of the following sources: MIT Technology Review, Wired, TechCrunch, The Verge, or a peer-reviewed AI journal. The product must be publicly available and not just a demonstration or prototype. If no such product is released by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the European Union implement new regulations on genetically modified organisms (GMOs) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements new regulations specifically targeting genetically modified organisms (GMOs).

The new regulations must be confirmed through an official announcement in the Official Journal of the European Union or through a press release from the European Commission.

The regulations must be distinct from any amendments to existing policies and should include at least one of the following:

- New labeling requirements for GMO products;
- New safety or environmental impact assessments for GMO products;
- New restrictions or bans on specific GMO products or practices.

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If no new regulations are implemented by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a major breakthrough in climate change research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a major breakthrough in climate change research is announced and recognized by the scientific community. A 'major breakthrough' is defined as any of the following:

- Discovery of a new, highly effective method for reducing greenhouse gas emissions that is both scalable and economically viable.
- Development of a new technology or scientific method that significantly enhances our ability to mitigate or adapt to climate change impacts.
- A new, comprehensive understanding of climate change mechanisms that leads to a significant shift in the scientific consensus on climate change.

The breakthrough must be confirmed by at least two of the following sources: a peer-reviewed scientific journal, a major scientific conference, or an official statement from a recognized scientific organization such as the IPCC, NASA, or NOAA. In the absence of such confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In case of multiple potential breakthroughs, the first to be confirmed by the required sources will be considered for this question's resolution.

title: Will a quantum computer solve a problem currently intractable for classical computers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum computer successfully solves a problem that is currently considered intractable for classical computers. The criteria for intractability are:

- The problem must be one that is widely recognized in the computational complexity community as intractable for classical computers, such as those in the complexity class NP-hard or beyond.
- The solution must be verified and accepted by at least two independent experts in the field of quantum computing.
- The results must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.

In the event of any ambiguity, the resolution will be based on a consensus of experts in the field, with a fallback to a review by a panel of at least three independent experts if no consensus can be reached.

title: Will advancements in computing technology lead to significant breakthroughs in biological research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, advancements in computing technology lead to at least one of the following significant breakthroughs in biological research:

- Development of a new drug or treatment that receives approval from a major regulatory body (e.g., FDA, EMA) and demonstrates a substantial improvement over existing therapies for a specific disease or condition.
- Discovery of a new biological pathway or mechanism that is widely accepted by the scientific community and leads to a paradigm shift in understanding a major biological process.
- Creation of a computational model that accurately predicts complex biological phenomena (e.g., protein folding, gene expression) and is validated through experimental data.

The breakthrough must be documented in at least two peer-reviewed scientific journals or confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in quantum algorithms for solving complex problems by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a quantum algorithm is developed and publicly demonstrated that provides a significant breakthrough in solving complex problems, defined as achieving a substantial improvement in efficiency or capability over classical algorithms for the same problem. The breakthrough must be recognized by the scientific community and reported in reputable sources such as peer-reviewed journals or major scientific conferences. A 'significant breakthrough' is defined as one that either: - Solves a previously unsolved problem. - Provides a polynomial-time solution to a problem previously thought to require exponential time. - Demonstrates a quantum speedup that is exponentially faster than the best-known classical algorithms. Verification must come from credible sources such as Nature, Science, or official announcements from research institutions like MIT, Caltech, or equivalent.

title: Will the US dollar be replaced as the world's primary reserve currency by a digital currency by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a digital currency becomes the primary reserve currency of the world, replacing the US dollar. 

A "digital currency" is defined as a form of currency that is available only in digital or electronic form, and not in physical form such as paper money or coins. This includes cryptocurrencies, central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), and other forms of digital assets. 

"Primary reserve currency" is defined as the currency that is held in significant quantities by governments and institutions as part of their foreign exchange reserves and is widely used in international trade and finance. 

The determination will be based on reports from at least three of the following reputable sources: 
- International Monetary Fund (IMF)
- Bank for International Settlements (BIS)
- World Bank
- Financial Times
- Bloomberg
- Reuters
- The Wall Street Journal

In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve as Yes if a majority of the sources listed above agree that a digital currency has replaced the US dollar as the primary reserve currency.

title: Will Joe Biden publicly endorse a major advancement in quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Joe Biden, in his capacity as a public figure, makes a public endorsement or statement recognizing a specific major advancement in quantum computing. 

A 'major advancement' in quantum computing is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:
- Achievement of quantum supremacy, where a quantum computer performs a calculation that is infeasible for any classical computer.
- Development of a quantum computer with at least 100 qubits that demonstrates significant error correction capabilities.
- A breakthrough that leads to a practical, scalable quantum computer that can solve real-world problems more efficiently than classical computers.

The endorsement or statement must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

In the event that Joe Biden is no longer alive or incapacitated, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan hold a national referendum on constitutional revision before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Japan holds a national referendum specifically addressing constitutional revision. The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the Japanese government and its primary purpose must be the amendment or revision of one or more articles of the Japanese Constitution. 

The announcement of the referendum must be confirmed by an official government declaration or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (NHK, Asahi Shimbun, The Japan Times, Reuters) are sufficient. 

If the referendum is postponed or canceled, or if the referendum addresses issues other than constitutional revision, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Amazon face a major antitrust lawsuit in the United States before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Amazon faces a major antitrust lawsuit in the United States. 

A 'major antitrust lawsuit' is defined as a lawsuit filed by the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ), the Federal Trade Commission (FTC), or a coalition of state attorneys general alleging violations of federal or state antitrust laws. 

The lawsuit must specifically target Amazon's business practices, rather than being part of a broader industry-wide investigation. 

For the purposes of this question, the lawsuit is considered to have been 'faced' by Amazon if it is formally filed in a U.S. court. 

The resolution will be based on official announcements from the DOJ, FTC, or state attorneys general, or credible reporting from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

title: Will a new political party gain a significant presence in any major European country's parliament by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a newly established political party (founded after January 1, 2023) gains a significant presence in the national parliament of any major European country. A "significant presence" is defined as:

- Winning at least 10% of the seats in the national parliament, or
- Becoming part of the ruling coalition government.

Major European countries are defined as Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Italy, and Spain. 

The outcome must be confirmed by official election results or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will an AI system created during Joe Biden's presidency win a major international AI competition by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system created during Joe Biden's presidency (January 20, 2021 - January 20, 2025) wins a major international AI competition.

A "major international AI competition" is defined as one of the following:
- The International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI)
- The Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)
- The Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) Conference
- The Turing Test competition
- The DARPA Grand Challenge

Winning is defined as achieving first place or being declared the overall winner by the competition's official judging panel.

The AI system must be publicly acknowledged as having been created during Joe Biden's presidency, either through official documentation, credible news reports (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post), or statements from the creators or affiliated institutions.

In case of ambiguity or dispute, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert opinions from at least three reputable AI researchers or organizations.

title: Will Emmanuel Macron still be the President of France in 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Emmanuel Macron is the President of France at any point on December 31, 2027. 
Official confirmation must come from a reputable source such as the official French government website, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, or Washington Post. 
If Macron resigns, is impeached, or otherwise leaves office before this date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant advancement in robotics impacting international relations by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a significant advancement in robotics is reported to have a measurable impact on international relations. 

A "significant advancement in robotics" is defined as a technological development or innovation in robotics that is recognized by leading robotics or AI organizations (such as IEEE or AAAI) as groundbreaking or transformative. 

"Impacting international relations" means the advancement must lead to one or more of the following outcomes:

1. Official diplomatic statements or policy changes by at least two countries referencing the advancement.
2. Coverage by at least three major international news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) discussing the advancement in the context of international relations.
3. The advancement being a topic of discussion at a major international summit or conference (e.g., United Nations General Assembly, G20, or World Economic Forum).

The significance and impact must be corroborated by credible sources and recognized by experts in the field.

title: Will there be a groundbreaking discovery in the field of Medicine by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a groundbreaking discovery in the field of Medicine is announced and meets the following criteria:

- The discovery must significantly advance medical science or practice, such as a new treatment, cure, or diagnostic tool that addresses a major health issue.
- The discovery must be recognized and documented in a peer-reviewed medical journal or presented at a major medical conference.
- The discovery must receive widespread recognition and validation from the medical community, including endorsements or confirmations from at least two reputable medical organizations (e.g., American Medical Association, World Health Organization, National Institutes of Health).

In the event of multiple discoveries, the first one to meet the criteria will be considered for the resolution. If no such discovery is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Amazon be involved in the development of any election-related technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Amazon is confirmed to be involved in the development of any technology specifically designed for use in elections. This includes, but is not limited to, electronic voting systems, voter registration systems, election security technologies, and election result reporting systems. 

The involvement must be publicly acknowledged by Amazon through an official statement or press release. Alternatively, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The technology must be intended for use in official governmental elections. Technology developed for private organizations or non-governmental elections does not count. 

If Amazon's involvement is limited to providing general-purpose technology (e.g., cloud services) without specific modifications or applications for elections, this question resolves as No.

title: Will a Republican Party (US) administration implement new federal regulations on artificial intelligence by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a Republican Party administration in the United States implements new federal regulations specifically targeting artificial intelligence (AI). The regulations must be officially enacted and come into effect within this timeframe. The regulations must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation, such as publication in the Federal Register. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The regulations must pertain specifically to AI and not be part of broader legislation unless the AI-specific sections are clearly delineated and independently actionable.

title: Will NATO adopt a unified quantum computing strategy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, NATO officially adopts a unified strategy for quantum computing. The strategy must be documented in an official NATO publication or announcement and must outline specific goals, timelines, and collaborative efforts among member countries for the development and deployment of quantum computing technologies.

The adoption of such a strategy must be confirmed by an official NATO press release or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The strategy must be comprehensive, addressing both military and non-military applications of quantum computing. Partial or preliminary strategies that do not encompass the full scope of quantum computing applications will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI technology play a significant role in global politics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI technology is confirmed to play a significant role in global politics. 'Significant role' is defined as AI being used in at least one of the following ways:
- AI systems being officially employed by at least one national government for decision-making in policy or governance.
- AI being used to influence or determine the outcome of a national election, as confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
- AI-driven systems being recognized as primary tools in international diplomatic negotiations or conflict resolutions by reputable sources.

The role of AI must be acknowledged by an authoritative source such as an official government statement, a recognized international organization (e.g., United Nations), or credible reports from at least three major news organizations as listed above.

The question will resolve as No if no such confirmation is made by the resolution date.

title: Will Google develop a general AI that passes the Turing Test by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google develops a general artificial intelligence (AI) that successfully passes the Turing Test.

For the purpose of this question, the Turing Test is defined as a test where the AI engages in a series of conversations with human judges and is indistinguishable from a human at least 70% of the time over a series of at least 10 conversations, each lasting at least 5 minutes.

The successful passing of the Turing Test must be confirmed by an official announcement from Google or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

title: Will a Major League Baseball (MLB) team adopt a significant new technology for performance enhancement by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any Major League Baseball (MLB) team officially adopts a significant new technology specifically aimed at enhancing player performance. 

"Significant new technology" is defined as a technology that is novel and not widely used in MLB as of the start of the 2024 season. Examples may include, but are not limited to, advanced wearable devices, AI-driven performance analytics, or novel training equipment.

The adoption must be confirmed through an official announcement by the team or MLB, or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The New York Times, The Washington Post). 

The technology must be intended for regular-season use and not merely for experimental or trial purposes. Temporary or one-off uses do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant scientific collaboration between Iran and another country in the field of natural sciences by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is an officially recognized significant scientific collaboration between Iran and another country in the field of natural sciences. 

A "significant scientific collaboration" is defined as a joint research project, co-authored publications, or shared scientific initiatives that are acknowledged by at least one reputable scientific organization or institution in Iran and the collaborating country. 

The collaboration must be documented through official announcements or publications in reputable scientific journals. 

In the absence of official announcements, reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, Reuters, The Guardian, New York Times) confirming the collaboration are sufficient. 

Collaborations in other fields (e.g., social sciences, engineering) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will France develop a government-backed AI research lab by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the French government officially establishes and backs a research laboratory dedicated to artificial intelligence (AI). The lab must meet the following criteria:

- Official Government Backing: The lab must be publicly announced and funded by the French government.
- Dedicated to AI: The primary focus of the lab must be on AI research and development.
- Operational Status: The lab must be operational and conducting research, not merely announced or in the planning stages.

Verification will be based on an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Le Monde) are sufficient.

title: Will the Republican Party (US) endorse a major federal investment in blockchain technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Republican Party of the United States officially endorses a major federal investment in blockchain technology. 

"Major federal investment" is defined as a commitment of at least $1 billion in federal funding towards blockchain technology development or implementation. 

The endorsement must be made through an official party platform, public statement by the party leadership, or inclusion in a legislative proposal sponsored or co-sponsored by a significant number of Republican members of Congress. 

Reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the endorsement are also acceptable. 

If no such endorsement is made by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will OpenAI develop a tool to predict election outcomes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, OpenAI officially releases a tool designed to predict election outcomes. The tool must meet the following criteria:

- The tool must be publicly accessible or available for use by third parties (e.g., government agencies, media organizations, research institutions).
- The tool must be explicitly described by OpenAI as intended for predicting election outcomes.
- The tool must be capable of predicting the outcomes of at least three different elections (e.g., national, regional, local) with a documented accuracy rate of at least 70% in each case.

Confirmation of the tool's release and its capabilities must come from an official OpenAI announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if the tool is not released by the resolution date or if it does not meet the above criteria.

title: Will a major baseball team use quantum computing to optimize player performance and strategy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major baseball team (defined as a team in Major League Baseball or Nippon Professional Baseball) publicly announces the use of quantum computing to optimize player performance and strategy. The optimization must include at least one of the following: player training, in-game strategy, or injury prevention. The announcement must come from an official team source or be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, ESPN). In the event of partial implementation or trial phases, the system must be actively used in regular-season games for the question to resolve as Yes.

title: Will there be a fully autonomous robotic system used in any national election process by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a fully autonomous robotic system is used in any national election process. A 'fully autonomous robotic system' is defined as a system capable of performing election-related tasks without human intervention, including but not limited to voter registration, vote casting, vote counting, and result verification. The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient. The system must be operational and used in an official capacity, not in a trial phase. Temporary deployments for specific events or use in local elections do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be significant changes in the geopolitical landscape of Eastern Europe involving Ukraine and Russia by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there are significant geopolitical changes involving Ukraine and Russia. 'Significant geopolitical changes' are defined as:

- Major territorial changes recognized by the United Nations or at least three major countries (e.g., USA, China, UK, France, Germany).
- A formal peace treaty or a major escalation of conflict, confirmed by major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- Major political changes such as regime change in either country, recognized by major news organizations as defined above.

In the case of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the question will resolve based on the consensus of major news organizations.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to significantly enhance baseball analytics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) is used to significantly enhance baseball analytics in any of the following ways:

- Player Performance: AI models are used to accurately predict player performance metrics (e.g., batting averages, pitching success rates) with at least 85% accuracy over a season.
- Game Strategy: AI systems are used by at least one Major League Baseball (MLB) team to make real-time strategic decisions during games, such as pitching changes, defensive alignments, or batting orders.
- Scouting and Recruitment: AI is used to identify and recruit talent, with at least one MLB team publicly acknowledging the AI's role in the successful recruitment of a player who performs above league average in their first season.
- Injury Prevention: AI-based systems are used to predict and prevent player injuries, with at least one MLB team reporting a statistically significant reduction in injury rates attributable to AI intervention.

The use of AI must be confirmed by an official announcement from an MLB team, the MLB organization, or credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic). The AI systems must be operational and not in a trial phase. Temporary or experimental uses do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI-driven technologies be implemented in NBA training programs by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, at least one NBA team officially implements AI-driven technologies as part of their regular training programs. 

"AI-driven technologies" are defined as systems or tools that utilize artificial intelligence to analyze player performance, optimize training routines, or provide real-time feedback. 

The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the NBA team or organization. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic, BBC Sport) are sufficient. 

The AI-driven technology must be used consistently in training sessions and not just for experimental or trial purposes. Temporary or one-off uses of AI-driven technologies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States develop a quantum computer that outperforms classical supercomputers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a quantum computer developed in the United States demonstrates computational performance that surpasses the capabilities of the most powerful classical supercomputers as of 2024 in solving at least one type of problem.

The quantum computer's performance must be verified by a credible, independent authority in the field of quantum computing, such as the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) or a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

The problem solved must be one where classical supercomputers have been previously tested and benchmarked. The quantum computer must show a clear computational advantage in terms of speed, accuracy, or resource efficiency.

This question resolves as No if no such demonstration is made by the resolution date, or if the performance claims are not independently verified.

title: Will NATO countries collectively invest over $10 billion in AI research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, NATO countries collectively invest over $10 billion in AI research. The following criteria must be met:

1. The investment must be officially announced by NATO or its member countries' government bodies.
2. The investment can be in the form of direct funding, grants, or contracts specifically earmarked for AI research.
3. The total investment amount will be calculated in USD, based on official exchange rates at the time of the announcement.
4. Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the investment amount.

In case of partial or ambiguous announcements, the question will resolve as Yes if the cumulative total of confirmed investments meets or exceeds $10 billion USD.

title: Will there be any significant political movements related to Machine Learning in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there are significant political movements in the United States explicitly related to Machine Learning (ML). 

A "significant political movement" is defined as any of the following:
- The formation of a new political party or political action committee (PAC) centered around ML policies.
- The introduction and substantial progress of federal or state legislation specifically addressing ML regulations, ethics, or development.
- Major political campaigns or platforms (e.g., presidential, gubernatorial, or congressional) that prominently feature ML as a core issue.

Verification will be based on official government records, announcements, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

In the event of ambiguity or partial fulfillment, the question will be resolved based on the preponderance of evidence from the aforementioned sources.

title: Will a new political party gain significant influence in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new political party meets any of the following criteria:
- Wins at least 5% of the popular vote in a presidential election.
- Secures at least 5 seats in the House of Representatives or 1 seat in the Senate.
- Gains official recognition in at least 10 states, allowing it to place candidates on the ballot without requiring petition signatures.

The new political party must not be a rebranding or renaming of an existing party. Verification will be based on official election results and state recognition documents. In the absence of official documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will Switzerland become a global leader in quantum computing research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland is recognized as a global leader in quantum computing research based on the following criteria:

- Publication Impact: Switzerland-based researchers must have published at least 50 peer-reviewed papers in top-tier journals (e.g., Nature, Science, Physical Review Letters) on quantum computing topics within the last five years.
- Research Funding: Switzerland must rank within the top three countries globally for government and private sector funding dedicated to quantum computing research, as reported by reputable sources such as OECD or UNESCO.
- International Collaborations: Swiss institutions must be involved in at least five major international quantum computing research collaborations or projects, as recognized by leading scientific bodies or consortia (e.g., Quantum Flagship, IBM Q Network).
- Technological Breakthroughs: Swiss researchers or institutions must have achieved at least three significant technological breakthroughs in quantum computing, as recognized by major technology publications (e.g., MIT Technology Review, IEEE Spectrum).

The resolution of this question will be based on reports and data from authoritative sources such as the OECD, UNESCO, major scientific journals, and leading technology publications. In the absence of a clear consensus, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant political movement related to black hole research before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a significant political movement related to black hole research is publicly recognized. A "significant political movement" is defined as one that meets at least two of the following criteria:

- The movement has at least 100,000 documented supporters or members.
- The movement has been covered by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The movement has led to the introduction of legislation or policy changes at a national or international level.
- The movement has organized at least one large-scale public demonstration or event with over 10,000 participants.

The recognition of the movement must be confirmed by reputable sources such as major news organizations or official government announcements.

title: Will there be significant electoral reforms in Iran by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, significant electoral reforms are officially enacted in Iran. 'Significant electoral reforms' are defined as changes that meet at least one of the following criteria:

- Introduction of new laws or amendments to existing laws that fundamentally alter the electoral process, such as the introduction of proportional representation, changes to the candidate vetting process, or the establishment of independent electoral oversight bodies.
- Official government announcements or legislative documents confirming the enactment of these reforms.
- Verification from reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that these reforms have been enacted.

The reforms must be implemented and not merely proposed or debated. In the event of partial implementation, the question will resolve as Yes if the reforms are intended for nationwide application and have begun to be enacted in at least one province or major city.

title: Will China implement online voting for its citizens by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the People's Republic of China officially implements an online voting system that allows its citizens to cast votes in national-level elections through the internet. The system must be officially announced and documented by the Chinese government and must be used in at least one national-level election. Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the implementation and use of the system are sufficient in the absence of an official announcement. Trials or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will an AI system be developed that can predict Taiwan's GDP growth rate by 2028?
body:
This question resolves as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system is developed that can predict Taiwan's GDP growth rate for the following year with an accuracy of at least 90%.

The AI system must be trained on historical economic data and use machine learning techniques to generate its predictions. The accuracy of the AI system's predictions must be validated by comparing its forecasted GDP growth rate for the year 2029 against the actual GDP growth rate reported by Taiwan's Directorate-General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics (DGBAS).

The AI system must be publicly documented in a peer-reviewed journal or presented at a major AI or economic conference. The validation of its accuracy must be confirmed by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will AI be used to analyze voting patterns in the US House of Representatives by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI is used to analyze voting patterns in the US House of Representatives in an official capacity. The use of AI must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from the US House of Representatives. Alternatively, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The AI system must be used for analyzing voting patterns, not just for data collection or storage. Temporary or experimental uses do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major geopolitical event be directly influenced by a medical breakthrough by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major geopolitical event is directly influenced by a medical breakthrough. A "major geopolitical event" is defined as any significant political, economic, or military change involving at least one country. Examples include changes in national leadership, significant policy shifts, international treaties, or military conflicts. A "medical breakthrough" is defined as a new medical treatment, vaccine, or technology that receives widespread recognition and is reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The direct influence must be clearly established through credible reports from these news organizations or through official government statements. In the absence of clear direct influence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Germany hold a national referendum on any major policy before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Germany holds a national referendum on any major policy. A 'national referendum' is defined as a vote in which the entire eligible voting population of Germany is invited to participate to make a decision on a specific policy issue.

A 'major policy' refers to significant legislative, economic, or social issues that have nationwide implications. The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the German government and widely covered by reputable news organizations such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, and Washington Post.

Local or regional referendums, internal party votes, or non-binding advisory referendums do not count towards this question's resolution. The question resolves as Yes if the referendum is held, regardless of the outcome of the vote.

title: Will a candidate with a background in Medicine be elected to a national office in any European Union country by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate with a background in Medicine is elected to a national office in any European Union country. 

A "background in Medicine" is defined as having a degree in Medicine (MD or equivalent) and/or having practiced as a medical doctor. 

"National office" refers to positions such as President, Prime Minister, or any other equivalent head of state or head of government roles, as well as members of the national legislature (e.g., Parliament, National Assembly, etc.). 

The election must be confirmed by official election results from the respective country's electoral authority. In the absence of official confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will a major breakthrough in voting technology influence the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major breakthrough in voting technology is implemented and influences the outcome of any local, state, or national election in any country.

A "major breakthrough" in voting technology is defined as a significant advancement that improves the security, accessibility, or efficiency of the voting process. Examples include, but are not limited to:
- Implementation of blockchain-based voting systems.
- Deployment of end-to-end verifiable voting systems.
- Introduction of secure and widely adopted online voting platforms.

The influence on the election must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or official government announcements. The breakthrough must be operational and not in a trial phase. Temporary implementations for specific events or limited pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will India implement a nationwide AI-driven public transportation system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, India has officially implemented a nationwide public transportation system that is driven by artificial intelligence. 

The system must be operational across multiple states and capable of managing and optimizing routes, schedules, and vehicle dispatching autonomously. 

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The system must be fully operational, not in a trial or pilot phase. Temporary implementations or systems limited to a single city or region do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI-driven technologies significantly change the IT industry in the European Union by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven technologies have led to significant changes in the IT industry within the European Union. 'Significant changes' are defined as any of the following:

- At least 25% of IT jobs in the EU being automated or significantly altered by AI technologies.
- The introduction of at least three major AI-driven technologies or platforms that become industry standards within the EU IT sector.
- An increase of at least 30% in productivity or efficiency in IT operations attributable to AI-driven technologies, as reported by reputable industry analyses.

The changes must be corroborated by reports from at least three reputable sources, such as The Guardian, BBC, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major EU IT industry reports. In case of conflicting reports, the majority consensus will be considered. Temporary or pilot implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Taiwan implement a nationwide AI strategy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Taiwan officially implements a nationwide AI strategy. The strategy must be a formal, government-endorsed plan or policy aimed at promoting and regulating the development and use of artificial intelligence across the country. The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The strategy must cover multiple sectors such as healthcare, education, transportation, and public safety. Temporary pilot programs or sector-specific initiatives do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will DeepMind's AI research lead to a major geopolitical event by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, DeepMind's AI research directly leads to a major geopolitical event. 

A "major geopolitical event" is defined as an event that significantly impacts the political relations between two or more countries, or within a country, and is recognized as such by at least three of the following reputable news organizations: BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg.

Examples of major geopolitical events include, but are not limited to:
- Diplomatic crises or conflicts,
- Major policy changes or legislation directly influenced by AI research,
- International treaties or agreements,
- Significant shifts in alliances or power structures.

The connection between DeepMind's AI research and the geopolitical event must be explicitly stated in the reports from the reputable news organizations. If no such event is reported by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant geopolitical event related to biotechnology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a significant geopolitical event related to biotechnology occurs. For the purposes of this question, a 'significant geopolitical event' is defined as any of the following:

- A public international dispute or conflict between two or more countries, where biotechnology is a central issue.
- The imposition of international sanctions or trade restrictions specifically due to biotechnology-related activities.
- The signing of a major international treaty or agreement focused on the regulation, control, or promotion of biotechnology.

The event must be reported by at least three major reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the case of ambiguity or multiple qualifying events, the earliest event will be considered for resolution.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) advocate for significant environmental policies impacting natural sciences by 2028?
Will any general election in 2028 be postponed due to an unexpected natural phenomenon?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if any general election scheduled to take place in any country during the year 2028 is officially postponed due to an unexpected natural phenomenon. 

An 'unexpected natural phenomenon' includes, but is not limited to, events such as earthquakes, hurricanes, floods, volcanic eruptions, or pandemics. 

The postponement must be confirmed by an official announcement from the relevant election authority or government body. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if no general election is postponed due to an unexpected natural phenomenon by December 31, 2028.

title: Will an AI developed by DeepMind be used in an official capacity to monitor or administer elections in any country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an artificial intelligence developed by DeepMind is used in an official capacity to monitor or administer elections in any country.

"Official capacity" means that the AI must be formally adopted or sanctioned by a government or electoral authority for the purpose of monitoring or administering elections. This includes, but is not limited to, tasks such as:
- Voter identification and verification
- Ballot counting
- Election result tabulation
- Monitoring for electoral fraud or irregularities

The use of AI must be confirmed by an official government or electoral authority announcement or documentation. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be sufficient.

The AI must be actively used in a live election, not in a trial or pilot phase. Use in internal party elections or non-governmental elections does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major election technology provider, such as Microsoft, implement blockchain-based voting systems in a national election before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a major election technology provider (such as Microsoft, Dominion Voting Systems, or Election Systems & Software) implements a blockchain-based voting system in a national election.

For the purposes of this question, 'implements' means that the blockchain-based system is used to record, verify, or tally votes in an official capacity during the national election. The system must be publicly acknowledged by the election technology provider and confirmed by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The question resolves as No if no such implementation is confirmed by the resolution date. The use of blockchain technology in pilot programs, local or regional elections, or non-binding referendums does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Germany develop an AI system that becomes a global leader in autonomous driving technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Germany develops an AI system that is recognized as a global leader in autonomous driving technology. The criteria for being considered a global leader include:

1. Performance: The AI system must demonstrate superior performance in terms of safety, efficiency, and reliability compared to other existing systems. This can be measured through benchmarks, industry standards, or independent assessments.
2. Adoption: The AI system must be adopted by at least three major automotive manufacturers or be deployed in at least five different countries.
3. Recognition: The AI system must receive recognition from at least three major industry bodies or publications (e.g., IEEE, SAE International, MIT Technology Review, or equivalent).

The resolution will be based on official announcements, credible industry reports, or publications from reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of conflicting information, the consensus among these sources will be used for resolution.

title: Will an AI system be developed that can consistently predict the outcome of basketball games by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system is developed that can consistently predict the outcome of basketball games with an accuracy rate of at least 70% over a sample size of at least 100 games.

The AI system must:
- Be publicly documented and available for verification.
- Have its predictions and accuracy independently verified by at least three reputable sources, such as major sports analytics organizations or publications (e.g., ESPN, FiveThirtyEight, Sports Illustrated).

The AI system must predict the outcomes before the games are played. Predictions made after the start of the game do not count towards this question's resolution. The system must also be able to predict games from multiple basketball leagues, not just a single league.

In the event of conflicting reports on the AI system's accuracy, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to significant advancements in cyber warfare techniques by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there is credible evidence that the Russo-Ukrainian War has led to significant advancements in cyber warfare techniques. Significant advancements are defined as:

1. New types of cyber attacks or defense mechanisms that were not previously documented before the onset of the Russo-Ukrainian War.
2. Major improvements in the effectiveness, speed, or stealth of existing cyber warfare techniques directly attributed to the conflict.

Evidence must come from reputable sources such as cybersecurity firms (e.g., Kaspersky, Symantec, FireEye), governmental cybersecurity agencies (e.g., NSA, GCHQ), or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The advancements must be recognized and documented in publications, reports, or official statements by these sources.

In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these reputable sources will determine the resolution. If no significant advancements are reported by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the European Union implement a unified digital currency by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union officially implements a unified digital currency that is adopted by at least 60% of its member countries. 
The digital currency must be issued or backed by the European Central Bank (ECB) and be legally recognized for transactions within adopting member states. 
The implementation must be confirmed through an official announcement by the European Central Bank or the European Commission. 
In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 
The currency must be operational and not in a trial or pilot phase. 
If the currency is implemented but only in a limited capacity (e.g., for specific types of transactions or within certain regions), the question will resolve as Yes if there is a clear and official plan for full adoption across the adopting member states.

title: Will the Republican Party (US) shift its stance on climate change policies by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Republican Party of the United States officially changes its stance on climate change policies in a significant manner. 

A significant change is defined as:
- Officially endorsing policies aimed at substantially reducing carbon emissions or other greenhouse gases.
- Supporting legislation or international agreements that align with scientific consensus on climate action, such as the Paris Agreement.

The change in stance must be confirmed by an official statement from the Republican National Committee (RNC) or through the party's official platform. 

In the absence of an official statement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

Temporary or individual statements from party members do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will advancements in Robotics lead to the discovery of a new method for studying marine life by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new method for studying marine life is discovered and attributed to advancements in robotics. The new method must meet the following criteria:

- Novelty: The method must be a novel approach not previously used or documented in marine studies prior to January 1, 2023.
- Attribution: The method must be directly attributed to advancements in robotics, including but not limited to autonomous underwater vehicles (AUVs), robotic sensors, or robotic sampling devices.
- Scientific Recognition: The method must be recognized and validated by the scientific community through publication in a peer-reviewed journal or presentation at a major scientific conference.
- Practical Application: The method must be demonstrated in a practical application or field study, showing clear benefits over existing methods for studying marine life.

In the event of multiple new methods being discovered, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one method meets all the above criteria. Reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or scientific journals will be considered sufficient for validation.

title: Will Germany implement AI-driven policies to significantly reduce carbon emissions by 2028?
body:
This question resolves as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Germany implements AI-driven policies that result in a significant reduction of carbon emissions. The criteria for 'significant reduction' are as follows: 
- A minimum reduction of 10% in annual carbon emissions compared to the baseline year of 2023.
- The AI-driven policies must be officially documented and publicly announced by the German government.
- The reduction in emissions must be verified by credible sources such as the German Federal Environment Agency (Umweltbundesamt), the European Environment Agency (EEA), or major international environmental organizations (e.g., Greenpeace, WWF).
- The AI-driven policies must be in active implementation, not merely proposed or in a pilot phase.
In the absence of an official government announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will California deploy AI systems to manage and prevent wildfires by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, California has officially deployed AI systems specifically designed to manage and prevent wildfires. 

The AI systems must be capable of one or more of the following functions:
- Early detection and prediction of wildfire outbreaks.
- Real-time monitoring and analysis of wildfire spread.
- Automated coordination of firefighting resources.

The deployment must be confirmed through an official announcement by a California state agency (e.g., Cal Fire) or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

The AI systems must be operational and not merely in a pilot or testing phase. Temporary deployments for specific events do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Kingdom hold a second referendum on Scottish independence by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a second referendum on Scottish independence is held in the United Kingdom. 

A "second referendum on Scottish independence" is defined as any official public vote sanctioned by the UK government or the Scottish Parliament where the electorate is asked to vote on whether Scotland should become an independent country, following the initial referendum held in 2014. 

The referendum must be officially recognized and the results must be officially counted and reported by the relevant electoral authorities. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the event. 

If the referendum is annulled or the results are declared invalid for any reason, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new global health treaty be signed by major world powers by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a new global health treaty is signed by at least three of the following major world powers by December 31, 2028: the United States, China, Russia, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Japan, or India. The treaty must be aimed at addressing global health issues, such as pandemics, infectious diseases, or health inequities, and must be officially recognized and documented by the World Health Organization (WHO) or another reputable international health organization. The signing must be confirmed by official government announcements or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). If the treaty is signed but not yet ratified, this still counts towards the resolution of this question.

title: Will the NBA be involved in a geopolitical controversy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the NBA (National Basketball Association) is officially involved in a geopolitical controversy. 

A 'geopolitical controversy' is defined as an event or series of events that:
- Involves the NBA or its representatives (players, coaches, officials, or executives) and
- Has significant political implications between at least two countries or between a country and an international organization.

The involvement must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Mere speculation or unsubstantiated claims do not count. 

Examples of geopolitical controversies include, but are not limited to:
- Statements or actions by NBA representatives that lead to diplomatic tensions or sanctions.
- NBA events being canceled or boycotted due to political reasons.
- Official government statements or actions directed at the NBA in response to political issues.

In the absence of such reports, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Canada implement new nationwide COVID-19 restrictions before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the Canadian government implements new nationwide COVID-19 restrictions. These restrictions must meet the following criteria:

- Be officially announced and enforced by the federal government of Canada.
- Apply to all provinces and territories in Canada.
- Include measures such as lockdowns, travel bans, mandatory mask mandates, or social distancing requirements.

The implementation of such restrictions must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times) are sufficient.

Temporary or localized restrictions (e.g., limited to specific provinces or cities) do not count towards this question's resolution. The restrictions must be nationwide and affect the entire country.

title: Will the US House of Representatives elections in 2028 see a voter turnout greater than 60%?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the voter turnout for the US House of Representatives elections in 2028 exceeds 60% of the eligible voting population.

The following sources will be used to verify the voter turnout:
- Official data from the United States Election Assistance Commission (EAC).
- In the absence of EAC data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Associated Press, CNN) will be considered.

The eligible voting population is defined as all US citizens who meet the requirements to vote as of the date of the election. The voter turnout percentage will be calculated based on the total number of votes cast in the US House of Representatives elections divided by the total number of eligible voters.

If there is any ambiguity or dispute regarding the turnout percentage, the final determination will be based on the consensus of the majority of the sources listed above.

title: Will a new food labeling regulation be introduced by the Food and Drug Administration before 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially introduces a new food labeling regulation. The regulation must be announced on the FDA's official website or through an official FDA press release. The regulation must pertain directly to food labeling standards, requirements, or guidelines. Amendments to existing regulations count towards this question's resolution if they introduce significant changes to labeling practices. Temporary guidelines or recommendations do not count. Verification will be based on the official announcement date.

title: Will any country hold an election using a blockchain-based voting system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any country holds a national election in which votes are cast and recorded using a blockchain-based voting system.

A 'blockchain-based voting system' is defined as a voting system that leverages blockchain technology to securely record votes in a decentralized ledger, ensuring transparency and immutability.

The election must be a national election, such as a presidential, parliamentary, or equivalent election, and must be officially recognized by the country's electoral authority.

The use of blockchain technology must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Partial implementations, such as pilot programs or regional elections, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will advancements in energy-efficient computing technologies be made by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there are notable advancements in energy-efficient computing technologies. "Advancements" are defined as:

- A minimum 50% improvement in energy efficiency for a given computational task compared to 2023 benchmarks, as documented by reputable industry standards or scientific publications.
- Introduction of new computing architectures or materials that significantly reduce energy consumption while maintaining or improving performance, as verified by at least two peer-reviewed publications or major industry reports.
- Implementation of energy-efficient computing technologies in commercial products from at least three major technology companies (e.g., Intel, AMD, NVIDIA, IBM, Google, Microsoft).

The progress must be reported in credible sources such as peer-reviewed journals, industry reports, or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will there be a formal peace treaty signed to end the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a formal peace treaty is signed by the recognized governments of both Russia and Ukraine, officially ending the Russo-Ukrainian War.

The peace treaty must be publicly announced and documented by both governments. Verification will be based on official government statements and documentation, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

In the event of a ceasefire or armistice that does not result in a formal peace treaty, this question will resolve as No. Similarly, any agreements that are not recognized as a formal peace treaty by both governments will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) introduce new national health policies in response to a major political event by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) introduces new national health policies directly in response to a major political event. 

A "major political event" is defined as an event that significantly impacts national governance or public health policy, such as a presidential election, a major legislative change, or a significant Supreme Court ruling. 

The introduction of new national health policies must be confirmed through official CDC announcements or documentation. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., The New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian) are sufficient. 

The policies must be new, not revisions of existing policies, and must be implemented on a national scale. Minor amendments or updates to existing policies do not count towards this question's resolution. Temporary measures or guidelines also do not count unless they are explicitly stated to be national health policies.

title: Will renewable energy sources account for more than 50% of the United States' energy consumption by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, renewable energy sources account for more than 50% of the total energy consumption in the United States. Renewable energy sources include solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass. The measurement should be based on data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) or an equivalent authoritative source. If the EIA or an equivalent authoritative source reports that renewable energy sources accounted for more than 50% of the total energy consumption in any of their annual reports for the year 2028, the question will resolve as Yes. In the absence of data from the EIA, reports from at least three credible news organizations (such as The New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg, or BBC) confirming this will be sufficient. This question resolves as NO if the criteria are not met by the specified date.

title: Will Italy hold a national election before the end of 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Italy holds a national election before December 31, 2028. A national election refers to any election in which members of the national legislature or the head of state are selected. The election must be officially recognized by the Italian government and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a significant chemical discovery lead to a geopolitical shift by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a chemical discovery leads to a significant geopolitical shift. The criteria for a significant geopolitical shift include:

- Official changes in national borders or the creation of new countries.
- Major changes in international alliances or treaties, such as the formation or dissolution of significant political or economic unions.
- Major shifts in global power dynamics, such as a country gaining or losing superpower status.

The chemical discovery must be directly cited as the primary cause of the geopolitical shift in credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

title: Will Brazil implement a national AI strategy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Brazil officially implements a national AI strategy. The strategy must be documented in an official government publication or announcement and should outline the country's plans and policies regarding the development, deployment, and regulation of artificial intelligence technologies. The implementation must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of such reports, an official government document or statement will suffice. If there is no such strategy implemented by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Israel become a leading hub for AI startups by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Israel is recognized as a leading hub for AI startups based on at least two of the following criteria:
- Israel ranks in the top 5 globally for the number of AI startups founded annually, as reported by a reputable industry analysis firm (e.g., CB Insights, PitchBook, Crunchbase).
- Major investments in Israeli AI startups total at least $5 billion USD in a calendar year, as reported by financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times).
- At least three Israeli AI startups achieve 'unicorn' status (valued at over $1 billion USD), as reported by major business news outlets (e.g., Forbes, TechCrunch, Business Insider).
- Israel hosts a globally recognized AI conference or event with significant international participation, as reported by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of clear data, the question will resolve based on a consensus of expert opinion from at least three reputable sources in the technology and startup ecosystem.

title: Will Sweden achieve its carbon neutrality goal by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Sweden officially announces that it has achieved carbon neutrality. 

"Carbon neutrality" is defined as the country having net-zero carbon dioxide emissions, meaning that any carbon dioxide emissions are balanced by equivalent carbon dioxide removal or offset measures. 

The announcement must come from an official government source, such as a statement from the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency or the Ministry of the Environment. 

In the absence of an official government announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If there are conflicting reports or ambiguity about the achievement of carbon neutrality, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a global treaty on plastic pollution by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations officially adopts a global treaty specifically aimed at addressing plastic pollution.

The treaty must include commitments from member states to take specific actions to reduce plastic pollution, such as reducing plastic production, improving waste management, or mitigating plastic waste in oceans and other environments.

The adoption of the treaty must be confirmed by an official announcement from the United Nations or its relevant bodies. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The treaty must be a formal and binding agreement, not merely a declaration of intent or a non-binding resolution.

title: Will Brazil achieve a 50% reduction in deforestation rates in the Amazon by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Brazil achieves a 50% reduction in deforestation rates in the Amazon Rainforest compared to the average annual deforestation rate from 2015 to 2020.
