The deforestation rates will be measured using data from authoritative sources such as the National Institute for Space Research (INPE) or the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO). The reduction must be sustained for at least one full calendar year.

In case of conflicting reports, a consensus from at least three major reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered. Temporary reductions due to unusual events (e.g., natural disasters) will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention adopt an AI-driven disease outbreak prediction system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) officially adopts and begins operational use of an AI-driven system specifically designed for predicting disease outbreaks. 

The system must utilize artificial intelligence to analyze data and predict the likelihood, spread, and impact of disease outbreaks. 

The adoption must be confirmed by an official announcement from the CDC or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters). 

The system must be operational and in use for public health decision-making, not merely in a pilot or testing phase. 

If the system is part of a broader multi-agency initiative, the question resolves as Yes if the CDC is one of the primary agencies using the system for outbreak prediction.

title: Will the European Union implement AI regulations that significantly impact AI development within its member states by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union enacts AI regulations that meet the following criteria:

- The regulations must be officially adopted by the European Union's legislative bodies (European Parliament and Council).
- The regulations must contain specific provisions that directly impact the development, deployment, or use of AI technologies within EU member states.
- The impact can be measured by significant changes in compliance requirements, restrictions, or incentives for AI research and development.
- The regulations must be reported by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or published in official EU documentation.

In the case of partial regulations or phased implementation, the question resolves as Yes if the core provisions are enacted and come into effect by the resolution date. Temporary or trial regulations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Microsoft release an AI model that surpasses human-level performance in natural language understanding by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Microsoft releases an AI model that surpasses human-level performance in natural language understanding. The following criteria must be met:

- The AI model achieves a score higher than the median human performance on established benchmarks for natural language understanding, such as the GLUE (General Language Understanding Evaluation) benchmark or its successor.
- The model's performance must be verified by an independent third party, such as a reputable academic institution or a major industry organization.
- The release must be publicly announced by Microsoft through an official channel, such as a press release or a major tech conference presentation.

In the event of ambiguity, the question will resolve based on consensus from credible sources, including major tech news outlets (e.g., TechCrunch, Wired, MIT Technology Review).

title: Will a discovery in particle physics significantly impact political campaigns or election outcomes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a discovery in particle physics is widely recognized as having a significant impact on political campaigns or election outcomes. The following criteria must be met:

- The discovery must be reported by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) as having influenced political discourse or election strategies.
- At least two reputable political analysts or think tanks (e.g., Brookings Institution, Council on Foreign Relations) must publish analyses attributing a measurable change in campaign strategies or election outcomes to the discovery.
- The impact must be acknowledged by at least one major political party in a public statement or official document.

The term 'significantly impact' is defined as causing a notable shift in campaign strategies, voter behavior, or election results as evidenced by polling data, election outcomes, or strategic changes in political campaigns.

In the absence of these criteria, this question resolves as No.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a landmark ruling on immigration policy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling that significantly alters federal immigration policy or sets a major precedent in immigration law. 

A 'landmark ruling' is defined as one that either:
- Overturns or significantly modifies an existing federal immigration law or executive order;
- Establishes a new legal principle or interpretation that has a substantial impact on immigration policy or enforcement.

The ruling must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian) as a landmark decision. 

If the ruling is subject to further appeals or legal challenges, the resolution will be based on the initial ruling date by the Supreme Court.

title: Will Google develop and deploy a technology to secure online voting systems by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google develops and officially deploys a technology specifically designed to secure online voting systems. 

The criteria for deployment include:
- The technology must be officially announced by Google as a solution for securing online voting systems.
- The technology must be implemented in at least one official governmental online voting system.
- The deployment must be confirmed by an official announcement from a government entity or credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

The technology must be operational and not merely in a trial or testing phase. General cybersecurity technologies not specifically designed for online voting systems will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will any major golf tournament be used as a platform for political campaigning by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any major golf tournament is used as a platform for political campaigning. A 'major golf tournament' refers to any of the following: The Masters, The U.S. Open, The Open Championship, and The PGA Championship. 'Political campaigning' is defined as any organized effort to influence the decision-making process within a specific group, including speeches, distribution of campaign materials, or any form of public endorsement for a political candidate or party. The use of a major golf tournament for political campaigning must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of ambiguous cases, the question will resolve based on the consensus of these sources.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration implement any regulations impacting election-related technologies before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) implements any regulations that directly impact election-related technologies. 'Election-related technologies' include, but are not limited to, electronic voting systems, voter registration databases, and any technology used to secure, monitor, or count votes.

The implementation of such regulations must be confirmed by an official FDA announcement or documented in the Federal Register. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If the FDA issues guidelines or recommendations rather than regulations, or if the regulations are proposed but not implemented by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve an AI-driven medical device by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) grants approval to a medical device that utilizes artificial intelligence (AI) as a core component for diagnosis, treatment, or management of medical conditions.

The AI-driven medical device must meet the following criteria:
- The device must be classified as a Class II or Class III medical device by the FDA.
- The AI component must be integral to the device's primary function, not merely an ancillary feature.
- The approval must be documented on the official FDA website or through an official FDA press release.

In the absence of official documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) confirming the FDA approval are sufficient.

If the FDA approval is conditional or for a limited use case, the question will resolve as Yes if the device is intended for general medical use and is not restricted to experimental or investigational purposes.

title: Will a major astronomical event significantly impact political decisions before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a major astronomical event directly leads to significant political decisions by one or more national governments or major international organizations.

A "major astronomical event" is defined as an event such as a solar eclipse, meteor shower, comet sighting, asteroid impact, or any other significant celestial occurrence that receives widespread media coverage and is recognized by authoritative sources such as NASA, ESA, or similar institutions.

"Significant political decisions" are defined as policy changes, new legislation, or international agreements that are directly attributed to the astronomical event by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of ambiguity, the question will resolve based on a consensus of expert opinions from political analysts and astronomers.

title: Will the United States achieve exascale computing capabilities by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States has officially achieved exascale computing capabilities. Exascale computing is defined as a system capable of performing at least one exaFLOP, or a billion billion (10^18) calculations per second. The achievement must be confirmed through an official announcement from a reputable authority such as the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) or the National Science Foundation (NSF). In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational and not in a trial or testing phase. If multiple systems achieve this capability, the question resolves as Yes upon the first confirmed instance.

title: Will Canada hold a national election before the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a national election is held in Canada before January 1, 2028. 
A national election is defined as an election for the House of Commons, which is the lower house of Parliament in Canada. 
The election date must be officially recognized by Elections Canada, the independent agency responsible for conducting federal elections. 
In the event of a dispute or ambiguity, official documentation from Elections Canada will be the authoritative source. 
If multiple elections are held, the question will resolve as Yes based on the date of the first election. 
By-elections, provincial elections, and municipal elections do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI-driven technologies lead to significant advancements in NBA game strategies by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven technologies lead to significant advancements in NBA game strategies. Significant advancements are defined as follows:

- AI systems being used by at least 50% of NBA teams for in-game decision-making, player performance analysis, or strategic planning.
- Public acknowledgment by NBA teams or credible reports from at least three major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic) that AI-driven technologies have resulted in measurable improvements in team performance, such as win rates or player efficiency ratings.
- The implementation of AI-driven strategies must be confirmed by reputable sources and not be limited to experimental or trial phases.

Edge cases, such as temporary use of AI for specific games or events, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI be used to significantly improve public services in Italy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI technologies are deployed in Italy to significantly improve at least one of the following public services:

- Healthcare: AI systems must be used to enhance diagnostic accuracy, treatment plans, or patient management, resulting in measurable improvements in patient outcomes or operational efficiency.
- Education: AI must be used to personalize learning experiences, improve educational outcomes, or streamline administrative processes, with measurable positive impacts.
- Transportation: AI must be used to optimize traffic management, public transport schedules, or maintenance, leading to measurable improvements in efficiency or user satisfaction.
- Public Safety: AI must be used in crime prevention, emergency response, or disaster management, resulting in measurable improvements in response times or safety outcomes.

The deployment and its impacts must be confirmed by official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

title: Will Brazil implement AI-driven policies to significantly reduce carbon emissions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Brazil officially implements policies driven by artificial intelligence (AI) that result in a significant reduction of carbon emissions. 

The policies must meet the following criteria:

- AI-driven: The policies must utilize AI technologies for decision-making, optimization, or enforcement processes.
- Significant Reduction: The policies must result in at least a 10% reduction in Brazil's annual carbon emissions compared to the baseline year of 2023, as reported by Brazil's Ministry of the Environment or an equivalent authoritative body.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

Temporary measures or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution. In case of partial implementation, the question will resolve as Yes if the policies are intended for nationwide application.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in computational immunology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant breakthrough in computational immunology is announced and recognized by the scientific community. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Development of a new computational model that substantially improves the accuracy of predicting immune responses compared to existing models.
- Creation of a computational tool or algorithm that leads to a major advancement in vaccine development or immunotherapy.
- Publication of a landmark study in a peer-reviewed journal that is widely cited and leads to a paradigm shift in the field.

The breakthrough must be confirmed by at least two reputable sources, such as major scientific journals (e.g., Nature, Science, Cell) or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of such confirmation, consensus recognition by leading experts in the field, as evidenced by statements from at least three prominent immunologists, will suffice.

title: Will a major golf tournament be postponed due to unforeseen circumstances by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any of the four major golf tournaments (The Masters, PGA Championship, U.S. Open, The Open Championship) are officially postponed due to unforeseen circumstances. 

"Postponed" means that the tournament's start date is rescheduled to a later date rather than canceled outright or moved to a different location. 

"Unforeseen circumstances" include but are not limited to natural disasters, extreme weather conditions, political unrest, pandemics, or other events deemed as force majeure. 

The postponement must be confirmed by an official announcement from the respective tournament's organizing body or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) release a new guideline or regulation affecting the voting process in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) officially releases a new guideline or regulation that directly impacts the voting process in the United States.

The guideline or regulation must be publicly available on the CDC's official website or announced through an official CDC press release. The impact on the voting process must be explicitly stated, such as changes to in-person voting procedures, mail-in voting guidelines, or other voting-related health and safety measures.

In the absence of a direct announcement from the CDC, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the release of such a guideline or regulation are sufficient for the question to resolve as Yes.

If no such guideline or regulation is released by the CDC by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will AI technologies lead to a major breakthrough in aerospace engineering by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI technologies contribute to a major breakthrough in aerospace engineering. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly advances the field and meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Enables a new class of spacecraft or aircraft with capabilities previously unattainable.
- Achieves a significant milestone in space exploration, such as a manned mission to Mars or beyond.
- Results in a substantial improvement in propulsion technology, reducing travel time or cost by at least 50%.

The breakthrough must be confirmed by reputable sources, including peer-reviewed scientific journals, official announcements from space agencies (e.g., NASA, ESA), or credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will the US Senate pass a significant machine learning regulation bill before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes significant regulations specifically targeting machine learning technologies.

A bill will be considered to include significant regulations if it contains provisions that:
- Set specific guidelines or restrictions on the development, deployment, or use of machine learning technologies;
- Establish a regulatory body or framework specifically for machine learning;
- Mandate transparency, accountability, or ethical guidelines for machine learning applications.

The passage of the bill must be confirmed by official Senate records or documentation. In the absence of official records, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event of multiple bills, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the criteria above.

title: Will Virginia elect a new US Senator in the 2026 midterm elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a new US Senator representing Virginia is elected in the 2026 midterm elections, scheduled to take place on November 3, 2026. "New" is defined as a person who was not holding the office of US Senator for Virginia immediately prior to the election. The election results must be officially certified by the Virginia State Board of Elections. In the event of a recount or legal challenge, the resolution will be based on the final certified results.

title: Will the US Senate have a majority of one party after the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, following the 2028 United States Senate elections, one political party holds more than 50% of the total seats in the Senate.

The total number of seats in the Senate is 100. Therefore, a party needs to hold at least 51 seats to have a majority.

The election results must be officially certified by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or another relevant authoritative body.

In the event of any special circumstances (such as recounts, legal disputes, or independent senators who caucus with a party), the final determination will be based on the certified results as of December 31, 2028.

title: Will there be a notable impact of COVID-19 on computing and mathematics research progress by 2028?
body:
This question resolves as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is credible evidence of a notable impact of COVID-19 on computing and mathematics research progress. This includes, but is not limited to:

- Decrease in the number of published papers in reputable journals compared to pre-COVID-19 levels.
- Significant delays or cancellations of major conferences or research projects due to COVID-19.
- Notable shifts in research focus or funding priorities as a direct result of the pandemic.
- Reports from authoritative sources (e.g., IEEE, ACM, Nature, Science) indicating a measurable impact on research activities.

In the absence of direct evidence, the question will resolve as No. The impact must be explicitly attributed to COVID-19 and not other factors.

title: Will Google develop an AI to predict election outcomes by 2028?
body: This question resolves as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google officially announces the development of an AI system specifically designed to predict election outcomes. The AI must be capable of predicting the results of at least one national election with an accuracy rate of 90% or higher, as verified by independent experts. The development and deployment of such an AI system must be confirmed through an official Google announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The AI system must be operational and not in a trial phase. Temporary or one-off predictions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant election reform be implemented in any major country before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a significant election reform is officially implemented in any major country. For the purposes of this question, a 'major country' is defined as any member of the G20.

A 'significant election reform' is defined as any change to the electoral process that meets at least one of the following criteria:
- Alters the method of voting (e.g., introduction of electronic voting, ranked-choice voting, or proportional representation).
- Changes voter eligibility requirements (e.g., lowering the voting age, extending voting rights to non-citizens).
- Modifies the electoral district boundaries in a way that affects at least 10% of the population.
- Introduces new measures to enhance election security or integrity (e.g., mandatory voter ID, blockchain-based voting).

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

If multiple reforms are implemented simultaneously, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the criteria above.

title: Will the United States implement a nationwide AI-driven healthcare system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States government officially implements a nationwide healthcare system that utilizes artificial intelligence (AI) to manage, diagnose, or treat patients across the country. The system must meet the following criteria:

- Nationwide Coverage: The AI-driven healthcare system must be operational and accessible to the general public across all states.
- Core Functions: The system must be capable of performing critical healthcare functions such as patient diagnosis, treatment recommendations, and management of healthcare records using AI algorithms.
- Official Confirmation: The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from a federal government agency (e.g., the Department of Health and Human Services) or through federal legislation.
- Reputable Sources: In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice.
- Exclusions: Pilot programs, state-level implementations, or private sector initiatives do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI technologies significantly influence the policies of the Republican Party (US) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is clear evidence that AI technologies have significantly influenced the policies of the Republican Party in the United States. 

"Significantly influence" is defined as AI technologies being a major factor in the development, modification, or implementation of at least three distinct policies or official stances of the Republican Party. 

The influence must be confirmed by either:
- An official statement from the Republican Party acknowledging the role of AI technologies in shaping their policies;
- Credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) detailing how AI technologies have influenced specific policies;
- Academic or industry analyses published in peer-reviewed journals or major conferences that provide evidence of AI's impact on Republican policies.

In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus of the majority of reputable sources will be used to determine the resolution. Temporary or trial influences, as well as influences on unofficial or minor policies, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be significant research published on the impact of deforestation in the Amazon on global climate patterns by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, at least three peer-reviewed research papers are published that focus on the impact of deforestation in the Amazon on global climate patterns.

The research must meet the following criteria:
- Be published in reputable scientific journals such as Nature, Science, or PNAS.
- Specifically address the connection between Amazon deforestation and global climate patterns, rather than local or regional effects alone.
- Provide empirical data or robust modeling that supports their conclusions.

The question resolves as Yes if the above criteria are met and the papers are recognized by the scientific community through citations or endorsements by established climate scientists. Otherwise, the question resolves as No.

title: Will there be any significant advancements in climate modeling technology by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any of the following advancements in climate modeling technology are achieved and documented:

- Development of a new climate model with at least 50% greater accuracy in predicting temperature, precipitation, or extreme weather events, compared to models used in 2023, as verified by a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- Significant improvement in computational efficiency, allowing climate models to run simulations at least 10 times faster than current models, as verified by a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- Integration of new data sources (e.g., satellite data, IoT sensors) leading to more accurate climate predictions, as verified by a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- Adoption of advanced machine learning techniques that significantly enhance the predictive capabilities of climate models, as verified by a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

Advancements must be recognized and validated by leading climate research institutions such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), or the European Space Agency (ESA).

title: Will Google develop and deploy an election technology product used in a national election by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google develops and deploys an election technology product that is used in a national election in any country.

The election technology product must be officially developed by Google and can include, but is not limited to, voting machines, election security systems, voter registration systems, or election result reporting systems.

The deployment and use of the product must be confirmed by an official announcement from Google or the relevant national election authority. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

The product must be used in an official national election, not in a trial or pilot phase. Use in local or regional elections does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new synthetic chemical be approved for use in elections by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new synthetic chemical is approved for use in elections by an official government body in any country. The chemical must be intended for a direct role in the electoral process, such as enhancing security, preventing fraud, or improving the voting mechanism. The approval must be confirmed through an official announcement or documentation from the relevant government authority. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary or trial approvals do not count towards this question's resolution. The chemical must be in active use in at least one election process by the resolution date.

title: Will Microsoft influence the outcome of a national election in the United States by 2028?
Will any NATO member invoke Article 5 before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, any NATO member state invokes Article 5 of the North Atlantic Treaty.

Article 5 states that an armed attack against one or more NATO members is considered an attack against them all, and it allows member states to take necessary actions, including the use of armed force, to restore and maintain security.

The invocation of Article 5 must be confirmed by an official NATO statement or documentation. In the absence of an official statement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

Temporary measures, joint military exercises, or actions taken under different articles of the NATO treaty do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Israel hold a national referendum on a major policy issue by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the State of Israel holds a national referendum on any major policy issue. A 'national referendum' is defined as a vote in which the entire eligible voting population of Israel is invited to participate to either accept or reject a specific proposal or policy issue. A 'major policy issue' is defined as any issue that has significant national importance and has been the subject of extensive public debate or media coverage. The referendum must be officially sanctioned by the Israeli government and widely reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Haaretz). In the event of multiple referendums, the resolution will consider the first one held. If no such referendum is held by the specified date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will robotics technology play a significant role in the administration of elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, robotics technology is used in any of the following significant roles in the administration of elections:

- Voter Registration: Robotics technology is used to register voters or update voter information in at least one official jurisdiction.
- Voting Process: Robotics technology is used to assist or manage the voting process, including but not limited to, operating voting machines, verifying voter identities, or assisting voters with disabilities.
- Vote Counting: Robotics technology is utilized in the counting of votes, either through direct tallying or through the transportation and handling of ballots.
- Security: Robotics technology is employed in ensuring the security of the election process, including surveillance, patrolling polling stations, or safeguarding ballots.

The use of robotics technology must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from the relevant electoral authority. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The technology must be operational, not in a trial phase. Temporary deployments for specific events do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a Nobel Prize in Physics be awarded for research related to voting systems by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a Nobel Prize in Physics is awarded for research specifically related to voting systems.

The research must be explicitly mentioned in the Nobel Prize announcement as being the primary basis for the award. This includes, but is not limited to, research on the physics of voting mechanisms, quantum voting systems, or any physical principles applied to improve or understand voting systems.

The Nobel Prize announcement from the official Nobel Prize website (nobelprize.org) will be the authoritative source for resolution. In the event of ambiguity, reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, and Washington Post will be considered.

If no Nobel Prize in Physics is awarded for research related to voting systems by December 31, 2027, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Kingdom hold a national referendum on any major policy issue by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom holds a national referendum on any major policy issue.

A "national referendum" is defined as a vote in which all eligible voters in the United Kingdom are invited to participate to make a decision on a specific policy issue.

A "major policy issue" is defined as any issue that has significant political, economic, or social implications for the country. Examples include, but are not limited to, constitutional changes, membership in international organizations, or significant legislative reforms.

The occurrence of the referendum must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if no such referendum is held by the specified date.

title: Will a major immunology breakthrough impact voter health policies in the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major immunology breakthrough is officially recognized and has a demonstrable impact on voter health policies in the 2028 elections in any of the following ways:

- Legislation: New health policies or legislation are enacted based on the breakthrough.
- Campaign Platforms: Major political parties in the 2028 elections adopt health policies based on the breakthrough in their official platforms.
- Public Health Initiatives: Government agencies launch significant public health initiatives based on the breakthrough.

The breakthrough must be recognized by reputable scientific organizations such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The impact on voter health policies must be documented through official government announcements, legislative records, or credible news reports. The question resolves as NO if no such impact is documented by the resolution date.

title: Will Brazil have a new president before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Brazil officially inaugurates a new president who was not the incumbent as of the date this question was posted.

The new president must be officially recognized by the Brazilian government and confirmed by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the event of the current president's resignation, impeachment, death, or any other scenario leading to the appointment of a new president, the question will resolve as Yes upon the official swearing-in of the new president.

If no new president is inaugurated by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Canada join a new international alliance before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Canada officially joins a new international alliance. 
An 'international alliance' is defined as a formal agreement between two or more countries for mutual support in areas such as defense, trade, or other significant policy areas. 
The alliance must be newly established, meaning it did not exist in its current form before the resolution date. 
Canada's membership must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. 
In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
The alliance must be recognized by the international community, and not merely a bilateral agreement or an extension of an existing alliance.

title: Will NATO establish a joint cybersecurity task force by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, NATO officially establishes a joint cybersecurity task force. 

The task force must meet the following criteria:
- Be a permanent entity, not a temporary working group or ad-hoc committee.
- Have a clearly defined mandate to coordinate and conduct cybersecurity operations among NATO member states.
- Be officially announced by NATO through an official press release or documentation on NATO's official website.

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The task force must be operational, not merely proposed or in the planning stages.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention utilize advanced computing for epidemic modeling by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) officially utilizes advanced computing techniques for epidemic modeling. Advanced computing includes, but is not limited to, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and high-performance computing. The usage must be confirmed through an official CDC announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The modeling must be operational and used in an official capacity for epidemic prediction, monitoring, or response. Experimental or trial phases do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant advancement in computational methods for sports analytics in the NBA by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a significant advancement in computational methods for sports analytics in the NBA. A 'significant advancement' is defined as any of the following:

- A new computational method or algorithm that is widely adopted by at least 10 NBA teams and is publicly acknowledged by these teams or reported in reputable sports news sources (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic).
- A peer-reviewed publication in a recognized sports science or data science journal demonstrating a novel computational method that significantly improves predictive accuracy or player performance analysis compared to methods widely used as of 2023.
- Official recognition or award from a major sports analytics conference (e.g., MIT Sloan Sports Analytics Conference) for a breakthrough in computational methods applied to the NBA.

The advancement must be verifiable through public announcements, peer-reviewed publications, or credible reports from major sports news organizations. The resolution will be based on the first verifiable instance of such an advancement.

title: Will there be a significant aerospace engineering policy change in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States government enacts a significant policy change directly related to aerospace engineering. 

A "significant policy change" is defined as a new law, regulation, or executive order that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Substantially increases or decreases funding for aerospace engineering research and development.
- Introduces new regulations or significantly modifies existing regulations affecting aerospace engineering projects.
- Establishes new government programs or initiatives focused on aerospace engineering.
- Directly impacts the operations of major aerospace organizations, such as NASA, FAA, or private aerospace companies.

The policy change must be confirmed by official government documentation (e.g., published law, executive order) or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

Minor amendments, temporary measures, or policy proposals that are not enacted do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration implement new regulations on lab-grown meat by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA) implements new regulations specifically addressing the production, sale, or labeling of lab-grown meat.

The criteria for implementation include:
- The publication of the new regulations in the Federal Register.
- An official announcement by the FDA regarding the new regulations.

The new regulations must be distinct from any existing regulations and specifically target lab-grown meat, not general food safety standards. The question will resolve as No if no such regulations are implemented by the resolution date.

In the event of ambiguity, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian) confirming the implementation will be considered sufficient.

title: Will advancements in Information Technology play a crucial role in the 2028 elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, advancements in Information Technology (IT) are widely recognized by reputable sources as having played a crucial role in the 2028 elections. 

"Advancements in Information Technology" refers to significant developments or innovations in areas such as (but not limited to) artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, data analytics, blockchain, and digital communication platforms. 

A "crucial role" means that these advancements had a substantial and widely acknowledged impact on the election process, including but not limited to voting procedures, election security, voter engagement, or the dissemination of information.

The determination of whether IT advancements played a crucial role will be based on reports from at least three major and reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of consensus among these sources, the question will resolve as No.

Edge cases, such as minor technological improvements or isolated incidents, will not be considered sufficient for a Yes resolution.

title: Will Google significantly influence any geopolitical event (e.g., through policy lobbying or technological intervention) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Google significantly influences any geopolitical event through policy lobbying or technological intervention. 

"Significantly influence" is defined as:
- Direct involvement in policy changes or decisions at a national or international level, confirmed by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- Technological intervention that directly affects the outcome of a geopolitical event, confirmed by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The influence must be clearly attributable to Google's actions, either through official announcements, credible reports, or verifiable documentation. In the event of ambiguity, the question will resolve based on the consensus of reputable news sources and expert analysis.

title: Will any country announce the successful development of a quantum computer that can break current encryption standards by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any country officially announces the successful development of a quantum computer capable of breaking current encryption standards, specifically RSA-2048 or equivalent.
The announcement must come from an official government source or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
The capability must be demonstrated through a practical example or validated by independent experts in the field of cryptography or quantum computing.
In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
This question resolves as NO if no such announcement is made by the specified date.

title: Will the United Nations establish a new member state by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new member state is officially admitted to the United Nations. Admission is confirmed by an official announcement from the United Nations General Assembly or Security Council. The new member state must be recognized by a majority vote in the General Assembly following the recommendation of the Security Council. In the event of ambiguous situations, such as partial recognition or observer status, the question will resolve as No unless full membership is granted.

title: Will a major political event in the US be influenced by a scandal related to Baseball before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a major political event in the United States is directly influenced by a scandal related to Baseball. 

For the purposes of this question:
- A "major political event" is defined as any event that significantly impacts national policy, election outcomes, or leads to high-profile legal action against a sitting official.
- A "scandal related to Baseball" is defined as any event involving Major League Baseball (MLB) or its players, officials, or associated entities that receives widespread media coverage and is deemed scandalous by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The influence of the scandal on the political event must be explicitly mentioned in credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or confirmed by an official government statement. 

If no such event occurs, or if the influence is not clearly established, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report a significant increase in jobs related to AI by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports a significant increase in jobs related to artificial intelligence (AI) by December 31, 2028. A 'significant increase' is defined as at least a 20% increase in the number of jobs classified under AI-related occupations compared to the number reported as of December 31, 2023. The BLS must officially publish this data in their employment statistics. In the absence of direct classification, jobs that predominantly require AI-related skills as defined by BLS occupational categories will be considered. In case of changes in classification or reporting methods, the closest comparable data will be used to determine the outcome. If there is no clear data available from the BLS, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Virginia become a leading state in AI research and development by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Virginia is recognized as a leading state in AI research and development based on the following criteria:

- Research Output: Virginia ranks within the top 5 states in the U.S. for the number of peer-reviewed AI research publications in major AI conferences and journals (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, AAAI, JMLR).
- Funding: Virginia ranks within the top 5 states in the U.S. for AI research funding from federal, state, and private sources.
- Industry Presence: Major AI companies (e.g., Google AI, OpenAI, Microsoft Research) have established significant research and development centers in Virginia.
- Academic Excellence: At least two Virginia-based universities are ranked within the top 20 in the U.S. for AI research and education by reputable sources (e.g., CSRankings, U.S. News & World Report).

The recognition must be confirmed by reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or authoritative industry reports (e.g., Gartner, Forrester).

title: Will AI be used to enhance basketball training and performance analysis by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI technology is used in an official capacity to enhance basketball training and performance analysis. This includes, but is not limited to:

- Real-time performance tracking using AI-driven analytics during professional or collegiate basketball games.
- AI-driven personalized training programs that adjust based on player performance data.
- AI-assisted scouting reports and player evaluations used by professional or collegiate teams.

The use of AI must be confirmed by official announcements from professional basketball organizations (e.g., NBA, NCAA) or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The AI technology must be operational and actively used in training or performance analysis, not merely in development or trial phases.

title: Will there be a significant epidemiological event affecting international relations by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant epidemiological event occurs that meets the following criteria:

- The event must involve an outbreak of a disease with international spread, affecting multiple countries.
- The disease outbreak must be declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) by the World Health Organization (WHO).
- The event must lead to significant diplomatic actions or changes in international relations, such as travel bans, trade restrictions, international aid, or other major policy changes involving at least two countries.

The resolution will be based on reports from reputable news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, or official statements from governments or international organizations like the WHO or the United Nations.

In the event of multiple outbreaks, the question resolves as Yes if any one of them meets the above criteria.

title: Will Canada sign a major new trade agreement with China by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Canada signs a major new trade agreement with China. A "major new trade agreement" is defined as an agreement that includes at least two of the following elements: significant tariff reductions, substantial increases in trade quotas, or the introduction of new sectors for trade. The agreement must be officially signed by representatives of both countries and publicly announced through official government channels. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The agreement must be distinct from any minor amendments or extensions of existing agreements.

title: Will there be significant political debates or legislation concerning quantum computing in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any of the following occur in the United States:

- Introduction of federal or state-level legislation specifically addressing the development, regulation, or funding of quantum computing technologies.
- Significant political debates in Congress, state legislatures, or major political campaigns where quantum computing is a primary topic of discussion.

For the purposes of this question, 'significant political debates' are defined as debates covered by at least three major news organizations (e.g., The New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters). The debates must explicitly focus on quantum computing, not just mention it in passing.

The resolution of this question will be based on credible reports from reputable news sources or official government records.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in computational methods for optimizing engineering designs by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant breakthrough in computational methods for optimizing engineering designs is achieved and meets the following criteria:

- The breakthrough must be recognized and documented in at least two peer-reviewed engineering or scientific journals.
- The new method must demonstrate a substantial improvement in optimization efficiency (e.g., speed, accuracy, resource utilization) over existing methods as of 2023.
- The breakthrough must be adopted or implemented in at least one real-world engineering project, with documented evidence of its application and benefits.

Verification of the breakthrough must be confirmed by credible sources such as major engineering associations (e.g., ASME, IEEE), leading academic institutions, or reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a new species of animal be discovered by scientists by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new species of animal is discovered and officially recognized by the scientific community. The discovery must meet the following criteria:

- The new species must be described in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- The description must include genetic or morphological analysis that clearly distinguishes the new species from known species.
- The discovery must be acknowledged by a recognized authority in the field, such as the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) or a similar reputable organization.

If multiple new species are discovered, the resolution will still be Yes. The question resolves as No if no new species meeting these criteria are discovered by the resolution date.

title: Will a major epidemic affect voter turnout in the 2028 Virginia state elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major epidemic is reported to have significantly affected voter turnout in the Virginia state elections held in 2028.

A "major epidemic" is defined as an outbreak of a disease that leads to widespread illness, hospitalizations, or deaths within the state of Virginia, as confirmed by the Virginia Department of Health or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

"Significantly affected" voter turnout means that the voter turnout in the 2028 Virginia state elections is at least 15% lower than the average voter turnout in the previous three Virginia state elections (2016, 2020, and 2024), as reported by the Virginia Department of Elections.

The confirmation of the epidemic's impact on voter turnout must come from credible reports in at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Virginia implement blockchain technology for voting in the 2028 state elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the state of Virginia officially implements blockchain technology for voting in any part of its 2028 state elections.

"Blockchain technology for voting" refers to the use of a blockchain-based system to record, verify, and tally votes. The system must be used for casting votes in an official capacity, not merely for demonstration or pilot purposes.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Virginia State Board of Elections or another authoritative state government body. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question resolves as No if blockchain technology is not used in any part of the 2028 state elections or if its use is limited to non-binding or unofficial capacities.

title: Will Google face antitrust regulations in the European Union by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Google is subject to any new antitrust regulations enacted by the European Union. 

Antitrust regulations are defined as laws or regulations intended to promote competition and prevent monopolistic practices. This includes, but is not limited to, measures such as breaking up the company, imposing significant fines specifically for antitrust violations, or enforcing structural changes to Google's business operations in the European Union.

The enactment of such regulations must be confirmed through an official announcement from the European Commission or other relevant EU regulatory bodies. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The question will resolve as No if no new antitrust regulations are enacted by the specified date, or if existing regulations are merely enforced without any new laws or regulations being introduced.

title: Will Microsoft establish a new headquarters in a European country by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Microsoft officially establishes a new headquarters in any European country. The establishment must be confirmed through an official announcement by Microsoft or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The headquarters must be intended for long-term operations and not be a temporary or satellite office. The question resolves as No if no such headquarters is established and confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will a new variant of COVID-19 with a higher fatality rate than the original strain emerge before 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a new variant of COVID-19 is identified and confirmed to have a higher fatality rate than the original strain (SARS-CoV-2) identified in Wuhan, China in December 2019. The higher fatality rate must be confirmed through peer-reviewed research published in a reputable scientific journal or official statements from recognized health organizations such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The fatality rate should be measured as the proportion of deaths among confirmed cases (case fatality rate). In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus of the scientific community will be used to determine the resolution. If no such variant is identified and confirmed by December 31, 2027, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new form of renewable energy become the primary source of energy in any country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new form of renewable energy becomes the primary source of energy in any country. For the purposes of this question, a 'new form of renewable energy' is defined as a renewable energy source that was not commercially viable or widely used before January 1, 2023. 'Primary source of energy' means that the new form of renewable energy accounts for the largest share of energy production in the country, surpassing all other sources.

The determination of the primary source of energy must be based on official government energy reports or data from reputable international organizations such as the International Energy Agency (IEA) or the United Nations (UN). If such data is not available, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

In the event of a tie between multiple energy sources, the question will resolve as Yes if the new form of renewable energy is one of the tied sources. This question will resolve as No if no new form of renewable energy meets these criteria by the resolution date.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report a significant increase in jobs related to environmental sciences by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports a significant increase in jobs related to environmental sciences compared to the base year of 2023. A 'significant increase' is defined as at least a 20% rise in the number of jobs in the environmental sciences sector, as reported in the BLS Occupational Outlook Handbook or equivalent BLS publication. The question will resolve based on the most recent report available as of the resolution date. If the BLS ceases to publish relevant data, the question will resolve as No. In case of discrepancies or revisions in the data, the most recent and authoritative BLS publication will be used.

title: Will the United States implement a nationwide policy to reduce carbon emissions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States government implements a nationwide policy specifically aimed at reducing carbon emissions. The policy must be officially enacted through legislation, executive order, or a regulatory framework.

The policy must include:
- Clear targets for carbon emission reductions.
- A timeline for achieving these targets.
- Mechanisms for monitoring and enforcement.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If the policy is challenged in court, it must be upheld by the highest court to which it is appealed by the resolution date. Temporary measures, pilot programs, or policies limited to specific states or regions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland hold a national referendum on a major policy issue before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Switzerland holds a national referendum on any policy issue that meets the following criteria:

- The referendum must be officially recognized and announced by the Swiss government.
- The policy issue must be described as 'major' in at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).
- The referendum must be nationwide, not limited to a specific canton or region.

In the event of multiple referendums, only the first one will be considered for the resolution of this question. The question resolves as No if no such referendum is held by the specified date.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) issue a global health warning related to a geopolitical event before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) issues an official global health warning explicitly citing a geopolitical event as the cause.

A "global health warning" is defined as a public announcement or alert intended to inform the international community about health risks that extend beyond national borders.

A "geopolitical event" refers to an event involving political relations among nations, including but not limited to wars, conflicts, sanctions, or significant political instability.

The issuance of the health warning must be confirmed through an official CDC announcement. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

If no such health warning is issued by the CDC before the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant global resurgence of COVID-19 due to a geopolitical event before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, there is a significant global resurgence of COVID-19 that can be directly attributed to a geopolitical event. 

A 'significant global resurgence' is defined as:
- A 100% increase in the number of new COVID-19 cases globally within a 3-month period, compared to the previous 3-month period, as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO).
- This resurgence must be recognized and reported by the WHO as a global health emergency.

A 'geopolitical event' is defined as:
- Any event involving political relations between countries, such as wars, conflicts, sanctions, or international diplomatic incidents.

The direct attribution must be confirmed by the WHO or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of WHO confirmation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any major political event related to Google occur globally by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any of the following major political events related to Google occur globally:

- Google is subject to new legislation or regulation that significantly impacts its business operations, such as antitrust actions, privacy laws, or content moderation rules.
- Google faces a major legal case or lawsuit that results in a significant penalty, settlement, or operational change.
- Google undergoes a major corporate restructuring or governance change due to political pressure, such as a breakup or significant divestiture.

The occurrence of such events must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Israel and Palestine reach a peace agreement by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Israel and Palestine officially sign a peace agreement recognized by both parties and the international community. The agreement must address key issues such as borders, the status of Jerusalem, security arrangements, and the rights of refugees. Confirmation of the agreement must come from official announcements by both the Israeli and Palestinian governments, and be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of conflicting reports, the question will resolve as Yes if the majority of the aforementioned news organizations confirm the agreement. Temporary ceasefires or partial agreements that do not comprehensively address the key issues will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States House of Representatives pass significant legislation involving Microsoft by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the United States House of Representatives passes legislation that directly involves Microsoft in a significant manner.

"Significant legislation" is defined as any bill that meets the following criteria:
- The bill must specifically mention Microsoft by name.
- The bill must have substantial implications for Microsoft's business operations, legal status, or financial performance.

The passage of the bill must be confirmed by official Congressional records. In the absence of explicit mention in official records, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

Legislation that only indirectly affects Microsoft, such as broad industry regulations, does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major breakthrough in Natural Sciences be announced by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major breakthrough in the Natural Sciences is announced and meets all of the following criteria:

- The breakthrough must be recognized as significant by the scientific community, with coverage in at least three major reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The breakthrough must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.
- The breakthrough must be acknowledged by at least one major scientific organization (e.g., National Academy of Sciences, Royal Society, or equivalent).

A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that substantially advances knowledge or technology in fields such as physics, chemistry, biology, or earth sciences, and has the potential to lead to significant practical applications or theoretical advancements.

If the breakthrough is disputed or not widely accepted, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a breakthrough in particle physics lead to significant advancements in computing technologies by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a breakthrough in particle physics leads to significant advancements in computing technologies. 

A "breakthrough in particle physics" is defined as a discovery or development that is widely recognized by the scientific community and published in a peer-reviewed journal. 

"Significant advancements in computing technologies" are defined as improvements that result in at least one of the following:
- A tenfold increase in computational speed or efficiency.
- The development of a new type of computer or computational method that outperforms existing technologies by an order of magnitude.
- A breakthrough in quantum computing that leads to practical and scalable quantum computers.

The breakthrough and its impact must be confirmed by credible sources, including at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or scientific publications. 

In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the criteria outlined above.

title: Will the total number of operational satellites exceed 15,000 by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the total number of operational satellites in Earth's orbit exceeds 15,000. 

An operational satellite is defined as a satellite that is actively functioning and performing its intended mission, whether it be for communication, navigation, Earth observation, or scientific research. 

The count of operational satellites will be based on data from authoritative sources such as the Union of Concerned Scientists (UCS) Satellite Database, the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA), or reports from major space agencies like NASA, ESA, or commercial satellite operators. 

In the event of discrepancies between sources, the highest reported number will be used for resolution. Temporary malfunctions that are resolved within 30 days do not disqualify a satellite from being considered operational.

title: Will any major geopolitical event significantly alter the relationship between Canada and the United Kingdom by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a major geopolitical event significantly alters the relationship between Canada and the United Kingdom. A 'major geopolitical event' includes, but is not limited to:
- The signing of a new major treaty or agreement that substantially changes economic, military, or political relations.
- A significant diplomatic incident leading to the severance or substantial downgrading of diplomatic relations.
- The imposition of major sanctions by either country on the other.
- Significant military conflict involving both countries.

The change must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In the absence of a clear event, the question resolves as No.

title: Will Sweden hold a national referendum on a major political issue by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Sweden holds a national referendum on a major political issue.
A "national referendum" is defined as a vote in which all eligible voters in Sweden can participate to make a decision on a specific political issue.
A "major political issue" is defined as an issue that has significant national importance and has been widely covered by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, etc.).
The occurrence of the referendum must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Swedish government or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations.
Local or regional referendums do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States have a female president by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a female individual is inaugurated as President of the United States by December 31, 2028. The individual must be officially recognized as female at the time of inauguration. The inauguration must be confirmed by official government records or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a major political party in the United States adopt machine learning for campaign strategies by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any major political party in the United States (defined as the Democratic Party or the Republican Party) officially adopts machine learning techniques as a core component of their campaign strategy.

"Adopt machine learning for campaign strategies" is defined as using machine learning algorithms to analyze voter data, optimize outreach efforts, predict election outcomes, or any other significant aspect of their election campaign.

The adoption must be confirmed by an official announcement from the party or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters).

The question resolves as No if no such adoption is confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will a significant policy related to pharmacology be enacted in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a significant policy related to pharmacology is officially enacted in the United States.

A 'significant policy' is defined as one that brings substantial changes to the regulation, approval, pricing, or distribution of pharmaceutical drugs. This includes, but is not limited to, policies that:
- Introduce new regulatory frameworks for drug approval.
- Significantly alter drug pricing structures or introduce price controls.
- Change the legal status of certain drugs (e.g., reclassification of controlled substances).
- Expand or restrict access to specific medications.

The enactment of the policy must be confirmed by an official announcement from a relevant government body, such as the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), or through legislation passed by the U.S. Congress and signed into law by the President.

In the event of ambiguity or dispute, the resolution will be based on reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian).

title: Will a new information technology breakthrough significantly impact the NBA by 2028?
