body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new information technology breakthrough is officially recognized as having a significant impact on the NBA. A 'significant impact' is defined as a technology that is adopted by at least 50% of NBA teams or endorsed by the NBA itself and leads to measurable improvements in game strategy, player performance, or fan engagement. The breakthrough must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or confirmed through an official NBA announcement. Examples of significant impacts include, but are not limited to, advancements in data analytics, player tracking systems, virtual or augmented reality for training or fan experience, and AI-driven game strategies. In the event of ambiguity, the question will be resolved based on the consensus of experts in sports technology and analytics.

title: Will advancements in information technology play a crucial role in the resolution of the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, credible evidence shows that advancements in information technology played a crucial role in the resolution of the Russo-Ukrainian War. 'Advancements in information technology' include but are not limited to: cyber warfare, communication technologies, surveillance systems, and data analytics. The role of these advancements must be acknowledged in the resolution process by either the governments involved, major international organizations (e.g., United Nations, NATO), or documented in credible reports by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 'Resolution of the Russo-Ukrainian War' is defined as a formal cessation of hostilities and establishment of a peace agreement or treaty. If the war is ongoing or no formal resolution is reached by the end date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major geopolitical event significantly impact global biodiversity by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major geopolitical event significantly impacts global biodiversity. For this question, a 'major geopolitical event' is defined as a conflict, policy change, or international agreement involving at least two sovereign states or a significant non-state actor. 'Significantly impacts global biodiversity' means a measurable change in biodiversity metrics (e.g., species extinction rates, habitat loss, or ecosystem disruption) as reported by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN), the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), or a peer-reviewed scientific journal. In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the majority consensus among these sources.

title: Will the United Nations successfully implement a global agreement on biodiversity conservation by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations successfully implements a global agreement on biodiversity conservation that meets the following criteria:

- Formal Adoption: The agreement must be formally adopted by the United Nations General Assembly or another relevant UN body.
- Global Participation: At least 75% of UN member states must sign the agreement.
- Implementation Mechanism: The agreement must include specific, actionable mechanisms for biodiversity conservation, such as protected areas, species preservation plans, and sustainable resource management.
- Verification: The successful implementation must be verified by reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or an official UN report.
- Duration: The agreement must be intended to be in effect for at least 10 years.

In the event of a partial implementation or a regional agreement, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will advancements in computing lead to a 10% increase in energy efficiency in data centers by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a documented and verified 10% increase in energy efficiency in data centers due to advancements in computing technologies. The increase in energy efficiency must be measured against the baseline energy efficiency as of January 1, 2024. The verification must come from at least one of the following authoritative sources: 
- A peer-reviewed scientific journal 
- A report from a recognized industry body such as the Uptime Institute or the International Energy Agency (IEA)
- Confirmation from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).
The energy efficiency improvements must be attributable directly to advancements in computing technologies, such as more efficient algorithms, hardware improvements, or cooling technologies, rather than operational changes or renewable energy usage.

title: Will Microsoft release a groundbreaking machine learning algorithm by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Microsoft releases a machine learning algorithm that meets the following criteria: - It must be officially announced by Microsoft through a press release or an official blog post. - The algorithm must be recognized as groundbreaking by at least three major technology news organizations (e.g., TechCrunch, Wired, MIT Technology Review, Ars Technica, The Verge). - The algorithm must demonstrate a significant improvement in performance or capabilities compared to existing algorithms in its domain, as evidenced by benchmarks or peer-reviewed publications. - The algorithm must be made publicly available for use or research. In the absence of such an announcement, this question resolves as No.

title: Will machine learning techniques significantly advance the field of mathematics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, machine learning techniques lead to any of the following significant advancements in the field of mathematics:

- Proof of a major unsolved problem (e.g., one of the Millennium Prize Problems).
- Discovery of new mathematical theorems or principles that are widely recognized and cited by the mathematical community.
- Significant improvements in the efficiency or accuracy of existing mathematical methods or algorithms, as evidenced by peer-reviewed publications or presentations at major mathematical conferences.
- Development of new mathematical tools or frameworks that become standard practice in the field.

Recognition of these advancements must come from reputable sources such as peer-reviewed mathematical journals, major mathematical conferences, or endorsements by recognized mathematical authorities (e.g., the American Mathematical Society, Clay Mathematics Institute).

In the event of simultaneous advancements, the question will resolve as Yes based on the earliest recognized advancement.

title: Will there be a significant mathematical model applied in soccer analytics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a mathematical model is applied in soccer analytics that meets the following criteria:

- The model must be publicly acknowledged by at least three major soccer clubs or national teams as a significant tool for decision-making in areas such as player recruitment, game strategy, or performance analysis.
- The model must be developed using advanced mathematical or statistical techniques, including but not limited to machine learning, regression analysis, or network theory.
- The model's impact must be documented in reputable sources, such as peer-reviewed journals, major sports analytics conferences, or reports by credible news organizations (e.g., BBC Sport, ESPN, The Guardian, New York Times).
- The model must be operational and actively used in decision-making processes, not merely in an experimental or trial phase.

In the event of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on a consensus of expert opinions from at least three independent authorities in the field of sports analytics.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War result in a significant shift in European alliances by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, there is a significant shift in European alliances as a direct result of the Russo-Ukrainian War. A 'significant shift' is defined as one or more of the following:

- A country leaving or joining a major military alliance (e.g., NATO, CSTO).
- A major defense treaty being signed or terminated between European countries.
- A substantial realignment of foreign policy by a major European power (e.g., Germany, France, UK) towards Russia or Ukraine.

The shift must be confirmed by official announcements from the involved governments or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The shift must be directly attributed to the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Will the global market for information technology exceed $5 trillion by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the global market for information technology is reported to exceed $5 trillion USD for the year 2028.

The primary source for this determination will be an official report from a recognized market research firm or financial institution, such as Gartner, IDC, Forrester, or a similar reputable entity. If multiple sources provide conflicting information, the majority consensus will be used. In the event of a tie, the resolution will favor the more conservative estimate.

The global market for information technology includes hardware, software, services, and telecommunications, as defined by the reporting entity. The valuation must be in USD and adjusted for inflation to 2028 dollars if necessary.

title: Will Italy implement a nationwide AI-driven education system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Italy has officially implemented an AI-driven education system on a nationwide scale. The system must utilize artificial intelligence to personalize learning experiences, provide real-time feedback, and support administrative tasks across public schools in Italy.
The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation from the Italian Ministry of Education. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.
The system must be operational and accessible to students across the entire country, not in a pilot or trial phase. Partial implementations, such as limited to specific regions or schools, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve an AI-driven drug discovery platform by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) grants approval to a drug that was discovered using an AI-driven platform. The AI-driven platform must have played a significant role in the drug's discovery process, which can be demonstrated through documentation or official statements from the drug's developers.

The approval must be confirmed by an official announcement from the FDA. In the absence of an official FDA announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The AI-driven platform must utilize machine learning or other AI techniques to identify potential drug candidates, optimize drug properties, or predict drug efficacy and safety. Traditional computational methods that do not involve AI do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant geopolitical event involving chemical weapons occur before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, a significant geopolitical event involving the use of chemical weapons occurs. 
A 'significant geopolitical event' is defined as an event that meets the following criteria:
- The use of chemical weapons must be confirmed by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The event must result in at least 50 casualties (fatalities and/or injuries).
- The event must prompt a response or condemnation from at least two recognized sovereign states or international organizations (e.g., United Nations, NATO).

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of reputable sources. If no such consensus exists, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the European Union implement a unified digital identity system by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the European Union has officially implemented a unified digital identity system accessible to all its member states' citizens. The system must allow for secure identification and authentication of individuals across various services and platforms, both public and private, within the EU. The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the European Commission or another relevant EU authority. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be fully operational, not in a pilot or trial phase. Partial implementations or systems limited to specific member states do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI be used to develop new treatments or drugs in medicine by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an artificial intelligence (AI) system has been used to develop a new treatment or drug that meets the following criteria:

- The treatment or drug must be approved by at least one of the following regulatory agencies: the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the European Medicines Agency (EMA), or an equivalent authority in another country.
- The AI system must have played a significant role in the discovery or development process, as acknowledged in the scientific literature or by the developing company.
- The new treatment or drug must be publicly announced and documented in reputable sources such as peer-reviewed scientific journals or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

If multiple treatments or drugs are developed, the first one to meet these criteria will determine the resolution. If no such treatment or drug is developed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Italy implement a nationwide AI ethics policy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Italy officially implements a nationwide AI ethics policy. The policy must include guidelines or regulations addressing ethical concerns related to AI, such as fairness, transparency, accountability, and privacy. The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient. Partial implementations, such as regional policies or non-binding guidelines, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Switzerland develop a new cryptographic algorithm that becomes a global standard by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a cryptographic algorithm developed in Switzerland becomes a global standard. 

"Global standard" is defined as an algorithm that is adopted by at least three major international standards organizations (e.g., ISO, IEEE, IETF) or is widely implemented in major cryptographic libraries (e.g., OpenSSL, Bouncy Castle) and used in commercial products by at least five major multinational companies (e.g., Microsoft, Google, Apple, IBM, Amazon).

The algorithm must be publicly documented and verifiable through official publications or announcements from the relevant standards organizations or companies. 

In case of ambiguity, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be used to determine the resolution. 

The algorithm must be developed primarily in Switzerland, with at least 50% of the lead researchers or developers being affiliated with Swiss institutions or companies.

title: Will Canada implement a new electoral system before the 2028 federal elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, Canada officially implements a new electoral system for its federal elections. The new system must be different from the current first-past-the-post system and must be used in the federal elections held after the implementation.

The implementation of the new system must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (CBC, The Globe and Mail, Reuters, BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The new electoral system must be in effect for the federal elections to be considered implemented. Proposals, discussions, or partial implementations (e.g., pilot programs) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a comprehensive framework for the ethical use of machine learning in international relations by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Nations adopts a comprehensive framework specifically addressing the ethical use of machine learning in international relations. 

The framework must include, but is not limited to, guidelines on:
- Data privacy and security
- Bias and fairness
- Transparency and accountability
- Human oversight and control

The adoption of the framework must be confirmed through an official United Nations resolution or announcement. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

The framework must be endorsed by the majority of UN member states and be intended for implementation across multiple countries. Drafts, proposals, or frameworks limited to specific regions or sectors do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Israel implement a new voting system for national elections by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Israel officially implements a new voting system for national elections. 

A 'new voting system' is defined as a significant change from the existing system, which must involve one or more of the following:
- A change in the method of casting votes (e.g., from paper ballots to electronic voting).
- A change in the method of counting votes (e.g., from first-past-the-post to proportional representation).
- A change in voter eligibility criteria or voting procedures.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Israeli government or the Central Elections Committee. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Haaretz, The Jerusalem Post, BBC, The Guardian, New York Times) are sufficient.

The new system must be used in at least one national election (Knesset election) to count for resolution. Temporary changes or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major geopolitical event be triggered by advancements in chemistry by 2028?
Will Switzerland announce a significant breakthrough in genetic engineering by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland announces a significant breakthrough in genetic engineering. A 'significant breakthrough' is defined as a development that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- Introduction of a new genetic engineering technique or technology that substantially improves upon existing methods in terms of efficiency, accuracy, or applicability.
- Successful genetic modification of organisms that leads to a major advancement in medicine, agriculture, or environmental science.
- Publication of research in a peer-reviewed scientific journal that is recognized by the global scientific community as a major advancement in the field.

The announcement must come from an official Swiss government body, a leading Swiss research institution, or be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a new political treaty be signed between Ukraine and Russia by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an official political treaty is signed between Ukraine and Russia. The treaty must be formally signed by representatives of both countries and officially recognized by the United Nations or another authoritative international body. The treaty must address at least one significant political issue, such as territorial disputes, military actions, or diplomatic relations. Confirmation of the treaty signing must come from credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the event of multiple treaties, the first one that meets the criteria will be considered for resolution. Temporary agreements, ceasefires, or informal understandings do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve a revolutionary drug for a major disease based on natural science research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves a drug that meets the following criteria: 
- The drug must be classified as 'revolutionary,' meaning it offers a significant improvement over existing treatments for a major disease (e.g., cancer, Alzheimer's, diabetes).
- The drug's development must be primarily based on research in natural sciences (e.g., biology, chemistry, biochemistry).

Approval must be confirmed by an official FDA announcement. The drug must be available to the public and not just in experimental or limited-use stages. 

In the absence of an official FDA announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be sufficient to resolve this question as Yes.

If the drug is conditionally approved but later revoked or not fully approved by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will any country hold a referendum on the use of genetic editing in humans for medical purposes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any country officially holds a referendum on the use of genetic editing in humans for medical purposes. 

The referendum must be nationwide and officially sanctioned by the government. The genetic editing in question must pertain to medical purposes, including but not limited to, treatment or prevention of diseases and genetic disorders. 

The holding of the referendum must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

If the referendum is postponed or cancelled after being officially announced, the question will still resolve as Yes if the official announcement was made before the resolution date.

title: Will a new political party gain a majority in the US House of Representatives by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party other than the Democratic Party or the Republican Party gains a majority in the US House of Representatives. 

A "majority" is defined as holding more than half of the total 435 seats in the House of Representatives. 

The party must be officially recognized as a distinct political entity by the Federal Election Commission (FEC). 

The resolution will be based on the official results published by the Clerk of the House of Representatives following the 2028 general elections or any subsequent special elections that lead to a change in majority control.

title: Will Switzerland implement a nationwide AI-driven energy management system by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Switzerland has officially implemented a nationwide energy management system driven by artificial intelligence.

The system must meet the following criteria:

- Nationwide Scope: The system must be operational across the entire country, not limited to specific regions or cities.
- AI-Driven: The system must utilize artificial intelligence for real-time monitoring, optimization, and management of energy resources.
- Official Implementation: The deployment must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice.
- Operational Status: The system must be fully operational, not in a trial or pilot phase. Temporary or event-specific implementations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the United States achieve a 50% reduction in energy consumption through AI optimization by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States achieves a 50% reduction in energy consumption compared to its energy consumption as of January 1, 2024, through the use of AI optimization techniques. 

The reduction must be documented and attributed primarily to AI optimization by an official government report or documentation from the U.S. Department of Energy. Alternatively, confirmation can come from credible reports by at least three major news organizations (e.g., The New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

AI optimization techniques refer to artificial intelligence methods used to analyze, predict, and optimize energy consumption and efficiency in various sectors, including but not limited to residential, commercial, and industrial sectors.

In the event of partial achievement, such as a reduction of less than 50%, or if the reduction cannot be primarily attributed to AI optimization, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system designed in Switzerland win an international AI competition by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system designed in Switzerland wins first place in a recognized international AI competition.

An "AI system designed in Switzerland" is defined as an artificial intelligence system where the majority of its development and design took place in Switzerland. This can be verified by the affiliation of the primary developers or the institution/company responsible for the AI system.

A "recognized international AI competition" refers to competitions such as the ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Challenge (ILSVRC), the DARPA Grand Challenge, the Kaggle Competitions, or any other competition acknowledged by the AI research community and reported by reputable sources like IEEE Spectrum, MIT Technology Review, or major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The win must be confirmed by the official results of the competition and reported by at least two reputable news organizations. If there is any ambiguity or dispute over the winner, the question will remain unresolved until a clear consensus is reached.

title: Will a significant computational method for solving complex chemical reactions be developed by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a novel computational method for solving complex chemical reactions is developed and meets the following criteria:

- The method must significantly improve the accuracy or efficiency of predicting the outcomes of complex chemical reactions compared to existing methods as of 2023.
- The method must be recognized and validated by the scientific community, specifically through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presentation at a major scientific conference.
- The method must be adopted or cited by at least three independent research groups or institutions within one year of its publication or presentation.
- The method should be applicable to a broad range of complex chemical reactions, not limited to a specific subset.

If these criteria are not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new engineering project aimed at connecting two countries be completed by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an engineering project aimed at physically connecting two countries is officially completed. The project must involve the construction of infrastructure such as a bridge, tunnel, or similar structure that allows for continuous travel between the two countries.

The completion of the project must be confirmed by an official announcement from the governments of the connected countries or the organization responsible for the project. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice.

The project must be fully operational and open for public use. Temporary structures, projects still under construction, or those only partially operational will not count towards this resolution.

title: Will a new international treaty on chemical weapons be signed by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new international treaty specifically addressing the regulation, reduction, or elimination of chemical weapons is signed by at least two recognized sovereign states.

The treaty must be formally signed, not just agreed upon in principle or verbally. The signing must be confirmed by official government announcements or documentation from the involved countries, or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

The treaty must be new and not a mere amendment or extension of an existing treaty. If multiple treaties are signed, the first one to meet the criteria will be considered for resolution. The question resolves as No if no such treaty is signed by the specified date.

title: Will South Korea achieve a significant advancement in climate change mitigation technologies by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, South Korea achieves a significant advancement in climate change mitigation technologies. For the purposes of this question, 'significant advancement' is defined as:

- Development and deployment of a technology or set of technologies that reduce greenhouse gas emissions by at least 15% compared to 2023 levels, as verified by South Korea's Ministry of Environment or an equivalent authoritative body.
- The advancement must be acknowledged by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- The technology must be implemented on a national scale or have clear plans for nationwide implementation within the subsequent year.

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of the sources mentioned above.

title: Will the United States implement new nationwide COVID-19 restrictions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States federal government implements new nationwide restrictions specifically aimed at controlling the spread of COVID-19. 

For the purpose of this question, 'nationwide restrictions' are defined as regulations or mandates that apply to the entire country and are enforced by federal agencies. These could include, but are not limited to, lockdowns, mandatory mask-wearing, travel bans, or vaccination mandates. 

The implementation of such restrictions must be confirmed through an official announcement by a federal government authority such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian) are sufficient.

State-level or local restrictions, as well as recommendations or guidelines that are not legally enforceable, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to significantly enhance aerospace engineering designs by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) is used to significantly enhance aerospace engineering designs. For the purposes of this question, 'significantly enhance' means that AI must contribute to at least one of the following: - A reduction of at least 15% in the weight of aerospace structures without compromising safety or performance. - An improvement of at least 20% in fuel efficiency of aerospace vehicles. - A reduction of at least 20% in the time required for the design and testing phases of aerospace engineering projects. - The creation of entirely new design methodologies or structures that were not feasible without AI. Verification must come from credible sources such as peer-reviewed journals, official announcements from aerospace companies, or reports from reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will artificial intelligence lead to a major breakthrough in energy storage technologies by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) is credited with leading to a major breakthrough in energy storage technologies. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a development that significantly improves the energy density, efficiency, cost, or scalability of energy storage systems by at least 50% compared to the best available technology in 2023. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or confirmed by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The AI's role must be explicitly acknowledged in the research or news reports as being pivotal to the discovery or development. Incremental improvements or applications of existing technologies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used to develop a cure for a major disease by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, artificial intelligence (AI) is used to develop a cure for a major disease. 

A "major disease" is defined as a disease that significantly impacts public health and is recognized as such by the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Examples include, but are not limited to, cancer, Alzheimer's disease, HIV/AIDS, or diabetes.

To count as a "cure," the treatment must:
- Completely eradicate the disease in a human patient or a significant percentage of human patients in clinical trials.
- Be recognized and approved by at least one major health regulatory body, such as the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the European Medicines Agency (EMA).

The role of AI must be explicitly acknowledged in the development process, either in scientific publications or official statements from the research team or organization responsible for the cure. The AI's contribution must be substantial, such as identifying potential treatment compounds, designing clinical trials, or optimizing treatment protocols.

In the event of multiple cures developed simultaneously, the earliest officially recognized cure will be considered for resolution.

title: Will Italy's government undergo a significant political shift (e.g., change in ruling party or coalition) by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Italy's government undergoes a significant political shift defined as one of the following:

- Change in the ruling party or coalition: A new party or coalition forms the government, replacing the current ruling party or coalition.
- Prime Minister Change: A new Prime Minister is appointed who is not from the current ruling party or coalition.
- Major Policy Shift: Implementation of a major policy shift that overturns or significantly alters key policies of the current government.

The change must be confirmed by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). The question resolves as No if none of these criteria are met by the resolution date.

title: Will a significant development in particle physics algorithms for quantum computing occur by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a significant development in particle physics algorithms specifically designed for quantum computing. A "significant development" is defined as one that meets the following criteria:

- Peer-Reviewed Publication: The development must be documented in at least one peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- Practical Implementation: There must be evidence of practical implementation or experimental validation, demonstrating a clear advancement over existing algorithms.
- Recognition: The development must be recognized as significant by at least two authoritative sources in the field, such as major scientific organizations (e.g., CERN, APS) or reputable scientific publications (e.g., Nature, Science).

This question resolves as YES upon the publication and recognition of the development as defined above. Otherwise, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will AI-driven methods revolutionize chemical synthesis by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven methods are recognized as having revolutionized chemical synthesis. To qualify as a revolution, the following criteria must be met:

- Significant Improvement: AI-driven methods must demonstrate a substantial improvement in efficiency, yield, or cost-effectiveness compared to traditional methods. This should be evidenced by at least three peer-reviewed publications in reputable scientific journals.
- Industry Adoption: AI-driven methods must be adopted by at least three major chemical or pharmaceutical companies, as evidenced by official announcements or reports in reputable industry publications.
- Breakthrough Innovations: AI-driven methods must lead to at least one breakthrough innovation in chemical synthesis that would have been unlikely or impossible without AI. This should be confirmed by expert consensus in the scientific community, as evidenced by reviews or commentaries in reputable scientific journals.

In the absence of these criteria being met, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will South Korea elect its first female president by the end of 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a female candidate is officially declared the winner of the South Korean presidential election by the National Election Commission of South Korea. The candidate must be inaugurated as the President of South Korea for the resolution to be considered valid. In the event of an election dispute or recount, the final decision by the National Election Commission will be used for resolution. News reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the election and inauguration are also sufficient for resolution.

title: Will there be a significant political development related to epidemiology policies in South Korea by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, there is a significant political development in South Korea specifically related to epidemiology policies. 
A 'significant political development' is defined as any of the following:
- The introduction or amendment of a major epidemiology-related law or policy by the South Korean National Assembly.
- A major public health initiative or program launched by the South Korean government aimed at combating or preventing epidemics.
- A significant change in the organizational structure or leadership of South Korea's public health agencies directly related to epidemiology.

Confirmation of such developments must come from an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of such an announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

The question will not resolve as Yes for minor policy changes, temporary measures, or developments not directly related to epidemiology.

title: Will there be a major political decision regarding chemistry research funding in South Korea by the end of 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the South Korean government makes a major political decision specifically regarding funding for chemistry research. 
A "major political decision" is defined as any of the following:
- Passing of new legislation or significant amendments to existing laws specifically increasing or decreasing funding for chemistry research.
- Official government announcements or policy changes that result in a budgetary increase or decrease of at least 20% for chemistry research funding.

The decision must be confirmed through official government publications or announcements. In the absence of such publications, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

This question resolves as NO if no such decision is made by the specified date.

title: Will the UK government introduce new regulations on Amazon's operations by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the UK government introduces new regulations specifically targeting Amazon's operations. These regulations must be officially published in government documents or announced through an official government press release or website. The regulations must directly impact Amazon's business practices, such as changes in taxation, labor laws, data privacy, or competition rules. General regulations affecting all e-commerce companies or all large corporations do not count unless they explicitly mention Amazon. Confirmation from at least two reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will also be considered valid.

title: Will the US Congress pass a major funding bill for particle physics research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the United States Congress passes a bill that provides significant funding specifically for particle physics research.

To qualify as a major funding bill, the bill must meet the following criteria:

- The bill must allocate at least $1 billion USD specifically for particle physics research.
- The funding must be directed towards research facilities, projects, or initiatives within the field of particle physics.
- The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States.

Confirmation of the bill's passage and its contents must be obtained from official government records or announcements. Reports from reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are also acceptable for verification.

If multiple bills are passed, the first bill to meet the criteria will be considered for resolution. If no such bill is passed by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will a groundbreaking discovery in particle physics be made by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a groundbreaking discovery in particle physics is announced and recognized by the scientific community. The discovery must meet at least one of the following criteria:

- Discovery of a new fundamental particle that is not part of the Standard Model.
- Experimental confirmation of a theoretical prediction that significantly alters our understanding of particle physics.
- Detection of phenomena that cannot be explained by current particle physics theories and that lead to new theoretical developments.

The discovery must be confirmed by at least one of the following authoritative sources: CERN, Fermilab, or a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal such as Physical Review Letters, Nature, or Science. Additionally, the discovery must be widely recognized by the scientific community, as evidenced by coverage in major scientific news outlets or endorsements by leading physicists.

If there is any ambiguity or dispute regarding the significance of the discovery, the question will resolve based on the consensus of a panel of experts from leading institutions in the field of particle physics.

title: Will a new political party focused on medicine and healthcare emerge in the United States by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new political party primarily focused on medicine and healthcare is officially registered and recognized in the United States. The party must meet the following criteria:

- Official Registration: The party must be officially registered with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) as a national political party.
- Primary Focus: The party's platform, as stated in its official documentation, must primarily focus on issues related to medicine and healthcare.
- Public Activity: The party must have engaged in public political activities, such as running candidates in federal elections or organizing national campaigns related to its platform.

Confirmation of the party's registration and activities must come from reputable sources such as official government announcements or documentation, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian).

title: Will there be a significant political event related to Chemistry in any major country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a significant political event directly related to the field of Chemistry occurs in any major country. For the purpose of this question, a 'significant political event' is defined as one that meets any of the following criteria:

- Legislation: The passing of new national legislation or major amendments to existing laws specifically targeting chemical production, regulation, or research.
- International Agreements: The signing or ratification of international treaties or agreements focused on chemical safety, production, or research.
- Government Actions: Major government actions such as the establishment of new regulatory bodies, significant funding initiatives, or the imposition of substantial sanctions related to chemical activities.
- Public Protests or Movements: Large-scale public protests or movements specifically centered around chemical policies, safety, or environmental impact, covered by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

The event must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to be considered valid. The term 'major country' refers to any of the G20 member countries.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI that significantly advances the understanding of protein folding by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, DeepMind develops an AI system that significantly advances the understanding of protein folding. 'Significantly advances' is defined as achieving at least one of the following milestones: (i) Predicting the 3D structure of proteins with an accuracy surpassing current state-of-the-art methods by a substantial margin, as evidenced by a performance metric improvement of at least 10% in the Critical Assessment of protein Structure Prediction (CASP) competition. (ii) Making a breakthrough in understanding the folding mechanisms of proteins that leads to new insights or theories, as recognized by a publication in a top-tier peer-reviewed scientific journal (e.g., Nature, Science, Cell). (iii) Developing a practical application or tool based on protein folding that has a significant impact on biomedical research or pharmaceutical development, confirmed by adoption or endorsement from leading institutions (e.g., NIH, WHO, major pharmaceutical companies). The resolution of this question will be based on official announcements from DeepMind, publications in peer-reviewed journals, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will global average temperatures increase by more than 1.5°C compared to pre-industrial levels by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the global average temperature has increased by more than 1.5°C compared to pre-industrial levels (defined as the average temperature over the period 1850-1900). The primary source for temperature data will be the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) or the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC). If both sources provide data, the WMO data will take precedence. If neither organization provides the necessary data, the question will resolve based on the consensus of at least three reputable scientific institutions (e.g., NASA, NOAA, Hadley Centre). In case of conflicting data, the question will resolve based on the majority agreement among these sources.

title: Will a new exoplanet capable of supporting life be discovered by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new exoplanet is discovered that meets the following criteria for being capable of supporting life:

- Location: The exoplanet must be located within the habitable zone of its star, where conditions are right for liquid water to exist.
- Size and Composition: The exoplanet must be terrestrial (rocky) and have a size and mass within 0.5 to 2 times that of Earth.
- Atmosphere: The exoplanet must have an atmosphere containing elements essential for life as we understand it, such as oxygen, nitrogen, and carbon dioxide.
- Temperature: Surface temperatures on the exoplanet must be within a range that allows for the presence of liquid water.

The discovery must be confirmed by at least one of the following authoritative sources: NASA, ESA, or a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The exoplanet must be a new discovery as of the date of this question's posting.

title: Will South Korea develop a top-performing AI system for mathematical problem-solving by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system developed by a South Korean organization is recognized as a top-performing system for mathematical problem-solving. 

"Top-performing" is defined as achieving a performance level within the top 5% of all AI systems in international mathematical problem-solving competitions or benchmarks, such as the International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO) or similar events. 

The AI system's performance must be verified through official competition results or benchmarking reports. Reputable sources such as publications in peer-reviewed journals, announcements by recognized AI research organizations, or credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) can also be used for verification. 

In case of disputes or ambiguous results, the consensus of the scientific and AI research community will be considered for the final resolution.

title: Will Israel hold a national election before 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Israel holds a national election before January 1, 2028. A national election is defined as an election for the Knesset, Israel's national legislature. The date of the election must be officially recognized and confirmed by the Central Elections Committee of Israel. In the event of multiple elections, the question resolves as Yes upon the first occurrence. If no national election is held before January 1, 2028, the question resolves as No.

title: Will a candidate with a background in aerospace engineering run for a major political office in any country by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a candidate with a background in aerospace engineering runs for a major political office in any country.

For the purposes of this question:
- "Background in aerospace engineering" is defined as having a degree in aerospace engineering or having worked professionally in the field of aerospace engineering for at least five years.
- "Major political office" includes positions such as President, Prime Minister, Governor, Senator, Member of Parliament, or equivalent high-ranking offices in a country's government.

The candidacy must be officially declared and recognized by a reputable news source, such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, or Bloomberg.

In the event of ambiguity, the resolution will be based on a consensus of reports from at least three major news organizations.

title: Will Brazil hold a presidential election with a peaceful transfer of power by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Brazil holds a presidential election and the transfer of power to the newly elected president occurs without significant violence or large-scale civil unrest.

For the purposes of this question, a 'peaceful transfer of power' means that:
1. The outgoing president concedes defeat and publicly acknowledges the newly elected president.
2. The newly elected president is inaugurated and assumes office without any major incidents of violence or widespread civil unrest.
3. There are no military coups or attempts to overthrow the elected government.

Confirmation of the peaceful transfer of power must come from credible news sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or Reuters. In case of conflicting reports, the consensus among these sources will be considered authoritative.

title: Will there be a major breakthrough in immunotherapy for cancer treatment by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major breakthrough in immunotherapy for cancer treatment is announced and meets the following criteria:

- The breakthrough must be acknowledged by a reputable medical authority, such as the American Cancer Society (ACS), the National Cancer Institute (NCI), or the World Health Organization (WHO).
- The breakthrough must be published in a peer-reviewed medical journal or presented at a major medical conference.
- The breakthrough must demonstrate a statistically significant improvement in survival rates or quality of life for cancer patients, compared to existing treatments, as reported in clinical trials.
- The breakthrough must be applicable to at least one type of cancer and show potential for broader application across multiple types of cancer.

In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus of the scientific and medical community will be used to determine the outcome. If no such breakthrough is announced by the specified date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) release a comprehensive report on the long-term effects of COVID-19 by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) releases a comprehensive report detailing the long-term effects of COVID-19.

The report must include:
- Analysis of data collected over multiple years, specifically focusing on the long-term health outcomes of COVID-19 survivors.
- Detailed findings on physical, mental, and neurological health impacts.
- Recommendations for healthcare providers and policymakers based on the findings.

The report must be publicly accessible on the CDC's official website or published in a peer-reviewed medical journal. A press release or announcement alone is insufficient unless it accompanies the full report.

In the absence of a comprehensive report, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the release of such a report by the CDC will also be accepted.

title: Will a new element be discovered and added to the periodic table by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new chemical element is discovered and officially added to the periodic table of elements.

The new element must be recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) and assigned an official name and atomic number. The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or announced by IUPAC.

If multiple elements are discovered simultaneously, the resolution will be based on the first element officially recognized and added by IUPAC.

title: Will Amazon face significant geopolitical challenges in its international operations by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Amazon faces significant geopolitical challenges in its international operations. 'Significant geopolitical challenges' are defined as any of the following:

- Amazon's operations are officially restricted or banned in a country that contributes at least 5% of its international revenue, as reported in its latest annual financial statement.
- Amazon faces sanctions or major regulatory actions from any country or international organization that materially affect its ability to operate in that region.
- Amazon's senior executives are publicly summoned or sanctioned by a national government or international organization in a manner that disrupts its international operations.

The occurrence of any of these events must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, The New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). In the absence of such reports, official government announcements or documents will be considered authoritative.

title: Will artificial intelligence be used by the Bureau of Labor Statistics for employment predictions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) in the United States officially uses artificial intelligence (AI) for employment predictions. 

The use of AI must be confirmed through an official announcement or documentation from the BLS. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will suffice.

The AI system must be operational and used in official BLS employment reports or forecasts. Experimental or trial uses of AI do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will any country announce a significant breakthrough in climate change mitigation technologies by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, any country announces a significant breakthrough in climate change mitigation technologies. 
A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a development that meets at least one of the following criteria:
- Reduces greenhouse gas emissions by at least 20% from current levels.
- Increases the efficiency of renewable energy sources by at least 30%.
- Introduces a new technology or method that is adopted by at least 10 countries within a year of the announcement.

The announcement must be made by an official government body or agency and reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). 
If multiple breakthroughs are announced, the first one to meet the criteria will be considered for the resolution of this question. 
In the absence of such an announcement, this question resolves as No.

title: Will the United States achieve a 50% reduction in carbon emissions by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States achieves a 50% reduction in carbon emissions compared to the baseline year of 2005. The reduction must be confirmed by official data from the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) or another authoritative body such as the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). The reduction must be in total greenhouse gas emissions, measured in CO2-equivalent terms. In the absence of official data, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. Temporary reductions due to exceptional circumstances (e.g., natural disasters, pandemics) do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will renewable energy sources account for more than 50% of global energy production by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, renewable energy sources (including solar, wind, hydro, geothermal, and biomass) account for more than 50% of global energy production.

The data for this determination must come from reputable sources such as the International Energy Agency (IEA), the United Nations (UN), or equivalent authoritative bodies. 

The calculation should be based on the total energy production from all sources, and renewable energy sources must collectively contribute more than half of this total. 

In the event of conflicting data, the consensus of the majority of these authoritative sources will be used to resolve the question.

Temporary spikes in renewable energy production due to unusual circumstances (e.g., temporary shutdowns of non-renewable energy plants) will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI be used to develop a new epidemiological model that becomes a global standard by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI-developed epidemiological model is officially recognized as a global standard by at least two of the following organizations: the World Health Organization (WHO), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC).

The model must be developed using artificial intelligence techniques and must be publicly acknowledged by these organizations as a primary tool for global epidemiological analysis and response. The recognition must be documented through official publications, press releases, or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

If multiple models are recognized, the first one to meet the criteria will resolve the question as Yes. In the absence of such recognition, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system be developed to analyze data from black holes and make significant discoveries by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system is developed that makes significant discoveries related to black holes. 

A 'significant discovery' is defined as one that meets at least one of the following criteria:
- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized by the scientific community as a breakthrough in the understanding of black holes.
- Confirmed by a major space research organization (e.g., NASA, ESA) as a notable advancement in black hole research.
- Reported by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) as a significant scientific achievement.

The AI system must be explicitly credited with the discovery in the publication or announcement. The discovery must be independently verified by experts in the field to ensure its validity. In the case of multiple discoveries, the first to meet the criteria will be considered for resolution.

title: Will AI be used to solve a significant problem in physics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an artificial intelligence (AI) system is credited with solving a significant problem in the field of physics. A "significant problem" is defined as one that has been widely recognized as important and challenging within the physics community.

The resolution criteria are as follows:

- The problem must be acknowledged as significant by a reputable scientific organization, such as the American Physical Society (APS) or the European Physical Society (EPS).
- The AI system's solution must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major physics conference.
- The solution must be independently verified and accepted by experts in the field.
- The AI system must be explicitly credited as the primary contributor to the solution in the publication or presentation.

In the event of multiple AI systems solving different significant problems, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one AI system meets the above criteria.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) propose major changes to federal computing regulations by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the Democratic Party (US) formally proposes significant amendments or new legislation aimed at altering federal computing regulations. The proposal must be introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and must be officially documented in the Congressional Record. The changes should address at least one of the following areas: data privacy, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, or digital infrastructure. Minor amendments, symbolic gestures, or non-binding resolutions do not count towards this question's resolution. Confirmation must come from reputable sources such as the Congressional Record, official announcements from the Democratic Party, or credible reports from major news organizations (e.g., The New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, BBC, The Guardian).

title: Will a computer model accurately predict the outcome of the 2028 NBA Finals?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a computer model accurately predicts the outcome of the 2028 NBA Finals. The prediction must specify the winning team before the start of the Finals series and must be made public through a reputable platform or publication (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, or an equivalent). The model must correctly predict the winning team and the number of games won by the champion team in the series (e.g., 4-2). The accuracy of the prediction must be verified by at least two major sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic). A prediction is considered accurate if it matches the actual outcome of the Finals series as reported by the NBA.

title: Will any country pass legislation regulating the use of robotics in political campaigns by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any country passes legislation specifically regulating the use of robotics in political campaigns. 

The legislation must explicitly mention robotics and outline rules, restrictions, or guidelines for their use in the context of political campaigns. 

The passage of such legislation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or publication in a government registry. 

In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. 

The legislation must be enacted and not merely proposed or debated. 

In case of amendments or partial regulations, the question resolves as Yes if the core aspect of regulating robotics in political campaigns is addressed.

title: Will a Swiss university develop a groundbreaking machine learning algorithm by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a Swiss university develops a machine learning algorithm that meets at least one of the following criteria:

- The algorithm achieves a performance breakthrough in a well-established benchmark or competition, such as ImageNet, COCO, or any other major AI/ML competition recognized by the scientific community.
- The algorithm introduces a novel approach or technique that is widely adopted and cited by the academic and industrial AI/ML communities, with at least 1000 citations in peer-reviewed journals or conferences.
- The algorithm is officially recognized as groundbreaking by a major AI/ML conference or journal, such as NeurIPS, ICML, or JMLR.

The development and breakthrough must be confirmed by an official announcement from the university or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a new machine learning model outperform current state-of-the-art algorithms in computing tasks by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new machine learning model outperforms current state-of-the-art algorithms in one or more of the following computing tasks:
- Image recognition: Achieves a higher accuracy rate than the current best model on a widely recognized benchmark dataset (e.g., ImageNet).
- Natural language processing: Outperforms the current best model in tasks such as language translation, sentiment analysis, or question answering on widely recognized benchmarks (e.g., GLUE, SuperGLUE).
- Game playing: Defeats the current best model or human players in complex games (e.g., Go, Chess) under standard competitive conditions.

Performance must be verified through peer-reviewed publications or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The new model must be publicly acknowledged by the scientific community as outperforming previous state-of-the-art algorithms. In case of ambiguity, the consensus of the scientific community will be considered.

title: Will a new species be discovered in the Amazon rainforest by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new species is discovered in the Amazon rainforest and meets the following criteria:

- The species must be recognized as new to science and not previously documented or described.
- The discovery must be confirmed by a peer-reviewed scientific publication or an official announcement by a recognized scientific authority (e.g., International Union for Conservation of Nature, National Geographic Society).
- The species must be identified based on clear morphological or genetic evidence.

In the event of a dispute regarding the novelty of the species, the question will resolve based on the consensus of the scientific community as reflected in peer-reviewed publications.

title: Will the Conservative Party win the most seats in the United Kingdom general election in 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the Conservative Party wins the most seats in the United Kingdom general election held in 2028.

"Winning the most seats" means that the Conservative Party secures more seats than any other individual party in the House of Commons following the 2028 general election. 

The results must be confirmed by the official announcement from the UK Electoral Commission. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be sufficient. 

In case of a tie in the number of seats with another party, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant change in voter turnout for any major election in 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if there is a significant change in voter turnout for any major election in 2028. A 'significant change' is defined as a change of at least 5 percentage points compared to the previous corresponding election. 

'Voter turnout' is the percentage of eligible voters who cast a ballot in the election. 

'Major election' refers to national-level elections, such as presidential, parliamentary, or congressional elections. 

The change in voter turnout must be reported by at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) or confirmed by official election authorities in the respective country. 

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of the reputable sources mentioned above.

title: Will a new elementary particle be discovered in particle physics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new elementary particle is discovered and confirmed by the scientific community. The discovery must meet the following criteria:

- The particle must be a previously unknown elementary particle, not a composite particle or a known particle in a different state.
- The discovery must be announced by a major particle physics research organization such as CERN, Fermilab, or a similar institution.
- The discovery must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and corroborated by independent experiments or observations.
- The particle's properties (such as mass, charge, and spin) must be clearly identified and distinguishable from known particles.

In the event of a disputed discovery, the question will resolve as Yes only if the majority of the scientific community accepts the discovery by the resolution date. If no such consensus is reached, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will AI-driven technologies lead to significant advancements in healthcare in Brazil by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven technologies lead to significant advancements in healthcare in Brazil. 'Significant advancements' are defined as:

- Implementation of AI systems in at least 30% of hospitals for diagnostics, treatment planning, or patient management.
- Documented improvement in patient outcomes, such as reduced mortality rates or improved recovery times, attributable to AI-driven technologies.
- Official reports or studies from reputable health organizations (e.g., Brazil's Ministry of Health, WHO) or publications in peer-reviewed medical journals confirming these advancements.

The resolution will be based on official announcements, government reports, or credible news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of official announcements, reports from at least three major news organizations are sufficient.

title: Will any G7 country pass legislation regulating genetic editing in humans for non-medical purposes by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any G7 country passes legislation that specifically regulates genetic editing in humans for non-medical purposes. 

A G7 country includes Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States. 

"Genetic editing" refers to the deliberate alteration of an individual's DNA using technologies such as CRISPR or other gene-editing tools. "Non-medical purposes" refers to enhancements or modifications not intended to treat or prevent diseases or medical conditions.

The legislation must be officially enacted, not just proposed or debated. Confirmation of the legislation's passage must come from an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In case of partial or unclear legislation, the question will resolve as Yes if the primary intent is to regulate genetic editing for non-medical purposes.

title: Will Brazil achieve a major breakthrough in Amazon rainforest conservation by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Brazil achieves a major breakthrough in Amazon rainforest conservation, meeting one or more of the following criteria:
- A significant reduction in the annual deforestation rate of the Amazon rainforest, verified by satellite data from reputable sources such as NASA, ESA, or Brazil's National Institute for Space Research (INPE).
- The implementation and enforcement of new, comprehensive conservation laws that lead to measurable improvements in biodiversity, as reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- The successful restoration of a substantial area of previously deforested land in the Amazon, with evidence of native species returning, confirmed by peer-reviewed scientific studies or reports from recognized environmental organizations (e.g., WWF, Greenpeace).

In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the majority of the sources mentioned above.

title: Will the outcome of the 2028 US congressional elections significantly impact national energy policies?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the outcome of the 2028 US congressional elections leads to significant changes in national energy policies. 

Significant changes are defined as:
- The passage of at least one major piece of federal legislation directly related to energy policy, which includes but is not limited to, renewable energy initiatives, fossil fuel regulations, or energy efficiency standards. 
- Major executive actions or regulatory changes by federal agencies that alter the direction of national energy policy. 

The changes must be reported by at least three reputable news sources such as the New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, or Bloomberg. 

If no such changes occur, this question resolves as No.

title: Will the 2028 US congressional elections result in a significant shift in political power?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the 2028 US congressional elections result in a significant shift in political power, defined as follows:

- A change in the majority control of either the House of Representatives or the Senate.
- A net gain or loss of at least 20 seats in the House of Representatives by a single party.
- A net gain or loss of at least 5 seats in the Senate by a single party.

The resolution will be based on the official results as reported by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or another authoritative source. In the case of disputed results, the resolution will be based on the outcome after all legal challenges and recounts are resolved.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) implement a major policy change related to pandemic response by 2028?
body:
