This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, quantum computing technology is demonstrated to have a significant impact on sports analytics, including basketball, meeting the following criteria:

- Published Research: At least one peer-reviewed research paper or a major industry report demonstrates the application of quantum computing in sports analytics, specifically mentioning basketball.
- Performance Improvement: The research must show a measurable improvement in predictive accuracy, strategy optimization, or player performance analysis directly attributable to quantum computing techniques.
- Industry Adoption: At least one professional sports team or major sports analytics company publicly acknowledges the use of quantum computing for basketball analytics.

The demonstration of impact must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a major golf tournament be disrupted due to geopolitical tensions by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, any of the four major golf tournaments (The Masters, PGA Championship, U.S. Open, The Open Championship) is disrupted due to geopolitical tensions.

"Disrupted" means any of the following:
- Cancellation or postponement of the tournament.
- Significant alteration of the tournament schedule (e.g., change of venue, dates, or format).
- Withdrawal of a significant number of participants (at least 25%) due to geopolitical tensions.

"Geopolitical tensions" include, but are not limited to, international conflicts, trade wars, diplomatic disputes, or sanctions that directly impact the tournament.

The disruption must be confirmed by an official announcement from the tournament organizers or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post).

If no such disruption occurs by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant biological threat that impacts international relations by 2028?
Will an AI system be used to detect black holes before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, an AI system is officially credited with the detection of a black hole. The detection must be confirmed by at least one of the following authoritative sources: NASA, ESA, or a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

The AI system must be explicitly acknowledged as the primary tool or method used in the detection process. The detection must include verifiable data and methodology that meets the scientific standards as of 2023. 

In the event of multiple detections, the first confirmed detection will be considered for this question's resolution. If there are conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the scientific community as reflected in reputable scientific publications.

title: Will the United Kingdom implement AI-driven public services nationwide by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United Kingdom has officially implemented AI-driven public services on a nationwide scale. 'AI-driven public services' are defined as services provided by the government that utilize artificial intelligence to perform tasks or make decisions typically done by humans. Examples include, but are not limited to, AI-driven healthcare triage, AI-based legal assistance, and AI-managed public transportation.

The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The services must be operational and accessible to the general public, not in a trial phase or limited to specific regions.

Temporary implementations or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution. If there are multiple services implemented, at least one must be accessible nationwide to resolve this question as Yes.

title: Will there be a significant advancement in AI for drug discovery by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is a significant advancement in AI for drug discovery, defined by the following criteria:

- Development of an AI model that can predict the efficacy of new drug compounds with an accuracy rate of at least 90%.
- The AI model must be utilized in at least one peer-reviewed study that demonstrates its ability to identify a novel drug compound that successfully passes Phase I clinical trials.
- Verification of the AI model's success by at least two major pharmaceutical companies or research institutions.

The advancement must be reported in credible sources such as peer-reviewed scientific journals or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will Canada become a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, Canada is officially recognized as a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC).

"Permanent member" refers to a member nation that has been granted permanent status and the associated veto power within the UNSC, similar to the current permanent members (China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States).

The official recognition must come from an authoritative source such as an official United Nations announcement or documentation. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

Temporary or rotating membership does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a significant geopolitical conflict involving the Amazon rainforest by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a significant geopolitical conflict involving the Amazon rainforest occurs. 

A 'significant geopolitical conflict' is defined as one that meets any of the following criteria:
- Involves military action or armed conflict between two or more countries.
- Results in the imposition of economic sanctions by one country or a coalition of countries against another country over issues directly related to the Amazon rainforest.
- Leads to a formal dispute brought before an international body such as the United Nations or the International Court of Justice, explicitly concerning the Amazon rainforest.

To resolve as Yes, the conflict must be reported by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). 

If no such conflict is reported by the resolution date, this question resolves as No.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI that can consistently outperform human experts in medical diagnosis by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI developed by DeepMind consistently outperforms human experts in medical diagnosis. 

The criteria for 'consistently outperform' are:
1. The AI achieves a diagnostic accuracy rate at least 5% higher than the average accuracy rate of human experts in the same field, across multiple studies.
2. The AI's performance is validated through peer-reviewed publications or presentations at major medical conferences.
3. The AI is tested across a diverse set of medical conditions and patient demographics.

Human experts are defined as board-certified physicians with at least 5 years of clinical experience in the relevant field. 

The studies must be conducted by independent research institutions or hospitals and must be published in reputable medical journals (e.g., The Lancet, JAMA, NEJM). In the event of conflicting results, the consensus of the majority of the studies will be considered. Temporary or trial deployments do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the employment rate for software developers increase according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the employment rate for software developers, as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), shows an increase compared to the rate reported for the year 2023.

The employment rate is defined as the percentage of software developers employed out of the total number of software developers in the labor force. The BLS's annual report on employment statistics will be the authoritative source for this information.

In the event that the BLS changes its reporting methodology or classification of software developers, the most comparable data available will be used to determine the outcome.

If the BLS ceases to publish employment statistics for software developers, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any major technology company, such as Microsoft, be involved in an election-related controversy by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, any major technology company (e.g., Microsoft, Google, Facebook, Amazon, Apple) is publicly involved in an election-related controversy. A 'major technology company' is defined as a company with a market capitalization of at least $100 billion USD as of January 1, 2028. An 'election-related controversy' is defined as a significant public dispute or scandal directly involving the company's actions or products in the context of any official election process (local, state, or national) in any country. This includes, but is not limited to, allegations of misinformation, data breaches, manipulation of election-related information, or undue influence on the election outcome. The controversy must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the absence of such reports, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major Republican Party (US) figure endorse a significant AI policy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major figure within the Republican Party (US) publicly endorses a significant AI policy. For the purposes of this question, the following definitions apply:

- Major figure: An individual who holds or has held a prominent elected or appointed position within the Republican Party, such as a current or former President, Vice President, Senator, Representative, Cabinet member, or Governor.
- Significant AI policy: A policy that addresses substantial aspects of artificial intelligence, including but not limited to regulation, funding, research initiatives, ethical guidelines, or national strategy.

The endorsement must be made through an official public statement, such as a speech, press release, or social media post, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg).

title: Will AI be used to discover a new exoplanet by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an artificial intelligence (AI) system is credited with the discovery of a new exoplanet. The discovery must meet the following criteria:

- The AI system must be explicitly acknowledged as having played a critical role in the discovery process, either through data analysis, pattern recognition, or another significant contribution.
- The discovery must be confirmed by at least one reputable astronomical organization, such as NASA, ESA, or an equivalent body.
- The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a major astronomical conference.

In the event of a simultaneous discovery by AI and human researchers, the question will resolve as Yes if the AI's contribution is recognized as critical by the confirming organization. The exoplanet must not have been previously cataloged or known to the scientific community.

title: Will the US Congress pass a major funding bill for natural sciences research by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the United States Congress passes a bill that allocates at least $10 billion in new funding specifically for natural sciences research.

The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States. The funding must be earmarked for research in natural sciences, which include but are not limited to physics, chemistry, earth sciences, and biology.

The passage of the bill must be confirmed by official government sources, such as the Congressional Record or an official press release from Congress or the President. In the absence of such confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient.

If multiple bills are passed that collectively meet the $10 billion threshold, this question will resolve as Yes. If a bill includes funding for other areas but at least $10 billion is specifically allocated for natural sciences research, it will also resolve as Yes.

title: Will AI-driven technologies be used in the reconstruction efforts in Ukraine by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, AI-driven technologies are officially utilized in the reconstruction efforts in Ukraine. These technologies must be involved in significant reconstruction activities such as infrastructure rebuilding, urban planning, or resource allocation. The deployment must be confirmed by an official government announcement from Ukraine or recognized international bodies (e.g., United Nations, European Union). In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The technologies must be operational and not merely in the planning or trial phase. Temporary or minor uses of AI-driven technologies do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will AI discover a new chemical element or compound by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, an artificial intelligence (AI) system is credited with the discovery of a new chemical element or compound that meets the following criteria:

- The discovery must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- The AI system must be acknowledged as the primary discoverer in the publication, either through direct authorship or explicit recognition by the human authors.
- The new element must be recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) if it is an element, or the new compound must be recognized by a relevant authoritative body in the field of chemistry.

The discovery must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources, such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, or similar. In case of simultaneous discoveries, the resolution will be based on the earliest publication date.

title: Will a major political party in the US use DeepMind technology for campaign strategy by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a major political party in the United States (defined as the Democratic Party or the Republican Party) officially uses DeepMind technology for any aspect of their campaign strategy. 

"DeepMind technology" refers to any machine learning or artificial intelligence technology developed by DeepMind Technologies. 

The use must be confirmed by an official announcement from the political party or DeepMind, or through credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg). 

The question will resolve as No if no such use is confirmed by the resolution date.

title: Will a new political party win a majority in any national election by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a political party that did not exist prior to January 1, 2024, wins a majority of seats in the national legislature or equivalent governing body in any country.

A "majority" is defined as more than 50% of the available seats. The election must be recognized as free and fair by international observers, such as the United Nations or the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE).

Official election results must be reported by reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In case of disputes or recounts, the final certified results will be used for resolution.

If no election meets these criteria by the resolution date, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US establish a new branch of the military focused on aerospace engineering by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, the United States establishes a new branch of the military specifically focused on aerospace engineering. The establishment must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The branch must be distinct from existing branches and have a clear mandate focused on aerospace engineering. Temporary task forces or rebranding of existing units do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI system that significantly influences any national election outcome by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, there is credible evidence that an AI system developed by DeepMind significantly influenced the outcome of any national election.

"Significantly influences" means that the AI system's actions or outputs directly affected the election results in a measurable way, such as altering voter behavior, changing the outcome in favor of a particular candidate or party, or being cited as a critical factor in the election's final result.

Credible evidence includes:
- Official statements from electoral bodies or government agencies confirming the AI system's influence.
- Investigative reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, Bloomberg) that independently verify the AI system's impact.
- Peer-reviewed studies or authoritative analyses that attribute significant electoral influence to the AI system.

This question resolves as NO if no such evidence is available by the resolution date.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US rule on a significant case involving quantum computing by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling on a case that significantly involves quantum computing technology.

For the purposes of this question, a "significant case" is defined as one where the primary subject matter involves the legal implications, regulations, or consequences of quantum computing technology. This includes but is not limited to cases involving:
- Intellectual property disputes directly related to quantum computing technology.
- Privacy concerns specifically arising from the use of quantum computing.
- Regulatory challenges or compliance issues directly associated with quantum computing.

The ruling must be documented in official Supreme Court records and reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., New York Times, Washington Post, BBC, The Guardian, Reuters).

title: Will there be a significant election-related event in Ukraine before 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, any of the following significant election-related events occur in Ukraine:

- Presidential Election: An official presidential election is held.
- Parliamentary Election: An official parliamentary election is held.
- Referendum: A national referendum is conducted on a significant issue.
- Major Electoral Reform: The Ukrainian government enacts and implements a major electoral reform, such as changes to the electoral system or significant amendments to election laws.

The event must be confirmed by an official announcement from the Ukrainian government or verified by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

In case of ambiguity or dispute, the resolution will be based on the consensus of reputable sources.

title: Will Virginia elect a Democratic governor in the 2028 election?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate from the Democratic Party is officially elected as the Governor of Virginia in the 2028 election.

The election results must be confirmed by the Virginia Department of Elections. In the event of a dispute or recount, the question will resolve based on the final certified result.

If the election is annulled or postponed beyond December 31, 2028, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new aerospace policy be implemented in the US by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, a new aerospace policy is officially implemented in the United States. The policy must be a federal regulation or law specifically related to aerospace activities, including but not limited to space exploration, commercial spaceflight, aviation safety, or aerospace research and development. The implementation must be confirmed by an official government announcement, such as a press release from the White House, NASA, FAA, or other relevant federal agencies. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The policy must be in effect and not merely proposed or under discussion. Temporary measures or pilot programs do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will computing technologies play a crucial role in combating COVID-19 by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, computing technologies are recognized as having played a crucial role in combating COVID-19 through any of the following means:

- Development of vaccines or treatments: Computing technologies significantly contributed to the development, testing, or distribution of COVID-19 vaccines or treatments. This contribution must be acknowledged by reputable sources such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
- Public health response: Computing technologies were integral to public health responses, such as through contact tracing, predictive modeling, or the management of healthcare resources. This impact must be documented by at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).
- Research and data analysis: Computing technologies played a key role in COVID-19 research or data analysis, leading to significant advancements in understanding or managing the disease. This must be supported by publications in peer-reviewed scientific journals.

If no such recognition or documentation is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.
